Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: Tam13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a period of 7 days in September. Upon check in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade the room for an extra $50 AUD per day, we declined but the lady at the front desk was quite persistent. We declined again - and then she gave us the upgraded room anyway, I think this is because they had in fact already arranged the cot we requested for ou son into this upgraded room. As such we got the upgraded room at no extra cost. The staff at check in were quite hopeless at putting a hold on our credit card, and managed to put three - yes 3! - different holds on the card. I brought this to their attention on the 2 nd day which they disagreed with and I had to how my Internet banking to prove this. This took almost 3 days to rectify. The daily charge for wifi in the rooms is ludicrous, as is the cost for laundry. As others have noted the pool still isn't available for use. Breakfast buffet was ok, good selection of foods however many were not kept hot enough for my liking. Daily we had to ask the staff for coffee cups and coffee. On 2 occasions we were also missing some cutlery from our table. Checkout was 12pm, about 10 minutes before this a staff member came to remind us to check out, as were already vetting luggag not the hallway this was no issue. When we got to the lobby the clerk advised that we had a late checkout until 4pm! No one had ever advised us of this, and it would have been useful to know especially with our young child who was due for a nap. As we had already packed and exited the room we went to the lobby lounge for a snack and drink. The prices are out of this world! It would be cheaper to get a taxi to Times Square and eat a a restaurant! We were also told hat all snacks had a minimum 30minute wait as the kitchen wasn't ready, even though the menus stated snacks from 12pm. Overall this hotel was a huge disappointment. Door staff were very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Hong kong!”
Reviews.Author: DawesFamily
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to Hong Kong we (wife and 14 year old son) stayed here from 24 Aug - 8 September as part of a package organised by Kenwood Travel of London (who were amazing!). We had an wonderful time - check-in was seamless and we were upgraded to a Premier Harbour view room on the 29th floor WOW what a room and a view!! My son had a roll out bed which was fine and there was a curtain which separated the lounge area from the beds so we all had some privacy. Bathroom was huge with an amazing shower! View across the harbour was stunning. The room was cleaned daily and free bottles of water each day was a nice touch. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and couldn't have done more for us. The location is great - (ignore the road of small car lots, they are really quite quaint - I guess that why it's called Oil Street, but they should not put you off) It's a few minutes walk to the MTR or Tram and busses stop outside the MTR for Stanley Market which is handy! The Hotel shuttle was great friendly driver and we used this on a few occasions. The breakfast we had on 5 days as part of our deal (we were room only) and was truly scrumptious! We did use the hotel pool at the sister hotel once and this was no problem at all - I just got a receipt for each journey and this was paid back immediately by reception - really easy! We will definitely stay here again and genuinely think this is one of the best hotels in HK and we have stayed in a few but mostly in Kowloon. Our departure was equally as seamless and throughout our stay we were made to feel like really special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Palce to stay on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: mamachompkin
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself enjoyed our three night stay at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong. The rooms were very comfortable and clean but slightly small. The only gripe I had was that the room service did not clear away dirty cups or glasses even after the maid had serviced the rooms. The breakfast was fine though I thought quite expensive for what you got. Room service was very efficient and all staff were very attentive. The hotel is conveniently located about 2 minutes walk from the Metro station. If you are coming from the airport on the train and metro, do be prepared to lug your suitcases up some stairs in the Metro station. There are numerous restaurants along the side roads near the hotel and at least two Starbucks nearby. The area is mixed from automotive part shops to fine dining. The only thing I did not like was that the rather tatty local garage next door did oil changes straight into the storm drain... and no doubt into the Hong Kong Harbour. Clearly the Hong Kong Authorities do not have the same regulations about pollution as one would hope.

Reviews.Title: “not sure it's worth paying the extra”
Reviews.Author: sandy_sandroad
Reviews.Content: we had already booked the club floor thinking that would give us a good room. Check in was late in the evening so we were tired, then they hit you up for another upgrade to a slightly larger room with a better view. By this time on the trip you're so tired you'll agree to almost anything just to get a bed., so we paid, $35 US a night more. The view is fantastic , only problem you need to sit on the bed to see it as the sofa faces a wall. Their club lounge was closed for repairs so you get put into the dining room , view is great but the chairs are awful, food is pretty average. The pool is closed has been for a while so for kids there's not much to keep them occupied. If you're a coffee lover, they don't have coffee makers in the rooms, only instant, Starbucks is around the corner but they dont open until 7am. You could get roomservice at $8 US a cup. They also charge $20 day for the Internet this is a complete rip off. It's free in a couple of areas in the hotel but there is limited seating. best bet go to Starbux or McDonalds it's free. Would we recommend this hotel, only for the view, you can do better in other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparksyUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous and the staff couldn't be more helpful. We had a club room with harbour views. Those staying in club rooms get free cocktails between 6-8 which were excellent. The views of the harbour from the club restaurant (currently level 41) are breathtaking. We had a late check out which meant we could go out for the day and return to our room to have a shower before heading to the airport (they even gave us fresh towels and toiletries after our morning shower). The location is perfect, 2 min walk to Fortress Hill MTR which is a few stops from Central and costs HK$5 for a single trip! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business stays”
Reviews.Author: Travellator10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbour Grand for a conference for 3 nights in August. The company had booked the basic category of rooms but I was upgraded to a Deluxe harbour room which had a lovely view of the harbour. Rooms are decent sized with a good sized bathroom. Some of the rooms even have a microwave and a small sink. Mine didn't but some of my colleagues' rooms did, though I was surprised that its not consistent. The MTR is within walking distance and even though the area doesn't look very appealing, it was not a problem walking there at night. The service is quite good. We had a lunch at the 188* restaurant and the views there are absolutely spectacular. The food was quite good as well and the presentation was lovely. All in all, a very good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel luxury”
Reviews.Author: jollygilly
Reviews.Content: great hotel - clean and well presented. Staff are very friendly and helpfull. Bathrooms are huge. We had a room with a harbour view - excellent. There's a metro station less than 4 minutes from hotel; if not, the hotel runs a 30 minute shuttle to main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krishna C
Reviews.Content: A luxurious Hotel with a good view. Rooms are comfortable and the Bathrooms are Big. Buffet is Huge variety with many options for vegetarian. There is a nice place to walk behind the Hotel. The Hotel is a little far from the main attractions. But, the hotel has a free shuttle service every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kourky
Reviews.Content: Can not fault this hotel ... The staff are excellent food great and the hotel in within easy access to all local landmarks twelve types of pillows alone to choose from Rooms looking out on the harbour are great views to waken up to

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: DStran12
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 night stay at this hotel during a work conference and I was extremely pleased with the choice. The foyer of the hotel is quite remarkable with a grand entrance leading to the reception area. The rooms are very comfortable and well maintained and the bathrooms are both luxurious with plenty of room. Although this hotel is located in a high traffic area close to busy highway, we were not affected by any noise. Just make sure you have a room which faces Victoria Harbour as the views are quite spectacular. For dining the hotel has a few choices. The Harbour grand café offers banquets style feasts with hot and cold varieties for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is also the Le 188 dining room which offers sophisticated dining with panoramic views of the Hong Kong skyline with floor to ceiling windows on three sides of the dining room. There is also live entertainment and this is the perfect experience for the true romantics out there. Attached to this dining room is an outside terrace area where you can sit and enjoy a drink or cocktail in the warm Hong Kong weather. The service is absolutely flawless and I commend all the staff on their warm nature and impeccable service. The restaurants are abundantly staffed so it feels you never wait long for (we measured that the longest time for a plate to be cleared in the café was about 25 seconds!). The hotel is a short walk to the Fortress Hill MTR station and the area itself has a very local feel which many small shop front stores, numerous mechanics and unrepaired streets. There is also an abandoned building complex directly opposite the hotel but this added to the feel of Hong Kong with both the modern and also dated parts of the city. A great hotel in a location with easy access to other areas of Hong Kong. Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff are the stars here.”
Reviews.Author: estravellerBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay in this hotel and were impressed by the staff. They work hard and are always keen to help. Probably by way of compensation for the swimming pool being out of action, we were upgraded to a club room on floor 40 which gave us good views of the Harbour along the Hong Kong island shoreline and all the current building work. Surprisingly the room was small, lacked storage space and showed signs of wear and tear - we had to lift a unit door back into position each time after it was opened. A free bowl of fruit was provided. Uniquely the bathroom was situated within a glass panelled section of the room, without lowering the blind - all activity would be on full view !!! Bathroom facilities were very good - the shower especially so. Cleaning was good but not perfect, there was an accumulation of dust behind the room door and in another corner of the room. All used toiletries were readily replaced but guests were not permitted to make use of the room fridge which unreasonable bearing in mind the weather. We used the breakfast buffet - an excellent selection but rather pricey we felt. The hotel is situated close to an MTR station, which was very handy as we used the system a great deal, and taxis were readily available. There is a definite dicotamy at play here though. The hotel in all its marble covered air-conditioned oppulence sits in the middle of a working neighbourhood. Just a stone's throw from the front entrance a local garage operates a repair and maintenance service on the kerb side which must be negotiated en-route to the MTR ! Overall this is a good hotel with excellent staff, but left me with a sense that a focus on replacing the ageing bedroom furnishings is due.

Reviews.Title: “good quality”
Reviews.Author: HWWT
Reviews.Content: good quality hotel. staff very helpful - nothing too much trouble. humungous foyer lavishly decored with marble, complete with classy touch of a harpist!! decore in room classic. not new but in v'good cond. immaculate. NO MILDEW which is excellent for hong kong!! HOORAY!! no toxic smelling carpets like some hotels have now. HOORAY!! 29th floor = no noise from outside, irrespective of construction nearby. shuttle bus to shops/office free and regular. bed king, but a bit firm, but ok. shower heads fabbo. view of harbour nice/interesting to watch - shame about the polluted skies on some days. ate dinner at the buffet and had low expectations but were happily surprised. quality was good. fresh and great variety to suit all tastes. breakfast buffet also excellent and catered for all. cons = air cond finicky - too cold, or too stuffy. no cotton blanket on bed which i like with a quilt. and no movie channel. dvd player, but no dvds!! and, fire alarm went off at 2:00am, and it was so quiet it didn't wake me, but, did wake my light-sleeping partner, which was a bit scary considering the recent fire problem. there was no announcement to say that it was a false alarm. and no form of aplogy next day. all in all, i'd def. stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: BristolTookie
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 nights at Harbour Grand. We had gone for a Convention and holiday. There were 8 of us, 3 generations, in 3 adjoining rooms. We were upgraded to a Premium room on 29th floor to make up for lack of swimming pool but they also provided free taxis to their sister hotel nearby which had a good pool. Room very large, bathroom luxurious. Could have done with more storage and another towel rail. Also not nearly enough seating in the lobby. I had damaged my back prior to going and was often desperate to sit down whilst waiting for other members of party. Situation was fine for us, it felt as though we were in the middle of actual life! Used taxis, which were dirt cheap, also MTR was just minutes away. The most outstanding thing was the staff who were absolutely lovely and so eager to help. Concierge always ready with advice, taxis called immediately. Lovely staff in the main buffet restaurant. Our breakfast was included and was very good. Evening meals expensive, but it would be the same in any big city. Special mention to Eva, our chambermaid, who was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Grand - Excllent”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, service and food. Concierge very helpful. Bar on 41 st floor with superb view of harbour. Pool not functioning when we stayed which was a bit annoying and the fire alarm went off at 2am but was a false alarm. Would revisit.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms in a good local neighborhood - not as touristy”
Reviews.Author: Jennybko
Reviews.Content: The rooms were unusually spacious for a hotel in HK. Concierge and front desk were also quite courteous.. both a bit unusual for HK. The view from our bed was awesome. Although there was a cyclone, and dark clouds, the view of the HK harbor and the Kowloon side was beautiful. The neighborhood is more local with quaint womens boutiques. There are quite a number of groceries like welcomme and park and shop. The MTR station is just 1 block away.. very convenient. A few negative things : ( 1.)that we have to pass a row of really unattractive car shops, and car part stores before getting to the nicer main avenue and MTR station. ( 2 ) the MTR station is fortress hill, which is quite a ride from the main areas like central or tsim sha tsui. But, I would say this is a good hotel, if you want a view, more space, better service but dont mind being away from the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay but not blown away.”
Reviews.Author: Andy W
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general was good. The breakfast was good but try and get there before 930am as the last 30 minutes does not have much choice. The only downfall of this hotel is no free wi-fi. In most hotels today you do get free wi-fi at least in the lobby. The internet was fairly expensive so we relied on wifi downtown. There was a shuttle bus that left the hotel every 30 minutes for down town which was good but spaces on the bus were limited. Overall this hotel is very good, but maybe next time I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina A
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the elegance, design and overall beauty of this hotel... in the lobby a harpist plays with a waterfall behind her! The views over the harbour from the bars/ restaurants and rooms were breathtaking. The staff were very polite and helpful. Shame the pool was shut indefinately. First class place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel tops the scale! What an awesome find”
Reviews.Author: travelyun
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel in a city that is flooded with mediocre hotels. We travel to HK at least once a year for holidays for the last 12 years, and this is the first time I stayed in a hotel that I loved every moment of it. We booked a superior room but was upgraded to premier, which contributed to the very pleasant stay. We were on 27th floor, quite high up but just below the club floor. The room was massive by a lot of countries standards - it was 35 square metre, with a super king bed, a couch, a desk, a TV unit, some surface for luggage (underneath is mini fridge), a big wardrobe, a massive bathroom with a round bath, and they also squeeze in a rollaway bed for my 5 year old. We stayed for 5 nights and didn't feel cramped at all. Room itself is of very modern decor and tastefully decorated. This is a very new hotel, around 4 years old, 5 star. There's a lot of details to how they have furnished the place. Everything works too, perfectly. Plenty of hot water, great pressure, there are even two showers, one the usual type and one from the ceiling! Bathroom is very very nice. View itself is a very rare find in HK. We have panoramic view of Victoria Harbour, I have to say I have never had such a view from my hotel room before. At night it's amazing with all the lights, and during a clear day you could see miles. Slight downside is that there's a construction site outside at the moment that finishes work at about 5pm, starts at probably 8-9am, which could be quite a pain if you stay in hotel during the day. We were out every day so this wasn't a problem. Otherwise there was no traffic noise at night and we slept really well each night. Staff - I have to comment on the staff. I am not usually too concerned if staff is bad - after all I just want a nice hotel that I could stay in. But staff here is excellent - totally contrary to the two previous comments before mine. I really don't get where these people were coming from - every staff I talked to had been very willing to help, they all had a big smile when they saw us. CHeck in and check out were both super efficient. They helped us to carry our luggages to the airport express shuttle. They opened the door for us EVERY time. Every time I rang Concerige to ask for some directions/timetable/shopping info they were helpful - if they couldn't help straight away they offered to ring back in 5 minutes. The only night that we had some problem with the neightbour (it was a wedding party), I rang, and they sent someone up straight away cos the noise was gone after 10 minutes. We were also recommended to a nearby restaurant for dim sum/yum char - and it's so good that we went back 3 times! Location wise, this is the only aspect I've given 4 star instead of five. That's because its about 3-5 minutes walk from Fortress Hill, a MTR station that is slightly out of the way (two stops to Causeway Bay that has a lot of shopping/eating). To get to the hotel from the MTR, you need to cross a very busy street and then a couple more little side streets, one of which is lined with car servicing shops, which could be slightly off putting. We usually stay in City View Hotel in Yau Ma Tei, which is very central location, but boy that hotel just cannot compare! So even the location isn't as good, we still think this is a hotel that is far more superior in every other way. My husband said the only downside he could think of is that the pool was closed during summer. This has been quite disappointing as we took our togs and wished to have a dip at the end of a hot summer day. Maintenance should be done during winter months surely? Despite that, we will be back to this hotel. My friend also stayed here with her mum and son and they had the superior room (31 square metre) and it still seemed pretty good to us. We are not going to go back to Cityview any more!

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Patrizio D
Reviews.Content: Hotel with staff very unkind. If you have any problem, forget to ask help to the staff to solve it. They will smile and say:" I am sorry. Cannot help you". Big Hotel in North Point, many people as staff but not efficient at all. For sure I will not come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location and ordinary service”
Reviews.Author: Lalala1111
Reviews.Content: The standard room is extremely small, do upgrade one room category to get the amazing round bath tub. Location - horrible for two reasons 1. Currently a worksite directly across the road for the new cruise terminal, this will go on for some time. Was awoken at 7am by this work site that goes 14 hour days 7 days a week. 2. Almost impossible to find a taxi in Kowloon that will take you there in peak traffic. I sat in 4 before one agreed to do the journey, this is because the meters run on kilometers travelled and not trip time. Service - lots of staff, however they are not very willing to assist and choose to stand in clusters and avoid eye contact with you. Lots of school trips there and conference groups etc, can make for alot of noise whilst they assemble in the Lobby for outings etc. Massive lobby and check in desks, the set up is correct, staff performance is questionable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel around North Point”
Reviews.Author: KahongLam
Reviews.Content: It's my 2nd time staying at this hotel. Always impress by the high level of service provided. Friendly staffs, great room with great view on Victoria Harbour (They even let you to choose your pillow of choice) and just a 3-5 minutes walk from the nearest MTR station 'Fotress Hill'. However, since the location itself (North Point) is a bit far (not walking distance) to others attraction places like Causeway Bay, I'd only recommend this hotel if you are coming here for business purpose and your office is around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but the pool is too cold!”
Reviews.Author: Divetravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Harbour Grand hotel on Hong Kong island at Easter 2012. We had a pleasant stay. It's a pricy hotel, but you get value for it. We are airline staff and they do give industry discounted prices for a room. Just write to the hotel and ask for it. The location: from the metro station Fortress Hill, it's a 5 minutes walk. The hotel is a bit hidden, but it's right on the boulevard. This boulevard is currently (april) under construction and there's a highway between the boulevard and the hotel. It would be a good idea to build a bridge or so over the highway for easy access, but I'm sure something like this should be part of the reconstruction plan already. We can't tell about the kitchen, as we didn't use it. There's many cheap breakfast options in the surrounding streets, which is a good option to save some money here. We used the bar on the top floor though. It is recommended to have at least one drink here at night to enjoy the spectacular view over Hong Kong harbour. The room is luxury, with good beds and a good bathroom. Be sure to book a room with harbour view on the higher floors! At night you can enjoy the wonderful Hong Kong light show from your own room. The only slightly disappointing issue was the pool... The reason why we chose this hotel out of many options was the pool, to be able to relax a little bit after a long touristic day in Hong Kong. But the water temperature was only 21 degr C.... Not inviting to stay in for longer than 5-10 minutes, despite the nice setting. That is too cold for a pool in a 5* star hotel, I would recommend to heat up the pool to a 27 degr C temperature year-round. Luckily they have a sauna and steam bath as well, so you can warm up afterwards. Overal: we had a nice stay here, but there are many good options in Hong Kong. We might try out another hotel next time :-) Wendy and Paul, the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: WeFollowBaseball
Reviews.Content: Service, service, top notch service! They treated us like royalty. We stayed on the club floor. I would highly recommend the upgrade. The service is worth it. The staff was super nice and helpful. Most hotels can give you a great room, nice furnishings, etc. Only a few can back that all up with service. Truthfully, that's what separates a 5 star and 3 star hotel. The Harbour Grand is 5 stars and then some. They have it all. And to comment on the area, there are service stations on your way to the MTR (3 blocks). Totally safe, actually neat to see true HK culture. We had a good time in HK, never met a single rude person there. If we return, we will stay here again, we were truly impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for kiwis visiting Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi-Freds
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very good service. Room had a great Harbour view. Only a minute walk to the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: mcveigh128
Reviews.Content: These are my experiences and thoughts about his hotel. Pros Location is perfect in my opinion, mtr underground station is only 5min walk away and is very easy to use. 55 hk dollar, about £5 gets a tourist pass and you see whole city. Check in smooth and friendly stayed on 31st floor, great view, fast lifts, staff were always pleasant Cons Broadband wifi in hotel is complete rip of at 130 hk dollar per 24 hours and is very slow. most public area in hong kong have free wifi and the burger king 2 mins away has free and fast. Food in hotel is very expensive at 611 hk dollar about £60 for lunch buffet for 2 and was only ok in my opinion. City is safe and very clean. Top tip do the 360 to the budda

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this hotel with my family. We had booked 2 Deluxe Harbour View rooms. My requests of being on the highest floor (Level 40, which is a harbour club floor) and having interconnected rooms were fulfilled. The hotel is modern and new. Although it is located adjacent to car repair shops in North Point, there are a plethora of cafes, restaurants, fruit/vegetable grocery stores, convenience stores and small shops nearby. The MTR (underground subway) station (Fortress Hill) is also a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Tsim Tsa Tsui, Admiralty, Central, Wan Chai and Causeway Bay are all within a 3-15 minute train ride away (2-5 stops). Upon arrival, the service provided by the concierge staff was excellent: they helped me unload my luggage and quickly brought them up to my rooms. The lobby was very spacious, well-lit and welcoming. The marble front desk was impressive. Check-in was efficient. My rooms were very well appointed, clean and were furnished with some unique features, such as a printer (complimentary) and an electronically-controlled blind/curtain that could be raised and lowered for privacy purposes in the toilet/bathroom. Housekeeping was generous with the amenities, re-supplying disposable slippers, body lotion, shampoos, combs, toothbrushes, tea/coffee etc. daily. There was also quite an extensive pillow menu. Shoe shining was complimentary. My room had a nice harbour view from my room but I would have preferred a more 'landscape' view. The hotel provides complimentary bus shuttle services to Causeway Bay every hour and various other places. On Level 41, there is a nice restaurant/bar and the Harbour Club. There is also a buffet lunch/dinner, a Japanese Restaurant, Lobby Lounge and fitness centre in the hotel. However, I have two small issues with the hotel. Firstly, the Internet costs HKD130/day for one device. I was lucky because from my room on Level 40, I could access wi-fi from the Level 41 Harbour Club. Secondly, my request for an English and Chinese newspaper to be delivered to my rooms daily were received with a sense of surprise. After putting down my request, the front desk called me to ask whether this was what I had wanted as if it was something extraordinary. This was quite bizarre given that complimentary newspaper is standard in 4-5 star hotels Having said that, the hotel fulfilled all my requests (including the newspaper one) such as extra towels, more soap and tea bags were fulfilled very promptly, usually within 5 minutes. I found the service therefore exemplary. I highly recommend this hotel. It is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manav D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 7-8 times during multiple business trips to HK and the service/epxerience was very consistent each trip. Neat and clean rooms with amazing views of Victoria Harbour, spacious and pleasant lobby area and good morning breakfast spread. Also had a very nice rooftop bar/restaurant with great views of HK. Location is a bit off Central/Causeway Bay but MTR is only a 5 min walk away. Staff are very courteous and helpful too. Overall, I've had a pleasant experience during each stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool staff...”
Reviews.Author: web_spider24
Reviews.Content: Great service but it just doesn't give us enough courtesy. They gave us hope before but due to fire accident has made me change my mind of the hotel! All the staff were nice but there was a staff that gave really bad image which was called Kei. She said she was a trainee! But I don't care if she was a trainee or not when she's on a piece of uniform, professionalism is the most important!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julesski
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a Harbour club room with great view. The rooms were well appointed with a large bath and all the usual mod cons. Breakfast was good and served on the 41st floor with great view, free tea and coffee almost all day and "afternoon tea"/light refreshments in the afternoon and drinks and nibbles 6pm - 8pm - all complimentary if you go for the Harbour club rooms (you should!) The staff were very attentive and friendly without exception. Located near to the Fortress Hill MTR and placed so that you have views over both HK Harbour and Kowloon, (almost 180 view from the restaurant area on the 41st floor). There are a few very small and "interesting" car repair shops between the hotel and MTR but at no time does the area feel unsafe in anyway. A free hotel shuttle will take you to Central station to catch the "Airport Express" train which is an easy way to start your journey onwards. The only slight complaint was that the pool was unavailable and we were not advised until we checked in and the 41st floor was unavailable to us the first night of our stay, due to a "private function". A very enjoyable stay and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Jervis S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July. If you do not mind being sandwiched in between car maintenance shops and building sights the location is fine with great views of Hong Kong from the higher floors. Having been told that the room had been upgraded from a Grand Deluxe Harbour view room I was expecting something a little more spacious than what it was. The bathroom is not the smartest design i have ever come across and for the less mobile climbing into the bath/shower would be a little hazardous. Room rates were reasonable though, but i would put this down to the odd location and the lack of facilities since the fire. I cannot comment on the restaurant facilities as there are so many good eating spots in HK a hotel is the last place to bother eating. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and I could not find a major reason to fault the hotel itself, but in future i would probably stay closer to Central/Wan Chai.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: sfulleylove
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Harbour Grand to start off our honeymoon and were very well treated. The room we stayed in was a Premium Harbour view room and was a typical medium sized room for a large city. A good breakfast, clean facilities everywhere and proximity to the underground made it a good base for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: happyhappychiu
Reviews.Content: Recently, we choose to stay at this hotel for its rating and pool amenity. It was only disappointing upon arrival and found the pool was under construction due to a fire a month ago. Shouldn't this be posted on their website as a head up to clients leaving them an option? After complaints to the manager, he was very willingly to offer an upgrade to our rooms. Of course, this replacement was not exactly as importance as a pool, but I am happy to see that they do value client's opinions and shown it s importance to satisfy a customer like me. , definiately willl stay here again, It's a beautiful hotel overall.Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..Freindly staff...easily accessible..”
Reviews.Author: Shilpankaj
Reviews.Content: It was a comfortable experience from the time we stepped out of the airport....hotel staff at airport was courteous and as we missed the bus timing, they were prompt in making arrangements for cab....checking and check out at hotel is smooth....concierge service is excellent and the staff is very helpful in terms of planning your day, how you should travel and sequence of events etc....we spent 5 days at the hotel and the property played an important part in making our stay memorable....

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: jhanki
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view from the room. Bed was super comfortable. Too bad the pool was under repair when we went, I was able to use their gym though. Location wise, it was convenient, a quick 2 minute walk to Fortress MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at the harbour grand hong kong and found it a very good hotel. Only down side was the lack of their swimming poo. (down for maintenance) although never saw anyone working on it for the seven days we were there. Brilliant room overlooking the harbour, could watch the light show from room every night. One bonus we were there for the 15th year of Chinese rule and they had a 25 min spectacular firework display in the harbour. Watched from room. There are major building works going on outside but that did not disturb us. It was quite fascinating watching the to-ing and fro-ing of the lorries on the site. ( I know I'm a sad person). Staff could not do enough for you, never touched the front door once, and if they could beat you to the lift they would press the call button. Overall a good stay at a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBha
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here during our honeymoon and were absolutley delighted with the hotel, location and service. Located only 5 mins walk from the Fortress Hill MTR. The hotel is very clean and modern. The staff were very helpful and helped us with the local attractions to see. The 188 restuarant is fantastic with wonderful view of the harbour and kowloon. The room was lovely and champagne was sent to the room due to it being our honeymoon. Overall a fantastic hotel in a very good location. Highly recommended to anyone who travels to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Excellent Value-Ignore comments about location”
Reviews.Author: Hunterstrystjambo
Reviews.Content: I joined my wife who was working in Hong Kong for 10 nights. Having carried out a lot of research we settled on the HG on the basis of reviews, cost and location. The hotel is in Oil Street a 2 minute walk from Fortress Hill MTR station which is 10 minutes from Admiralty/Central in the heart of Hong Kong Island. Buy an octupass card and fly around Hong Kong like a local on the MTR. Ignore comments about location. To stay in a 5 Star hotel in HK just 10 minutes from the heart of the action for just over a £100 per night is amazing. Yes you may want to be closer but expect to double the cost; but is 10 minutes on the MTR such a hardship. The hotel has a number of food chain outlets around-starbucks, subway. Burger King, MacDonalds, Olivers-HK sandwich chain as well as a number of up and comng outlets. Massive marble recption is stunning with huge chandelier, harpist and lots of well trained staff on hand to help. Our room was on the 15th floor with superb views of Victoria Harbour and the HK skyline. The room had a massive double bed, separate seating area and a suberb bathroom. Fabulous sunken bath with superb drenching shower. Bathroom had window looking into seating area but had an electric privacy blind if required. Hotel had complimentary bus service to Admiralty and Hong Kong Station, where the Airport Express departs from. Our gripes were:- -outdoor pool out of action although we had access to sister hotel. Harbour Plaza with hotel paying for taxi there and back; -wi fi pricey but this was offered free as we were unhappy about the pool being out of action; -food and drinks expensive

Reviews.Title: “Luxury by the Harbourside”
Reviews.Author: LABarbs
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in the Harbour Grand HK is in the Club Floors. We stayed in Harbour Club De Luxe Room for 2 nights with my daughter. We have a perfect view of Victoria Harbour from our room. Plus exclusive access to the Harbour Club Lounge for breakfast, afternoon snacks, evening cocktails and exclusive concierge services.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, great service”
Reviews.Author: Tarun71
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand is a very good property with great views and very well appointed rooms. Their breakfast is excellent and the service is very warm. Only one shortcoming - there are very few eateries that you can walk to and practically no shopping within walking distance. Having said that, it is located barely 5 minutes from the metro station and offers very good access everywhere. As a business hotel, it would be fantastic. As a leisure hotel, I would rate it lower. The concierge is especially warm and helpful. Overall, it was a happy experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “At par”
Reviews.Author: Jisan
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 7 nights for a business. The hotel has a grand entrance. A spacious lobby with beautiful chandeliers complemented by royal chairs! The hotel staff is courteous and friendly. The checkin process is a breeze. One thing i did not liked is that I'd to change my duration of stay due to change in plan. The hotel did not allow any changes in booking as it was booked online. I found it quite weird. Also, The online rates of the rooms are cheaper than what you get by directly booking at hotel!. I did not find the hotel location to be that convenient. It is close to CBD but you still need to take MTR to CBD. MTR station is at walkable distance. Breakfast and wifi plans are darn expensive. I did not bother to check it out. There are couple of Starbucks around for your service. You have a harbor view (facing Kowloon) from the rooms. I found all that needed in room. Currently the swimming pool is not working. Also, There is noise around the hotel due to civic construction across the road. Lounge at the top of the hotel provides the fantastic ambiance and harbor view. 4/5

Reviews.Title: “5 star - Harbour Grand Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JOHN_FNC
Reviews.Content: I am happy to offer 5 star to Harbour Grand Hong Kong. We just completed a conference with 100 delegates.We have booked 50 rooms with 3-4 days stay. The price was fantastic and the arrangement was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “New & nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soodye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last year and enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was very new and during our breakfast, the manager came to chat with us for our opinion. We mentioned that we stopped over in HK before continuing our honeymoon to Europe. So she nicely sent a bottle of champagne and card to our room in the evening, which we found very nice. Breakfast selection was really good, with free cappuccino (although not very good for fussy coffee drinker like me). The breakfast area has a good view to the harbor, so go there earlier to get a good seat. Subway is also very close to the hotel. Catching taxi from the hotel to popular shopping area was relatively cheap as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and awesome view at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: lazblue
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong for 2 nights at the beginning of June. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to the "Club" floor at no extra charge. The view of Hong Kong from our room was spectacular and we couldn't help stop looking out at the window. The amenities in the room was good (free bottles of water were provided) and the bed was comfortable, although free WI-FI is not available. If you have a smartphone, tip is to purchase a pre-paid SIM with mobile internet from Smartone or Three as they're well priced in HK. Concierge was very efficient and we were able to store our luggage with them after we checked out before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller0907
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of reviews before booking this hotel and wasn't disappointed at all. I booked a room onone of the club floors, which was excellent because it included breakfast, afternoon tea, pre-dinner drinks etc. and also access to the business club where you could check emails etc. The room was lovely with a view of one side of the harbour, we had two twin beds but there was still enough room to move around. There is no problem with the location. Sure it is in a street that had mechanic workshops, but there is a 7 Eleven two streets away and an ATM in the same street. Also, there are a couple of great little boutiques in this street which we weren't aware of and the staff are lovely and really appreciate you going in to have a look. We caught taxis and also used the MTR which was a breeze! Train travel is so cheap! The staff at the hotel were lovely. A couple on the 41st floor were a little abrupt, but Jan was exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. The beds were quite hard but housekeeping put an extra duvet over it and it softened it somewhat. It was a shame the pool was closed (you were able to go an use a sister hotel's pool, but it was a nuisance because you had to advise the staff that you wanted to go and use the other pool and then get a taxi over there which was supposed to take 5 minutes. but the traffic is pretty busy all the time so it would have probably taken 15-20 minutes, and then when you return show them your receipt and get reimbursed. By the time we got back after a day out, it was the last thing we felt like doing. Going downstairs in the lift to the third floor would have been much easier, and a swim after a hot day out would have been wonderful! Checking in and out was a breeze when you stay on the club floor because you do all this on the 41st floor, so it is very quick. We got a late check out which was fantastic because we had a late flight and were able to have a shower and freshen up later in the afternoon and then wait upstairs for our transport to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: 862mark
Reviews.Content: loved our stay here. the club room was outstanding & the staff were so friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacqLJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and upon arrival we upgraded to the Club room which was an excellent decision. Club room on 38th floor was well equipped (compact but sufficient) clean, well furnished and had all the things you could/would need plus a great view! The club lounge on the 41st floor was just great. Breakfast, tea and coffee all day, afternoon tea and alcoholic drinks 6-8pm and 5pm late check out on departure all included, all for approx. £60 extra per room, per night. Incredible value. Don't listen to reviews about the supposedly dodgy area, it is fine and a taxi in Central Hong Kong only costs about £4 so hardly an expensive ride! Alternatively there is the MTR close by which we didn't use as taxis were so cheap/accessible. Excellent gym, shame about the pool being out of action but to be honest there is so much to do in Hong Kong why would you sit by a pool!? All in all a fantastic hotel which I would not hesitate to use again. I have stayed at the Marriott right in the centre of Hong Kong and didn't find the Harbour Grand in any way inferior for being a few minutes further out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a convenient Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 3 times and really love it! We recently stayed for 9 nights and will come back again. The staff are amazing! So helpful and nothing is a hassle! Particularly in the Club Lounge. Leo, Hugues, Karen, and all others in the lounge always go above and beyond. We always opt for the Club lounge access as it is great value for what you get. Breakfast Buffet, afternoon tea, soft drinks and coffee all day, and cocktails between 6pm and 8pm each night. You also get complimentary Wifi in the lounge which we used regularly. Overall all a great hotel and easy access to the MTR. Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Complete indulgence!”
Reviews.Author: Ricnorthrocks
Reviews.Content: The only downside of this hotel is that we only stayed one night! On arrival we were asked if we wanted to upgrade, I'm so pleased we did! The room was stunning, free afternoon tea & drinks. You should do this. Hotel is located just a couple of minted away from MTR station so easy to get around. Would defiantly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: isspaul
Reviews.Content: Firstly use the airport direct train system in HK, and the shuttle bus to your hotel of staying here, so much easier than getting cabs, trust me!! (long story short we ended up at harbour grand Kowloon- our fault, then harbour plaza hong kong before finally reaching this place, cab drivers can be annoying! Anyway the hotel, lovely staff - the brilliantly named Kinki on reception was great and convinced us to upgrade to a suite on the 29th floor, seemed worth it as had an amazing room and great views of HK. As on honeymoon we got a lovely cake and bottle of fizz, which was great, the place was impeccable - stunning lobby and a 2 minute walk from Fortress Hill MTR station which gets you anywhere on HK island in 10-15 mins - buy an octopus card on arrival an the journeys work out at about 40p each - amazing! Overall a perfect HK hotel for me

Reviews.Title: “Wow it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and loved it the staff were great and we were upgraded to one of the top floor with use of all the extra facilities that came with them the bar on the top floor was breath taking and our free champagne topped it off. We will never forget this place the room was stunning and the view were fantastic. Can't wait to visit again xx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alyecat
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, the rooms are very clean and very comfortable. Staff are very helpful and the hotel has a gym and pool but pool was shut when I was there in Feb 12.Metro station is a 1min walk up the street and if want to eat out lots of places nearby but the food in the hotel was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really a 5 star hotel, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Luci_br
Reviews.Content: Everything here is superior. The room quality, bathroom, services. You have even the choice from the 12 pillows. Rain shower, electrical curtain in the shower. Everywhere smells the luxury. But, because there is a but, was the wrong timing to go to this hotel: 1. Pool is closed until further notice. You have the option to go to the sister hotel pools, but is not what I paied for. I wanted this pool. 2. During the night you can here an annoying sound form the electrical circuit or something near the door. Was really bad. 3. There is a construction and a demolition site nearby. They start the work at 8 AM sharp till forever. You cannot stay in the room, really. Is like hammering in your head. At least they are not working during the night. But don't stay too late, you have to wake up at 8 AM, even on saturday. And from what you can see on the window, they will not finish in the next month the demolition. I asked for a room on the other side of the hotel, but they said that the noise is the same.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Carbs29
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Harbour Grand Hotel Hong Kong. The hotel lobby is beautiful. When we arrived we could hear a harp playing, we originally thought it was coming from a speaker system. We were surprise when we actually realized that there was a women at the top of the stair case heading to the ballroom playing the harp, real nice touch. The lobby was clean, with a slight floral fragrance. We checked in, the front desk was courteous. There was a bank of elevators to the left of the lobby, they were a polish copper color, clean and quick, they also didnt have that jerking sensation on starts or stops. The room appeared small but it was very well layed out. There was a clear pane of glass that separated the bathroom and room, it did have a button activated curtain that would come down in order to have privacy. The shower/tub area was good, there where 2 shower heads one directly above and a hand held one, plenty of hot water and good water pressure. There wasnt a separation between the shower and tub which got everything wet but it wasnt a big deal. There was slight discoloration on the wall next to the shower wall, I would venture to say that it was mineralization/soap scum. the beds had a pillow top which made them comfortable along with large pillows, we had two single beds the beds were adjacent to each other. (if you rolled over to far you would be on the next bed). The internet cost $130HKD (cable/wifi) per computer. We had a harbour view but there was some construction going on so you could see cranes and construction equipment. As another review stated the surrounding area is run down. The MTR (subway) is two blocks away effective mode of transportation taking you near most spots allowing you to walk around and explore.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE - STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: tammy_elle
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed one night at the Harbour Grand Hotel in HK on Oil St on the night of the fire. Luckily the time the fire started we were out enjoying late night eats. When we returned, the hotel's top floors was engulfed in flames. Having to wait outside for 12 hours, we were finally let back into our rooms to collected our stuff and get the heck out of there! A month have passed as we filed our insurance claim with the hotel, their response? a settlement of 2000HKD equiv to 256$CDN when our claim was about 6000$CDN all destroyed and irretrievable (macbook pro 15" work laptop, ipads, designer purses, designer sunglasses, 2 destroyed passports and much much more!) what a joke! As others have mentioned about the night of the fire, management handled everything wrong. Had to get info from the fire fighters! Was yelled at by Front Desk Manager for talking to the fire fighters! Will never return, will not settle and will not recommend! Has anybody received e-mails regarding settlement??

Reviews.Title: “Great view of harbour, but an expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_road_house
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on my company's list, so got booked through that. The room was nice, especially the bathroom. but the big selling point is the view of the harbour. But along with it comes the noise of the highway the hotel is on, and hence i deduct one point from the rating. The place overall felt expensive, and i have had better experiences for same in other Asian cities. but a functional hotel with a very nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cognitive dissonance”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand - a 5 star luxury hotel sits in the middle of an industrial area side by side with car workshops and car mechanics. It is located at North Point and it's out of the main tourist drag - and that's its attraction for us. It is 2 short blocks away from the MTR (underground railway) which connects Hong Kong and Kowloon. Causeway Bay is an excellent shopping area nearby. Check out the "Times Square" shopping mall in Causeway Bay. Service in the hotel is excellent. It is worthwhile to pay the extra for "Club status" which includes access to the club lounge on the top floor, breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails daily and use of internet. Unfortunately on our recent visit the pool was closed for maintenance, however they offered to drive us over to their sister hotel if we wanted to use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: DP72
Reviews.Content: When I stayed, there were road works/police road closures next to the hotel and there had been a fire. As such, 'reception' was at the end of the road (unmanned when I arrived) and not all hotel facilities were available. That aside, the hotel has the potential to be great. Reception (the regular one) is an amazing space, with stunning chandeliers and a harpist on the stairs at night, which is quite enchanting. I had good service on the two occasions that I dealt with people. My room on the club floor was comfortable, with a great bed. I do always have a slight problem with rooms that are somehow integrated with the bathroom. Here, the wall is glass, with the option of lowering blinds, presumably to give the illusion of space. There is a curious wet room within the bathroom, containing both shower and bath. Great views over central Hong Kong and Kowloon. I ate breakfast twice. On the first day I was very early and there wasn't much service to be had. On the second day, I was later and the staff were much more eager. The spread was impressive. Well located for my office and the MRT. Wifi available but not included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Jo_PaulLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November 2011, was a bit unsure of staying on Hong Kong Island as we had previously stopped in Kowloon (2009) and didnt venture over the harbour much, one day we visited this hotel as a member of our party knew someone who worked here. The street was a little off-putting as it is very "local" with garages and shops, the hotel look a little out of place as the reception is very luxourious. My in-laws stayed here in October 2011 and said how lovely it was so we decided to book it! So glad we did I would say after stopping in this hotel, we will definately be back! Upgraded to the Club lounge and the views from our room across the harbour were lovely. Club lounge is well worth the extra, daily breakfast, free drinks throughout the day, lunch time and evening nibbles and a fantastic view. Staff were lovely, always remember you and very friendly and helpful. Rooms nice and clean. Staff were sometimes a little slow at breakfast but we didnt let it bother us, just felt a bit bad asking! Close proximity to the MTR and we didnt feel at all intimidated by the locals around us, even late at night (as no-one seems to sleep here!) Didnt eat in the restaurant as we wanted to explore as we were only here a short while and the MTR makes it so easy to get around but the in-laws said it was very nice when they came. Looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning harbour views”
Reviews.Author: Jonsee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on stop over on way home from Australia.The street leading to hotel not brilliant, which made you wonder what the hotel would be like? We needn't have worried once inside the huge and opulent reception area you knew this was a quality hotel.Arrived at 7am after longhaul to be told that rooms were ready.Room on the small side (remember you are in H Knong) but well appointed and comfy,Views overlooking harbour breathtaking. Breakfast can only be described as probably the biggest varietey of breakfast (food from all around the world) we have ever seen.Was on a buffet basis and you could eat as much as you wanted.Quality of breakfast outstanding ,we noticed several locals who paid to have breakfast there,we got chatting to one of them who said that he ate there on a regular basis as it was one of the best breakfast in H Kong, I could not disagree with him. We also ate at the restaurant on the top floor, views were outstanding as was the food.Overall once you have got past the street leading to the hotel you should not be disappointed we walked up this street every evening for a stroll and was never an issue, looked worse than it actually was.We would definateley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Against all the odds”
Reviews.Author: LondonSpaceman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two friends arrived at the Harbour Grand twelve hours after the fire had been extinguished. The top floors, pool. spa and the Le 188 Restaurant were all out of action. However, despite the organised chaos on arrival, we were checked into the Grand Delux rooms we had booked on the 16th floor - this was clearly a challenging time for the hotel management and staff but they managed it magnificently and their service was superb. Throughout our stay, we were kept informed as the hotel got back to some normality and received a complementary bottle of wine for our patience and understanding. We were not able to use the pool (but the hotel shuttle bus took us to the Grands sister hotels pool). The spa reopened on our last day and while the treatment was good, the surroundings had been affected by the fire. Not withstanding the fire, the Harbour Grand is clearly a 5 star hotel. Our room was an adequate size, very well appointed with a marble bathroom with wet room and the bed is very comfortable. We had a harbour view which is stunning but it's worth noting that there is a lot of construction work along almost the entire waterfront. The breakfast buffet is very comprehensive, catering for almost every cuisine and in bright airy surroundings. But above all, the service throughout our stay was second to none. The hotel is 5 minutes walk to Fortress Hill MTR station and 10 minuted on the train to Central and the Star Ferry. I'd recommend buying an Octopus card which we used on all the public transport which is simple to use and very efficient. Taxis are very cheap too. Overall a great experience in a well located 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ltnathome
Reviews.Content: I was in HK recently for 7 days and spent 3 nights here first and then 4 at the Sheraton in Kowloon (bc of available hotel points, and not bc of any problems). Not sure what the least expensive rooms are like because we were upgraded to a large room with a nice view of the harbor. We didn't use any of the facilities and so can't comment on that. Overall, the hotel has a very nice luxe feeling. Our room is very comfortable with nice shower facilities. Others here have remarked that it's not in the most desirable location. That is true enough in that it's not nearby fancy shopping or restaurants within walking distance etc. However, I felt perfectly safe here and have zero complaint about the location; I also like the fact that the metro station is 3 blocks away, on an often used MTR line, and there are two Starbucks within a few blocks -- always nice to have if you don't want room service or sit down at the hotel cafe. A number of bakeries nearby, as well as drugstore, 7-11 (everywhere in HK and very useful) etc. As a note, the Airport Express metro line to HK has a free shuttle service that drops you off right at the hotel, and the hotel also has free shuttle service (at intervals) to the Airport Express line.

Reviews.Title: “my experience with fire”
Reviews.Author: edwardgb
Reviews.Content: Outside of the fire this is easily a five star hotel except for the immediate location. General location is great, close to MTR, pretty easy shot from the tunnel. My experience with the fire knocks this rating down because of the lack of an alarm. The fire alarm did not wake me up the fire hitting my window did. It seems pretty basic that an alarm would go off during a fire. Other than that a little disorganized getting you back about to your room next afternoon everything else was handled fine. The staff was very accommodating trying their best under the circumstances. Would stay there again because what are the odds?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, mediocre area”
Reviews.Author: Steveqld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights earlier this week. Lovely spacious hotel with rooms of a decent standard. I thought I was in a deluxe room but apparently it was a higher standard. Still, the room was smallish but acceptable. Some amenities were not available due, I was told, to maintenance although looking at other reviews this may have been due to repairs from a fire more than maintenance. Staff were always polite and friendly. Only complaint is that they charge for absolutely everything. Had to print out an airline ticket and was told that it is usually $HK4 per page but because I had to wait for repairs to the printer they were free. I enquired about airline tickets but the quote was well above what they were available for so I booked them myself. Location is also not too impressive. Transport is affordable and available up the road but trains are usuallly packed. Overall may stay there again but would seriously look for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Views”
Reviews.Author: Soetnos
Reviews.Content: All rooms in this hotel have excellent views over Hong Kong island as well as TsimShaTsui and Kowloon. Nice rooms which are well maintenance. All TV's have HDMI, wireless as well as cable connection. Refrigerator in room. Excellent service as a 5 star hotel. Good AC. 2-3 minutes walk to Fortress Hill MTR station and supermarket. Excellent choice for business travelers visiting HKCEC. Only one change to Airport Express train from Central. The hotel in general offers high quality food on gourmet level for a 5 star hotel in Hong Kong. Nice restaurant on top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel, in a seriously grim location”
Reviews.Author: Angliskai
Reviews.Content: "Why would you build such an attractive hotel in such an undesirable area", was the question I asked myself upon arrival. The decor was of a very high standard in the suite I was in. The view from the roof top lounge was stunning. Food was above average. Gym facilities were excellent. Staff were friendly but a bit slow on helping out with some basic request for my meeting. Maybe a connection there with their apparently poor response in the fire described by other reviewers? MRT was nearby but extremely crowded even by HK standards. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling handling of fire”
Reviews.Author: redmonkey
Reviews.Content: I stay at Harbour Grand regularly because of the beautiful rooms, even though the neighborhood is not exactly the most desirable. Though I am aware of poor management of the hotel, I never thought of safety issues and after this fire, I have learned to be cautious now in all hotels when I travel, because I realize now how important good management is. I was on the 29th floor when I was woken up by loud banging on my door. I answered the door and could hear a dim ringing of alarm from some distant floor. I concluded there was a fire alarm of some sort, but never thought there really was a fire. When I opened the door I saw smoke rolling down the hallway towards my room (the last one on the floor) and the fire doors were already slammed shut at the other end of the hallway. There was not one soul anywhere in sight. I had one exit next to my room so I rushed downstairs, only to find the 25th floor (supposedly a fire breaking floor) piled with what seemed like construction materials, tables and furniture. I thought maybe I should go to the 26th floor to see if I could make it to another stairwell, but found a similar situation of smoke and fire doors slammed shut, so I returned to the 25th floor and tried to find my way in the dark and debris to another stairwell. Luckily I did and I ran down the 25 flights of stairs as fast as any human possible could, and by the time I got to around 8th floor, there was smoke coming up the stairwell. I thought the lower floors must be burning and I would probably be stuck. One can imagine the panic I felt, being the only person this whole time, not knowing the extent of the fire in the building. There was no announcement, no hotel personnel, no fire alarm going off on my floor and no guidance whatsoever. Luckily I made it down and I saw a huge crowd of probably up to a thousand on the dead end side of the street. To make a long story short, I did not get to return to the room until about 12 hours later, and the hotel's management and response later was nothing short of ridiculous. The ineptitude and complete lack of training was disheartening for a city that I have always been proud of. The misrepresentations made later to keep guests in their rooms so they would not move to another hotel was also unconscionable, as in guaranteeing that the air conditioning would be coming back within hours when I could not sleep the next night (after having practically no sleep at all already the night before with the fire), that the hot water would be back on when it was running out quickly the next morning, and similar assurances to keep signing guests in when in effect it was in no condition to provide accomodations. A hotel management personnel even tried to tell me that the building was never on fire and that a sign burnt and fell down on the 7th floor which caused burning downstairs. I discovered later that the people in the room next to mine slept through the whole fire until the firemen broke into their room at 8 am in the morning. Many would have perished, including myself, if the fire was not contained in time. The total disregard of fire code regulations and laws by the Hutchinson Group (owners of the hotel) by virtue of their stature and influence in the community is worrisome. In summary, this is defintiely a hotel to stay away from.

Reviews.Title: “Great time.”
Reviews.Author: gblofield
Reviews.Content: Sorry to see reviews regarding fire, all I can say is when we stayed for 2 nights at the end of January all was great, lovely room, great views, amazing food and pool. Location was good, easy to walk to places. Prior to reviews about fire we would certainly have returned as a stop over on the way to New Zealand, now I think we would have to give it some serious research.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Please,Serious Safety Issues !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlm00
Reviews.Content: For people who left positive reviews regarding FIRE guess you are as corrupt as Hotel and Fire Department. We were on 39th floor, 2.45am herd noises, looked out of window as 6 floors on fire, NO FIRE ALARMS SOUNDED, we woke whole of 39th floor to the fire. Left hotel and made way to a dead end street under hotel , no staff to help, no alarms. 2 hours later people were still in rooms asleep unaware of fire!!!! Fire service took 45 minutes to arrrive from when we were outside yet fire station 400 yrds away. 7th and 8th floor totally destroyed due to falling debris and fire that was not put out by an unprofessional fire service which allowed fire to burn for several hours. It thats good then god help us all. All hotels have problems, but the way which it was handled was disgraceful.....

Reviews.Title: “No fire alarm!!!”
Reviews.Author: Corame
Reviews.Content: I have check in on 20 April at this hotel and I want to share with you my experience. We had a premium room at the 40 floor. The room was amazing(very clean and nice with a stunning view). The problem was that in the same night(20 to 21) start a fire at the 41 floor..It was 3 in the morning and everybody was sleeping. I heard "boom boom boom" in my window and when I opened my eyes I saw some big things in fire that were falling from the roof in my window..I was scared and tried to call the reception 5 times..also emergency button but the phone was not working..it was closing each time I tried to call..then I waked up the other persons next door that tought it was fireworks!!! The alarm for fire was not ringing so we didn't know what to do...We took our passports and left with the elevator that was stopping at each floor without calling it someone..we arrived in the lobby and they were evacuating the people in the left of the outside hotel..but there was no place to run..it was a fence and water...I saw then the hotel in big flames..the top floors were already taken..and the 1 st floor got fire also..it was crazy..everybody was scared,screamming, crying..thinking we will all die as the tower will fall..The police didn't answered..nobody answered..We had to find a way to run throw a deposit next to the hotel and fight with the police so we can run as far as we can..No words to describe the feelings!...We had luck we had money and check in in other hotel...The next day we went at the hotel to ask our money back or just give us a room in a same star rating hotel..but they didn't..and they didn't even told us when we will get out money back...What a shame! For a 5 star respected hotel to act like this.. Some people were very angry for the fact that they were in their room sleeping and nobody came to wake them up and evacuate them..they were people with kids...Alarm didn't rang, nobody from hotel came to all doors and see if someone was in the rooms, no money received yet for our lost payed nights!!! I would never stay again at this hotel! I'm not recommanding it! Shame on you guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “When is an upgrade not an upgrade?”
Reviews.Author: PennyH2009
Reviews.Content: Prior to our arrival we were upgraded to a Grand Deluxe Harbourview Room as the swimming pool was closed. I hate to think what our original room would have been like, as with two suitcases and handbaggage there wasn't an awful lot of spare room. The harbour view was only partial, and there was quite a lot of building work going on below us. Fortunately most of our stay was over Chinese New Year so it didn't cause us much bother, but you really noticed it on the last day when everybody was back at work. If you are spending time on Hong Kong Island this hotel has easy access to the MTR which made getting about fairly easy, even though several stops away from Central. Room and harbour views nowhere near as good as the Harbour Grand Kowloon, which we stayed at last time we were in Hong Kong, but more than made up for with its easy access to the MTR without the need of a shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, the ugly-by samflyer”
Reviews.Author: samflyer
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand Hotel is located on Hong Kong island in central HK near the Fortress Hill metro station. It's on the north coast with good views of city and water. It is in a good neighborhood, good restaurants nearby, metro within 3 minute walk. While the hotel is highly priced the quality is good and the service superior. Wifi and cable Internet is available in each room. The rooms are very nice and cleaniness excellent. The good: 1. Top quality modern rooms 2. Wifi on every floor 3. Good area 4. Excellent views 5. Very good restaurant on site The bad: 1. The prices, too be expected in HK. The ugly: 1. The hotel recently had a major fire (20 April). Damage was significant although pictures may not indicate this. Additionally, the fire alarm only activated on the floors that the fire was on, not on ALL floors. This caused a delayed evacuation from other floors (namely the ones above the fire!)

Reviews.Title: “Lets not tell anyone there's a FIRE!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrian w
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary at the Harbour Grand,Arriving on the 16th April for 10 days. On the night of 21st was woken up at 3am on the 31st floor by the sound of breaking glass, opened curtains to see flaming debris falling past like a waterfall, could see reflection of floors above ours in opposite windows as one mass of flames.woke wife and rushed into hall and broke firealarm point as no alarm was sounding,alarm rang for 30 seconds and turned off.I rushed down the corridor banging on doors shouting fire.We joined the throng of people in the fire escape stair well to go down 31floors,only to find on the way down places that were semi blocked by table and chairs.We ran into the road and followed others in to a dead end! Stood for over 2 hours with any hotel personal making contact and name checks only after 4 hours by the police. Later when asking staff what was the cause , some did not even know there had been a fire overnight. They tried to charge for that night and told us that later in day we could return to our room for the night . Hotel smelt of smoke through out and windows were black with melted substance,Luckly holiday rep found us another hotel so we booked out. They get everyone on the upgrade trick .Even us .Watch out internet -cost $130HK a night about £13 , the hotel I am in know ,its free.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential...”
Reviews.Author: Intlnabers
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong on Hong Kong Island due to the proximity to Soho, Causway bay, etc on HK Island. It’s located in the North Point neighborhood which is very nice, although there is a TON of construction going on right now so that was hugely irritating & VERY loud at times....even through the thick glass windows. Its very close to a metro stop, starbucks, grocery store, laundry center, etc…so convenient for our 6 night stay. The hotel lobby is massive and so beautiful!! Its modern, smells amazing from the fresh flowers, and has huge chandeliers hanging from the high ceilings. Plus they have a live harpist the plays every evening! The rooms are so modern & clean but small (and we got a suite) but that is pretty normal for Asia. The showers are huge with a round tub & rain can shower (indulgent!), but the fact that the hotel charges daily for Wifi PER device, is insane in this day in age. Luckily we complained enough that they only charged us 1 time for our 5 devices/day. For this reason, the construction, and the somewhat unfriendly staff, I would not stay here again unless services changes were made and the surrounding construction finished.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeliveable!!! Not in a good way..”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: After running down 39 flights of stairs in the middle of the night to escape last night's fire, (no alarms!) my husband just returned to the US. He was able to reteive his belongings in his room, climbing and descending the same 39 floors with his heavy suit case, escorted by fire personnel, to the front desk where upon he was presented with a bill for his one night stay and his dinner. Really??? UNBELIEVEABLE. What kind of luxury hotel would even attempt this?!? Upon his refusal to pay for the room and his request that due to the circumstances they sould also be comping his dinner too, they comped the one night stay (who would even attempt to charge for this). He reluctantly paid for his dinner... Not that the hotel will be open anytime soon, but my guess is that from now on, as he travels to Hong Kong regularly for business, he will be staying at The Conrad (Hilton) where he was welcomed and given his room until the next evening at no addition charge so that he could decompress from the events of the previous night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Upgrade tricks.”
Reviews.Author: VMyt
Reviews.Content: BEWARE of UPGRADES. Booked and prepaid for a superior room for 6 nights. On arrival, the hotel offered an upgrade from a room looking onto a demolition site to a harbour view room for HK$550. The only problem was the lady at the counter did not make it clear that the cost for the upgrade was HK$550 PER NIGHT. Bittersweet check-out but after heated discussion with hotel managers hotel agreed to charge HK$550 for the upgrade total. Other than this stay in hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fire in harbour grand HK”
Reviews.Author: Jacques P
Reviews.Content: The alarm went on at level 38 and wake me up -all staff manage the situation well and was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbour views if slightly out of town”
Reviews.Author: RJhols
Reviews.Content: Part one of a twin centre holiday (Part 1 Hong Kong Part 2 Langkawi) earlier this month. Firstly, I highly recommend the 'Airport Express' train from HK airport. It takes 24 mins to reach Central station costing HKD80pp. We then grabbed a taxi to Harbour Grand costing a further HKD45. A taxi from the airport is HKD360. The train was easy to access from arrivals, quick, clean, efficient and much cheaper. We caught it back to the airport too. Very impressed. We stayed on a room only basis and had a harbour facing room on the 17th floor and the room was spacious and clean, with a massive shower. No problem not getting brekkie included as Starbucks just round the corner. Ther hotel wanted HKD 215pp per day for brekkie. No thanks. Like everybody else says on their review, the hotel is slightly out of central town but with Fortress Hill station a 3 min walk away, you're never far from anywhere and the MTR impressive service and low cost shames the London Underground. We were there for 4 days and got an 'Octopus' card which is essentially a travel card which works on MTR, trams, ferries etc (Londoners will be familiair with Oyster cards, same thing). A small gripe, I didn't find the Consierge especially helpful. It was our first trip to HK and looked for some guidance on several places to visit and got little feedback other than suggesting where to go if we want to go shopping....thanks very much. Over all, if you don't mind being slightly out of SoHo or Wan Chai where all the evening action is then this hotel is very good and no complaints. Oh and by the way, one final tip down in Kowloon (Mong Kok station), lots of electronics shops and we bought the new ipad and a new Nikon camera.....saved ££££

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, not practical”
Reviews.Author: JNBils
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on our way back from Australia. Upgraded to a Club Room on 36th floor but made very clear it didn't include any club privileges.
