Rooms quite small and lacking storage space, especially drawers. Seating area taken up with oversize desk. Harbour view but not towards central so not anything recognisable and as another reviewer points out there is major building work going on outside so lower rooms may suffer. Got the impression more geared to business traveller and certainly the Concierge staff couldn't have been more disinterested. We asked about the Big Bus Tour expecting they would have information available, or if not a quick google search would have helped, but all we got was a shrug. The response for timing of the free shuttle bus to Central was to ask the door boy! In its favour despite "colourful" location access to Central via MTR is very quick and easy, once you master the ticket machines, but certainly wouldn't recommend as a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL & STUNNING VIEWS!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra12blue
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand was absolutely stunning!!..... The best thing about this hotel is that it is in North Point and only a 2 minute walk to the MTR...... the suburb is truly authentic Hong Kong and by MTR you are only 10 mins to Causeway bay....... Even though the breakfast was delicious we decided to only have it twice in our 10 day stay as it was expensive and if you can be bothered Brekkie is so cheap just outside the hotel ...... lots of variety outside not just with brekkie but lovely quaint restaurants ans so so cheap eg bottle of red, crab, veggies, pork dish,rice enough food for three people = $30AUD. The view from this hotel is overwhelming see my photos..... Located on Hong Kong island and free from the hustle and bustle of downtown..... We really loved the fact that at the end of the day we could catch the MTR and make the getaway back to our hotel...... We had friends who decided to stay at this same hotel in the Kolwoon side and also loved it there but said hotel was noisey and busy..... Book this hotel you will love it :))

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRod1960
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand Hotel is a great hotel in a great location very close to Fortress Hill MTR with access right along Hong Kong Island and only minutes by MTR to Kowloon. Also very close if you want to catch the tram which is a a great Hong Kong experience. We stayed on the Club Floor with access to the Executive Lounge on the 41st floor which was well worth the extra payment. Great breakfast provided every morning and all day snacks, water, soft drinks and beer. Evening cocktails and nibbles too in a very comfortable room with magnificent views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Our room had beautiful harbour views and was very comfortable. On arrival we were whisked skyward in the lift and all our check in was handled personally by one of the Executive Club Staff while we enjoyed a welcome drink. The staff continued throughout our stay to welcome us by name each morning or whenever we were in the hotel. They assisted with dinner bookings and helped in locating special places to visit. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Glossy facade but inconsistent and stingy on basics”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana P
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the doormen with turbans plus the lobby gave the impression of opulence and luxury. Great views from our room and lovely decor BUT our room was only refreshed daily with one teabag and milk per person (plus a couple of herbal teas), Perhaps they should have less turban wearing doormen and provide more consistent service. Front desk person was very brusque. The pool was stunning but there was no service to order the offered ice cream treats or drinks even though it abutted the buffet restaurant. When we finally ordered two icecreams after flagging down the two chatting life guards it took 30 minutes to arrive and the other another twenty and was basically ice and water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: csteets
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but the rooms are very small (think London small). The lobby is very sterile and has no lobby bar or restaurant . This hotel in my opinion is basically a convention hotel. The staff were very friendly and the service was good. One thing you should know is the location of this hotel is very bad. It is located in an old 1960's residential neighborhood. There is plenty of local food around but it is not really a tourist area. The hotel is located on a road called "Oil Can Road" which is appropriate considering there are car repair shops located next to the hotel. These shops stay open late. The MTR is located about 3 blocks away. If you are coming as a tourist I would not recommend this hotel because you have to hop on the MTR to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chippie1308
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Hong Kong 7's between 22/3 and 27/3 - very easy to get to, well located, great views, terrific facilities. Internet connection performed well and relaibly (comes at additional cost) Fortress Hill MTR station is a 3 minute walk away and whilst Fotress Hill itself is a little bit out of centre of town, it doesn't take long to commute via Hong Kong's efficient public transport system. Check-in was a little complex but think that was a timing issue and they did manage the delays quite well. Check out was very simple & quick Only minor dislike was that the pool area was right outside the breakfast area. Stayed on the 15th floor and there were some cabling works happening during my stay however the works were non-disruptive and the cablers were very accommodating Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterStanyer
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) stayed here in April 2012 on holiday for 6 nights on the 39th floor. The staff were unfailing helpful and the extra paid for the Harbour Club on the highest floors with complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails was well worth the price. The restaurant ("Le 188") on 41st floor served exquisite food with views to die for. Our room (and that of our son on 37th floor) had amazing views of the harbour, and our bed was extremely comfortable. The location was fine so long as you are willing to take the metro or a cab to get to usual tourist or business haunts. One downside to mention is that the bath and shower would have been difficult to climb into for anyone with even modest mobility issues (but this was not the case for all rooms, so check in advance if this is a concern) and the pool in early april, being unheated, was, to put it mildly, refreshing.Overall, we were really pleased with our choice of hotel - it underpinned a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Hotel ideal for business Trips”
Reviews.Author: harrissafety
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbour Grand for 4 nights and overall the hotel room was fine. The resturant / bar on the top of the hotel has some of the best views of Hong Kong and Kowloon. The only downside to the hotel is its location as you are slightly of the main centre, but the MTR is only a couple of minutes walk away. If you stay at this hotel make sure you do not have a room by the lifts, as the noise can be a bit loud at times, as sound proofing is very poor. Also at the moment there is a major construction site directly in front of the hotel which is very noisy, which you can hear in the room at 8am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: starryjohn99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbour Grand for 4 nights at the end of March and the hotel was fine. They were helpful, very courteous and always obliging. My only criticism, and this would be a plus for some visitors, is that it is a bit out of the way. We visited the HK Flower Show in Victoria Park and that was easily accessible by foot from the hotel. Virtually everything else needed to be accessed by the subway trains. However, that really wasn't a problem because Fortress Hill Station is a two minute walk away and of course the train system is fantastic --- cheap and far-reaching. The hotel is a good hotel and if you wanted to stay in and take advantage of all their facilities it wouldn't disappoint. Missed some gentle live music in the lobby lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel near MTR station”
Reviews.Author: charber
Reviews.Content: I went to see this hotel when I was in HKG late last year and booked for a 5 night stay with my family (2 children aged 3 and 7) on the basis of what I saw. The staff here are very helpful and friendly and that was a great introduction to the city. A special mention must go to Leo in the Harbour Club. The location is controversial, but I get the feeling this is not a typical business hotel and that might explain it's capacity (seemed quite full) whilst being outside the main 'hub' of the city. In reality I think this is perfect in fact, since the walk to the MTR (Fortress Hill) takes only 2 mins and it is less than 5 mins to central from here on a direct line. There are some great places to eat along electric road - very cheaply too. I have stayed in a few hotels in HKG over recent years and none have had this (most spectacular) view from the harbour club floor (41) and the restaurant there. I have a feeling that this may only be achievable from this floor (and possibly even only from this part of Hong Kong Island) but when you price up breakfast it is not as bad a premium as if first seems. We will be back for a night in a week or so, and are not on the higher floors (we were on the 37th floor) so I will be able to compare then. The breakfast upstairs was good and the canapes and cocktails in the evening a nice touch, with free soft drinks and beer throughout the day. However, there is a huge construction project going on next door. It looks as if a new skyscaper is to be added to Hong Kong's increasingly cramped address book. This was not in progress when I visited and would have cost them my booking had it been. The pool area is very pleasant but under these circumstances it was not the relaxing haven I had expected. The level of noise is remarkable, it made hearing my children virtually impossible - and that is some achievement! The pool is also freezing and the children were shivering after only 10-15 mins of swimming. There also were pieces of glass, sharp wire and a screw, amongst the items we removed from the pool floor - one of which cut my son's foot. All rather bizarre for a 5-star establishment - as was the response (a sticking plaster). All in all, this did not spoil our stay but I would hesitate to 'recommend' this to families/people seeking R&R until the building site next door is more complete. At the moment they are digging foundations it would appear and this is very noisy - you can even hear the banging in the bedrooms which is amazing as aircraft and vehicles whizz by without a sound. As a business hotel when guests would be out all day it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottyjules
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel dec'11- just fantastic loved the room 22 floor great view out over the harbour. room very very comfortable largest comfiest bed ive ever been on. location great just short walk from mtr which made this hotel good location for site seeing this hotel not in busy central district butnever felt unsafe when walking back to hotel at night. we only ate on the first night at hotel which was room service which was great little feast never tried and of the resturants. overall great hotel for been able to be colse to an mtr without the extra cost of been in central/kowloon. would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Break From The Crowds and Congestion”
Reviews.Author: wally434
Reviews.Content: Some reviewers don't like the location of this hotel, but we found it ideal, compared to the congestion in Central, Causeway Bay and Kowloon. Yes, the area around the hotel is somewhat industrial, but at no time did we feel that our safety was at risk. It is only a short walk to the MTR and there are a number of dining options within walking distance. We upgraded to the club floor and are glad that we did. In addition to breakfast and happy hour, the lounge is a quiet place to view the activity in Victoria Harbour and the staff were some of the friendliest and helpful that we have encountered. The rooms are not large, but adequate. The design of the bathrooms seems to favour form over function - the taps are not well placed and the mirror makes it difficult to lean over the sink. There is construction all along the harbour, and the noise can be annoying at times, especially when they are operating the pile driver. Construction starts mid morning and seems to wrap up around dusk.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but”
Reviews.Author: brady209
Reviews.Content: Won a holiday to Hong Kong and stayed in this hotel so have no idea of cost. Quite plush and agreed to pay $500 Hong Kong dollars for a room upgrade after double room was booked but got here and only twin available. Bit peeved as double had been booked by agent but thought £50 equivalent upgrade was not bad.On 33rd floor with fabulous views over all of Hong Kong Harbour Only had breakfast in hotel(this was excellent buffet and as much as you can eat) as out sightseeing all the time plus food is quite expensive. Not 5 mins walk away is wonderful restaurants and snack bars with great chinese food for not a lot of money. Really enjoyed the hotel and then slight of hand of room upgrade bit us. At check out informed that the $500 was per night not for the 5 days we were there. So £50 had become £350. It had been explained and put across very clearly that it was £500 dollars. No mention of anything else and I had signed when we checked in for just $500 Hong Kong Dollars. There further across the page I am sure had been entered the figure of $2500 after we had handed the form back on check in. I kicked up a fuss and asked for the duty manager, who agreed to look into it, and I refused to pay for anything other than drinks from our mini bar. I also got the agent on to it, who also intervened on our behalf and when I got back to England, even the $500 I had signed for had been waived. But watch out if you stay here for this little bit of deceit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: ebtrip
Reviews.Content: When we tried to walk to the harbour promenade just a few hundred yards away, we realised why this hotel was such good value. After 2 - 3 hours trying to negotiate road works and developments we still could not get to the promenade. The hotel seems completely out of place with its surroundings. Several car repair 'shops' are just few yards away. The outlook from the fron of the hotel is of bamboo scaffolding on the building opposite. The room we stayed in was perfectly adequate and on first inspection was quite stunning to look at. It was only when we used the wardrobes that we discovered the doors did not open and close properly - a shame as the rest of the room was very good. We quickly discovered the way to let the blind down across the glass wall between the bedroom and the bathroom - neither of us particluarly want to watch the other sitting on the loo....a strange concept. The most beautiful lifts/elevators ever seen and also efficient:)

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby and bar but rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: Roosterdap
Reviews.Content: Was here for the Hong Kong sevens with a group of 20 guys. The hotel is smart, modern, clean and has some fantastic views especially from the bar on the 41st floor. However the standard rooms seemed a little small. I upgraded to a suite but even this wasn't huge. No real complaints apart from the cost of a late check out, we had to pay half the room rate that I thought was a little tight considering there were 20 of us and we had spent sch a lot of ash at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Japanese must love the bath tub”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMiyauchi
Reviews.Content: What I loved about this hotel is the size of the bath tub. I am not sure all rooms has the same bath tub but it was round large size, deep enough so even a lazy guy like me did filled it with hot water every morning and night. I usually don't and this hotel has a nice rain shower too. We arrived in Sunday afternoon and in the very nice large lobby area, we saw some wedding couples nicely dressed. One of the bride was in Chinese version which gave us Hong Kong feeling. One only thing which wasn't nice was the area, especially the main entrance is facing some construction site or something, I didn't pay attention what that was, but didn't look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with large hotel...inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: pedigreebull
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I would say this is a good 4 star hotel. I am hesitant to say this is a 5 star hotel because although it looks like a 5 star hotel, it did not feel like a heavy weight 5 star hotel. There were quick free shuttle buses to/from the HK station of the Airport express trains. Service was good but erratic. For example, I ordered the standard Yang Chow Fried Rice for room service. It was way too greasy…can you imagine fried rice with an inch thick of oil at the bottom of the rice? Not exaggerating….after leaving the unfinished rice outside the room for pick up and having written negative comments about it on the napkin, although the item “Private Dining – Room” was reflected on the bill, the cost (without me asking for it) was zero. Great initiative. What was erratic was the newspaper….firstly, they did not ask me whether I preferred English or Chinese papers. Secondly, it was only delivered on the 1st day and they forgot about it for the next 4 days! Finally, there was window cleaning/replacement going on so the ropes from the gondola were constantly knocking against the room’s windows (even late at night). This was not mentioned upon check-in. So although a room change was offered after I inquired about what was going on, it was rather late because I have unpacked and it was late at night. What gave it a 5 star look: a big sized lobby; there was also a musician playing harp in the lobby in evenings…soothing; good sized restaurant for breakfast , did not feel crammed. Nice looking hotel pool too overlooking the harbor. There was a good Business Centre too but a pity that the person behind the counter did not even know how to arrange for a DHL package to be picked up. Why it did not feel like a heavy weight 5 star hotel: weird location. The surroundings are rather run down with no trendy shops to speak off however there is a 7-11, 2 supermarkets and MTR station (Fortress Hill) is a short walk away though. It is not conveniently located i.e. From Fortress Hill. It is a few MTR stops to Admiralty (which you will need to get off in order to get to change MTR to Tsim Tsa Tsui). Suggestion: get the free shuttle buses from the hotel if it takes you to where you want to go (they go to Causeway Bay, Admiralty, Central). Slow elevators in Hotel. Made worse by large tour groups jostling for the elevators. If not too much more expensive, suggest getting a room from 28/F upwards. You will get to use elevators in a different elevator bank from those that tour groups use (they appear to generally use rooms up to 27/F). If you are after good sized rooms (by HK standards), want to feel comfortable in a large hotel with modern amenities, are not bothered too much by its location and its surroundings, and can live with service that does not go the extra mile, and cost is important (it is slightly cheaper than others more conveniently located hotels in the same class) I would say this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Full Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: HongKong1234
Reviews.Content: A short walk to the MTR station, brand new hotel. Please enjoy the sky lounge on the roof. The rooms are BIG.

Reviews.Title: “TOP OF THE LOT”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and had to come home and buy a pillow just like there beds ohhh we loved the views from our room we watch cruiseships sail by and watch junk boats take people on tours was so relaxing. The internet was easy assess so was nice to send the emails from our room. The door men where so nice greeting us with a lovely smile so nice to feel welcome everytime we cam back from a day out. there is a lovely supermarket just down the road undernear a ship placed in the corner block just walk straight down the road and you can miss it get the lift down to the lower levels to food courts and food shopping centre and they speak perfect english was great

Reviews.Title: “Location not convenient though the hotel is rather new...”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: I didn't pick this hotel, my business partner did. I stayed for just one night, it's located at North Point but it's far from the North Point MTR station. This is a 5-star hotel that's 3 years old. The hotel staff are generally friendly and competent. I was there for a seminar and the banquet staff was outstanding in terms of rendering help and assistance for venue set-up. For a 5-star hotel though, it falls short of housekeeping standards. I was greeted with a cup in the bathroom full of tooth paste marks - it was obviously used and not replaced. I did take a pic and will do the uploading later. I am not sure what' wrong on this trip, I had the same issue with the 2nd hotel I was in (Silka Seaview at Yaumatei, see my other review). I also had lunch there; the buffet offered a great variety of food though not everything was delicious. I will not stay there if I am in HK for leisure, it was HK$1650 a night. I prefer Kowloon at all times but if you want to stay in HK, choose a hotel in Admiralty/Central (yes, it's expensive), Wanchai or Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: CityTravelers999
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a really eclectic, contemporary room with comfortable beds and a great bathroom! The views from the bar on the 41st floor were amazing. Lobby is a bit stark with very little seating, but the harpist in the evening helps to warm things up.

Reviews.Title: “class in a run down part of the city”
Reviews.Author: littlemissred41
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from 3 nights in this 4/5 star hotel, I must say this stay was was very pleasant, from the grand entrance reception to the dining room on the top floor with a commanding view over Hong kong city and Kowloon, one of the best places to see the nightly laser display, ( on a clear night ) unfortunatly not on our stay. The room with its king size bed and well stocked mini bar,to the glorious deep bath in the wet room ideal after a long day sight seeing. The hotel has it's draw backs namely the area, a little run down and a little out from Hong Kong central, needing the hotels shuttle bus, or a 10 minute walk to the MTR station at Fortress Hill for the metro ride into the centre,cheap transportation via the easy use of the citys transport card OCTOPUS,good for trains, buses,ferries and even in some shops. The only thing I could find was that the hotel does not advertise its shuttle service to and from the airport so you could pay more then you need to. Worth looking into first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: kiplingex34
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lives up to its name Grand, restaurant on the top floor a little expensive but great views, rooms very clean & modern, the area could have been better a little grimey at night (fixing cars on the corner all the time day & night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovingthetravelingli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and would have loved to stay longer! Everything about the hotel - the lobby, the room, the bathroom, the restaurant for breakfast - was impressive. The room was incredibly comfortable; It was spacious and convenient, and I can't remember when I've slept so well. The bathroom was the real luxury. The bathtub was enormous and had two different shower heads: one on the wall and one on the ceiling. Everyone I encountered at the hotel - the doorman to hail me a taxi, the concierge to order my airport shuttle, the room service operator and delivery, the front desk for check in and check out, the wait staff at breakfast - was helpful, friendly, professional, and attentive. For me service goes a long way; I'm very sensitive to it, and everyone I came into contact with, including merely riding in the elevator with a member of the staff, earned major points in my book. The hotel is within a block of several blocks of shopping (and two Starbucks), and within two blocks of the famous tram ride as well as the MTR (which is easy and clean by the way). The airport shuttle makes it painless to get to and from the airport as they handle your luggage for you, so it's just a matter of sitting back for the ride. I plan on returning to Hong Kong next year for holiday and will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food & Bath Tub”
Reviews.Author: SDGWH
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel in HK. The guest room is showing a bit sign of getting old but still very decent overall. The bed is very comfy and the circular bath tub is an excellent feature. Service of front desk is not of top grade but good enough. I also went to the Chinese restauran, Kwan Cheuk Heen, for dinner. Food is excellent and service is great. A good place for considersation if you are planning to have some fine Chinese cuisine dining.

Reviews.Title: “A little far out”
Reviews.Author: Anginstrop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not central which deterred us venturing out on an evening which left us feeling left out of Hong Kongs night life. We stayed 2 nights and dined in the hotel. The 188 restaurant on the top floor was excellent with service to match but the buffet restaurant that advertised serving until 10.00 pm were removing fishes and not restocking all it offered when we arrived at 9.15 so we had very limited choice. If they are open until 10.00 they should offer the same choice to both late and early diners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Barry P
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our three night stay I felt I had to comment on one of the previous reviews about feeling unsafe. Although the hotel is situated downtown from most of the other five star hotels we felt completly safe when walking about in the local streets, you see the true sights and sounds of Hong Kong. We were invited to upgrade to Harbour Club on our arrival for a modest cost and what a good choice it turned out to be. our room was on the 38th floor with stunning views. We had only one complaint when the kitchen had a hick-up one morning and failed to produce our cooked to order eggs on time,[ we were going on a bus trip and could'nt wait ] . On our return we were suitably impressed by a bowl of fruit delivered to our room with an letter of apology for the breakfast delay. The staff were courteous and helpful. A really beautiful hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Eilidhgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on the way home from New Zealand.The hotel is excellent in every way and the staff in particular helpful.As others mention the upgrade to the Harbour Club well worth considering depending on your plans,for example,if like us you favoured being out for the day,coming back to use the lounge and enjoy the service worked well.The staff are keen to assist with any information or planning for your day and are enthusiastic and well informed.Don't overlook the in house Chinese Restaurant or the Cafe where in both cases the food is excellent. A number of people comment about the location,but wherever you are in H K you need to taxi, about,so it isn't really an issue. Finally,think about using the limousine pick up and drop off if you feel like spoiling yourself.At 650 dollars,it just makes everything really easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMartin1606
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to visit HK and pushed the boat out for our Silver Wedding. Like others we opted to upgrade to the Club Room and found ourselves on the 39th floor. The views alone are worth the extra cost. Be sure and ask for a west facing room as you get the aspect out to Hong Kong centre and Kowloon. From the lounge the views are fantastic both during the day and evening when you have front row seats to the lights show at 8.00pm. The staff in the lounge make a real effort to look after you. A real 5 star experience. We found the best way to get around during the day was the metro/underground using Fortress Hill which is only 3 stops from central. I have never felt so safe on an underground system as I did there. We did also go on Star Ferry, buses, taxis and trams as well. On speaking to other tourists on a trip to the Buddha we realised that the compromise of very central v views was worth paying as others didn't have any view out of their hotel due to the built up area nature of the City. The open top bus tour was also an excellent way to find out about HK. We also went to see the Pandas at Ocean Park Theme Park and went on the cable car ride which gave great views over Aberdeen, Stanley and Repulse Bay. The night market in Kowloon was well worth a visit giving you a chance to experience the "in your face" Hong Kong. Once again 20/25 minutes back on the metro. Don't bother with the airport transfer which takes around 70 minutes as you are last hotel on the stop, get a taxi as it costs around the same 350HK$ or take the train and then taxi. Always write down where you are going as sometimes the taxi drivers can't understand what you are saying.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality and reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: Ferrarilad
Reviews.Content: Just been off on our travels again and stayed here for 4 nights, the entrance and lobby is most impressive with the lighting and wonderfull staircase. Most have the usual smile and the service is indeed 5*, our room on the 37th floor gave a magnificent view over the harbour and the fabulous 25 minute firework display to ring in the Chinese New Year. Rooms are very well equipped and very modern and nothing is too much trouble for them, you even have a choice of 12 different pillow types !!!! The restaurants and food are world class and just overwhelming with choice, I could have just stayed in the restaurant and pigged out it was that good. Only down side might be location, like most places in Hong Kong you are as well to catch a cab to wherever you go and downtown is only a short ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in poverty!”
Reviews.Author: pjandgcf
Reviews.Content: Beautiful fairly new modern Hotel on Hong Kong Island (North Point) but a fair distance out of Hong Kong centre itself. The Hotel was built, I gather about 2 years ago, in a very run-down area and I personally did not feel safe in the area. Just across the road from the Hotel was a Garage that did 99% of its work on the road - both sides of the road with electric cables crossing from one side to the other (next to the Hotel) and if you were unfortunate that re-spraying was taking place and it was a bit windy - watch out. Lovely Hotel, good food, nice rooms but position is a no-no.

Reviews.Title: “If change or cancel your reservation you will pay.”
Reviews.Author: cninja98
Reviews.Content: Only book here if you are 100% sure you will show up. Else they will charge the full rate (not the rate you were quoted for) of the 1st night plus 10% surcharge. In my case I didn't want to cancel just rescheduled but still got charged so It. Customer service not accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Henny52
Reviews.Content: We had read some of the reviews about the poor location of this hotel, but we needn't have worried. It was easy to reach direct from the airport and is a 3-4 minute walk from the MRT station to the front door of the hotel. Other reviews mention feeling unsafe at night, but we didn't - yes there are a number of what seem like 24 hour car repairers/valet businesses along the road and the area is not typically residential, but at no time did we feel unsafe. The street is well lit, often busy with traffic and plenty of people about. The hotel, located on Hong Kong Island, is in an ideal spot. We were on a room only basis, but there were plenty of cafes nearby to get breakfast - we opted for the local Starbucks, just a couple of minutes' walk away. You can also get free wi-fi there as the hotel charges (we hate paying for wi-fi these days!). As for the rooms, they are of top notch standard, modern and well maintained. We opted for a Premier Harbour View room, which also had a small seating area with a sofa. The bathroom is spacious and has a very deep round soaking bath tub easily big enough for 2 and a rainfall shower over. The bathroom is separated from the bedroom by a clear glass wall, but for the shy, there are blinds that can be lowered to give total privacy if needed. Tea and coffee making facilities are provided free of charge and a couple of bottles of complimentary water too. The bed is so comfy - bliss after an 11 hour flight from the UK. Overall, the hotel is an above average 4* and we would definitely consider staying there again if in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with an amazing breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Tim F
Reviews.Content: During my last visit in Hong Kong I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and modern and the service throughout the hotel was very friendly and always helpful. The breakfast buffet is out of this world. It offers everything from continental to typical Asian breakfast items. I also enjoyed the cakes that are served in the Lobby lounge and the hotel bar which offers a great view of the bay. I had a great time at this hotel, the only negative point was that at times it takes very long to get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: charlottejorgensen1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights between Christmas and new Year and then 3 nights at the end of January with my husband and three children age 11, 9 & 9. We stayed on the club level floor, which gave us access to breakfast every morning in the club lounge, afternoon tea from 15-17:30hrs and evening refreshments from 18-20hrs. The evening refreshments included sparkling, white and red wine and water, soft drinks and beers, the latter three being available all day. We had a late check-out of 15:00 hrs, after which we were able to stay in the lounge until we left for the airport at about 20:00. This was very much appreciated as our flight was not until 23:30 hrs. I had made a mistake with my booking, booking only for 2 nights when I needed 3 nights. I had failed to pick this up both on the confirmation email and when I checked in. The staff did not inform me until I asked what time I need to check out the following day. By this time it was 16:00 hrs and no fuss was made. They gladly extended my stay, offering me the same room at a good rate. The following day I had trouble with the airline website, struggling to check in on line and print my boarding pass. They gladly helped me with this also, although it was a website problem at the time. Generally they were extremely helpful and pleasant. On our return stay they recognised us straight away and welcomed us back, even though we had only spent 2 nights there 4 weeks prior to this. I upgraded to one King room so I could be next to the room with my children. There unfortunately were no interconnecting rooms on the club floor but this actually worked really well with the age of my children. Everyday fresh fruit was delivered to our room as well as complimentary bottle water. The room was very clean and had no awful smells. The bathroom was great with a large round bath over which was a rain shower and a standard hand held shower. The bath amenities were well stocked including toothbrush/paste, loofah and bath salts as well as the usual amenities. There was a full length window between the bathroom and bedroom which had a mechanical blind that could be rolled down if you wished for privacy. The bed was extremely comfortable as was the doona. The pillows were the best I have ever had in a hotel room. The only downside to this hotel is the location. My husband felt it was a bit far from Central but it was an easy walk to the MTR, although not via a covered walkway, which may be important in the wet season. As far as I'm concerned, whether to travel one station or 10 don't really matter once you are on the train. There are however not many "western shop" around North Point and probably fewer restaurant to choose from, but then the prices are very reasonable. Location comes down to what you are looking for. Free WiFi in the club lounge but you need to pay to use in the room HK130/24 hrs

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view”
Reviews.Author: WelshFee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Harbour Grand in November 2011. As the hotel is to the east of the main tourist area of Hong Kong Island, the rates are better value than more centrally located properties, this fact enabled us to have a club room with a harbour view and club lounge access. The views from the 41st floor club lounge were spectacular - floor to ceiling windows look out over Hong Kong Island, the harbour and Kowloon.Complementary beer, champagne and canapes every evening also make it a lovely place to spend a few hours. Club breakfast was served in the 41st floor restaurant and comprised a good selection of the usual buffet type items plus a choice of eggs....I highly recommend the smoked salmon eggs benedict, delicious! Service at the hotel was excellent, the girls on the club floor reception were lovely, and Leo who works in the club lounge was very friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is absolutely fine - it's a short walk to the main road to catch buses, trams and underground trains into the centre. Public transport is extremely cheap and very efficient. The area also felt completely safe at night. Please don't let mentions of car repair workshops put you off chosing this hotel. The local area is bustling with plenty of shops, cafes, local restaurants etc. Would we stay at the Harbour Grand again? Yes, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Grand at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: shakeyw
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 days at The Harbour Grand and cannot speak to highly of it. We upgraded to the Club Floor level and this was worth every penny,the breakfast was excellent and the food and drink from 6 to 8 first class.As this was included in the upgrade price we probably ended up saving as we ate during the day out in HK and then the nibbles were more than enough for most evenings.All of the staff from The door staff to waiters and reception were always very professional and helpfull. We ate one night in the 188 restaurant on the top floor and the food was excellent which along with the spectacular views made the evening very special. The shuttle bus to Central was always on time and well worth it to get into the central area of HK Island and was not far to walk to The Star ferries. One a two minute walk from the nearest MTR at Forest Hill and for those visiting HK for the first time the Octopus card is a must as it makes travelling so simple and you get your deposit back and any unused money back on handing in.Usefull for end of trip tips etc. Would recommend this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: CelineBrussels
Reviews.Content: The room is big for Hong Kong standards, decor is very stylish and modern. Rooms with view especially premier harbour view rooms with excellent HK famous night views. The bed is very comfortable and big. If you stay in superior room it might be a bit noisy as it is on the lower floor and next to the flyovers. However, at night, it might be fine because there is not much traffic. Just ask for a quieter room. Excellent service with a smile. The only drawback is that there is no free wifi service anywhere in the hotel. The Le 188 Is beautiful and with a great view. Cocktails are good and service excellent. There is also a very nice outdoor restaurant on 44th floor but had not tried it out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice upscale hotel without any surprises”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong in November of 2011. I had previously visited the hotel lobby and was impressed by the looks. This time I booked a stay in the hotel for three nights. I found nothing to critisize, everyhting worked, the staff was courteous, my room was big enough compared to most of the typical hotel rooms in Hong Kong. The bathroom had the items you would expect to find at a luxury hotel and my work station in the room was also comfortably fitted with electrical sockets etc. Hotel has plenty of services available and also the outdoor pool, which typically is closed during the coldest months (Dec-Feb). I was treated with dignity and smooth service during my brief stay. The hotel is located on the other side of Victoria Park, which can be a downer for some guest, but since Victoria Park and Tin Hau - North Point area is one of my favorites in Hong Kong, I was quite pleased with the location. Fortress Hill MTR station is only two blocks away, so the hotel is definitely within an easy access if your are looking for convenient public transportation. Also the tram runs along Kings Road, which is also within the same distance as MTR station. But, for some reason I was left with the impression of "too clinical". As said, everything worked, the hotel was luxurious and I have no complaints. However, I would not visit the hotel with my family with my children. But still, a luxury hotel with no dissapointments.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kruegs_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were great. This hotel is not in the busiest or most happening part of HK island, but still walking distance to Causeway Bay... And a little bit of peace ain't bad after all. What sets it apart is the great service, especially for Clib Floor guests. From. The time of arrival to departure nothing is too much trouble. Even after late checkout, the hole was happy for us to use the club liunge until we departed for our flight later in the afternoon. Gloria and Maki in the. In llounge were superb staff... Friendly, helpful and very service orientated. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and large rooms for HK standards”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Harbour Grand Hong Kong is a good value and modern hotel with spacious, comfortable and well-quipped rooms. The hotel isn't amongst all of the hustle and bustle at Central, Causeway Bay or Wan Chai, however it is a 5 minute walk from the Fortress Hill MTR Station (which is quick, cheap and frequent enough to commute to Hong Kong's major districts with minimal fuss every day) and there are some nice street markets just up the road. I stayed here for a week over New Years and found it to be a great location. Although there isn't a major shopping district around the hotel, there are still the essentials: Mannings, Wellcome supermarket, 7-11, McDonalds (with McCafe - good value coffee in Hong Kong!) and a Starbucks so you will never be without food nor caffeine. I found the Harbour Grand to be significantly cheaper and more spacious than other hotels that are closer to Central and Causeway bay. For me, staying here for a week the financial savings and larger room definitely outweighed the (slightly) out of the way location.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Roaming12
Reviews.Content: Large, well appointed hotel which is reasonable value for money. Probably not the best 5 star hotel in HK, but is good value for money. A little out of town but no more than 15 to 20 minutes on the underground to the main centres of Hong Kong and a little bit further to Kowloon. Well appointed room which is relatively small if 2 people are staying. From the bed you can see straight through a glass wall into the bathroom. So there are some privacy issues if you are sharing the room. I stayed on the executive floor. The executive lounge offers breakfast and afternoon tea. Relatively good choice of food and drink but not amazing. The coffee machine was not working properly. Great views of the harbour from the 40th floor. Overall a good stay. Not luxurious, but if you get a good rate, it's a pretty good choice for a reasonably high standard hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything at my fingertips....Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: homeral2002
Reviews.Content: The lobby is impressive with the crystal chandelier,harpist playing ...Staff is very helpful and always pleasant. Location, MTR is close by, Grocery store , pharmacies, Subway, Burger King , McDonalds, Sandwich shop, Starbucks all within walking distance. Refrigerator in the room , hot pot for heating water, Internet in the room....everything I need and like is there...rooms clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: limlib
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried before staying here after reading mixed reviews but we had a very pleasant stay. The rooms were comfortable and nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were always helpful and efficient, contrary to some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. We had booked and prepaid for a Grand Deluxe Room and requested non smoking , a king bed and an extra bed for our 7 year old. On arrival we had been upgraded to a Premier Room on a non-smoking floor with a King Bed and the complimentary extra bed was made up and ready in the room. The view was spectacular from the room being able to see Central, Wanchai and also Kowloon. We took the Airport Express to Central and then the Airport Express transfer to the hotel which is only the second on the route so was very quick. On the way back we decided to take the A11 bus so we could have the scenic route. The A11 stop is right in front of the Fortress Hill MTR stop which is a couple of minutes from the hotel. We found the position convenient for transport so easy to get around. My son enjoyed the Ding Ding trams which run nearby and are easier I think to get around than in and out the MTR. The hotel has a free shuttle that we used a couple of times, do pick up the schedule from the concierge. We had the buffet breakfast one day and found it quite comprehensive and enjoyable. As you would expect in a five star hotel it was quite expensive. There are cheaper breakfast options in easy walking distance from the hotel. The only problem we had with the room was the bath took a long time to run away. We had maintenance to the room on a separate issue and they arrived and attended to the problem immediately. It may be worth noting that if you have any mobility issues then you would not want a room like ours with the circular bath as you have to climb into it and it may be awkward even with the provided safety rail. I would recommend this hotel, yes it may not be in the thick of the action in Causeway Bay or Central but the view and comfort of the hotel make up for that. We found it easy to get around even being first timers to Hong Kong and with a 7 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Good (views) and bad (receptionists) put together”
Reviews.Author: dorinser
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overall ok but has some bad parts. What is ok: First of all, a unique perspective on both HK shores (HK Island and Kowloon) from the window. If you book it, make sure it has harbour view. Then, a very convenient location near all sorts of public transportation including the underground (MTR). It's not the most central location but if you enjoy seeing more than the typical touristic objectives you will like it. The central area is 10 min away by underground and aprox 25 min by tram. The Causeway Bay area is reachable by foot, if you enjoy a 20 min walk. The rooms are a bit small for the price but clean and well equipped. The bad part concerns the staff. The people at the reception are not able to help, despite their somewhat friendly attitude. Some of them are barely speaking and understanding english. We were unfortunate enough to have problems with the low room temperature. The outside temperature was below 10 degrees Celsius during the night and the hotel didn't seem prepared for it, there was no heating, our room became very cold and as result we woke up frozen in the morning. We claimed this at the reception, they sent somebody to check the heating, the guy simulated working on something, but the next night was exactly the same. Then again claims and discussions, again no result. Luckily, the outside temperature did increase after the 3rd night so our problem was solved. Still, not a story for a hotel at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: FionaSmith100
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 2 nights without breakfast. The hotel was stunning and we got a free upgrade to the Club floor. Very modern, comfortable room. Only downside was we had a view the wrong way down the river so couldn't see the Xmas lights etc. Hotel is within a 3min walk of MTR so nice an convenient. We walked to Centre one day too which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, rooms are clean and have very comfortable bedding. The large bathroom has standard generic amenities. Overpriced coffee shop has standard menu, though items are well presented and service there is good. However: -- in room Internet is charged at HKD$ 130 per day per computer, highest I have experienced in travels in the Asia region in two years. Internet service was unstable and it took staff nearly one hour of work to make it work in the room. -- "Superior Deluxe Harbour View" room was cramped (small - no sofa), and faced a freeway and an ugly construction site. -- the harborside contruction site generates irritating noise from pile driving. In addition, drilling noise from another construction site on a building next door reverberates in the building regularly during the day. -- the location although near Fortress Hill subway stop is inconvenient for shopping and dining. Nothing within nearby walking distance. Hotel is poor value and is not comparable to Excelsior, Park Lane, etc. in terms of service quality. If you do stay there and experience problems, contact the guest relations director. Front desk managers are useless.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: NMEH1976
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand is fantastic, spotlessly clean, nothing is too much effort, everyone is more than willing to help. We stayed for New year 2011, we chose not to upgrade to the club rooms but still had a fabulous view from our room. The hotel is near to the MTR and taxis are readily available from outside the hotel, however they have a complimentary mini bus that goes everyday and regularly to various places on the island. Michael on the concierge desk was exceptional in being helpful when it came to us choosing what we were going to do for the day as we chose to do things ourselves instead of booking on scheduled trips. I would recommend doing this as the public transport is VERY easy to fathom and it is by far cheaper to do this yourself. Michael is very helpful in assisting you to navigate the public transport if your destination in not accessible via the MTR. The hotel itself was ALWAYS spotless as were our rooms. I have to say as we stayed for 1 week I struggle to see what more space would be required, we have stayed at other hotels in other countries and have had rooms of similar size and considering that space is somewhat sparse I struggle to see what peoples issues were. We did not leave a deposit by credit card and this was not an issue either or us or the hotel. Would I come back??? - without a shadow of a doubt, would I upgrade next time??? - NO!! We did not feel the need to do this, we came to see the city, explore the city and paying for the upgrade so that we had breakfast, cocktails and nibbles is not for us and we would have felt obliged to go back for cocktails and nibbles so that we got the value for money. The food in the hotel is fabulous and I would eat in there again but there are some absolutely fabulous bakeries minutes from the hotel where you can get fresh pastries still warm for pennies!! All in all, FABULOUS hotel, AMAZING city and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Jenn3777
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel 3 stars as they messed up our room booking and it took 3 hours to sort out. Poor service - they did upgrade us to the club floor in the end which was a good thing but I'd have rather saved the 3 hours we wasted sorting it out. The location was fine - only a few blocks to the mtr station no problem that it was a lite further from the main part of town. Would recommend booking a room with a view of both sides of the harbour as at night the view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RedSlippers6
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Grand is a FANTASTIC place to stay. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, friendly & professional at all times. Our room had a brilliant view & we had paid to be on the Harbour Club floor - which is great value for money when it includes daily breakfast, afternoon tea & cocktails in the evening...no need for any other food really if you're on a tight budget. To top it off, my partner proposed at dinner on New Year's Eve & the hotel staff gave us top ups on our champagne for free & a bottle of champers to bring home to help us celebrate! A fantastic stay at a top notch hotel - don't even hesitate, just book it!

Reviews.Title: “A second excellent stay at the Harbour Grand”
Reviews.Author: joandgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grand for eight nights just before Christmas and were welcomed back to the the Club floor even though it was a year since our last stay. We received excellent service during our stay and would recommend upgrading to the Club floor, definitely value for money and personal service. We were happy with our room, not nearly as large as the one we had in Thailand but what do you expect in Hong Kong The area close to the hotel might not suit everyone but we like a 'local' area rather than a tourist area and there are several coffee shops and restaurants close at hand as well as lots of shops including a few up market shops in Electric Road.It's only two stops on the MTR or a short ride on the shuttle bus to Causeway Bay and all the big name shops in huge malls such as Times Square.You can also get a bus or a ding ding tram anywhere.We got a bus to Stanley Market and on another day to Aberdeen.Taxis are reasonable and you never have to wait more than a minute or two. One tip,my son booked a table at Cafe Too at the Island Shangri la Hotel for Sunday Brunch and it was excellent,one of the best buffet's I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views but small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JZ16
Reviews.Content: I booked a conve tion rate and then I upgraded to Club level. I regretted spending the extra 850 HKD (+10%) almost immediately. While the Club has a great view, the quality and selection of the food and drink were not worth it. Also some of the promised amenities were no where to be found. The location of the hotel is fine, just a short two blocks from the MTR. Rooms are small, heaven help you if there is a spouse or partner to share. You can also hear noise in hallway and in adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Inpersonal”
Reviews.Author: HarpendenVicar
Reviews.Content: Having flown half way round the world, a welcome other than we don't have your rooms anymore was not really what we were looking for. We asked for no smoking rooms, given I have asthma its kind of important. But due to the fact they were busy and we had booked a late arrival - can you arrive in Hong Kong from Europe early in the day??? They decided other customers were more worthy of our rooms even though we had already paid for them. We were travelling in a group of 5 people, including two children. We ended up on three different floors. The room they put us in was a smoking room even though it was upgraded to a suite. But it stank of smoke. And why put a kitchen in a bedroom if you dont include anything crockery, what a waste of space. The hotel is huge, inpersonal, you might as well be on a conveyor belt in a toothpaste factory.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong views”
Reviews.Author: Craig D
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with all rooms having an amazing view down Victoria Habour. The service is excellent with all your needs catered for. Enjoy the night skyline in the cocktail bar or visit the oriental restourant

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Juliusmarkwidadya
Reviews.Content: This is one of the recommended Hotel in HK that has reasonable prices, good breakfast, locate in the central HK, and larger room comparing amongst any hotel whom has equivalent prices in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: maldini3
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel with a fantastic lobby. Room was really good with the most fantastic pillows. The hotel was slightly out of the centre but still enjoyable. The pool was very nice and clean but a little warm. Would recommend anytime

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service and ideal location...”
Reviews.Author: nicegirl47us
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Hong Kong, the location is perfect being very close to the MTR station, bus and tram stops. On arrival we upgraded to a Club Room which is definitely worth doing - the deal includes a room on at least floor 36 and upwards with fantastic harbour views, then breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks with canapes from 6.00 - 8.00 pm are included in the room price (all in the Club Lounge on the 41st floor). The staff are friendly and attentive, the rooms are modern, comfortable and very clean - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with one unfortunate noisy problems”
Reviews.Author: ceewilky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan 2011 as a single traveller. It runs. Very handy and frequent coach service from Kowloon station to the hotel (K1 bus service) and also runs a small bus to the metro every 30 minutes which when you are settled and want to hit the town. The hotel itself is impressive- grand, sweeping, clean bright and with beautiful harbour views. The buffet breakfast is reasonable and plentiful (although I am used to London prices!) and the rooms are spacious. Staff incredibly attentive and friendly, I felt very welcome and valued as a customer. The lack of a barbs compensated by the lovely waterfront bar and restaurantbopposite the front entrance. There is however one point worth bearing in mind about this hotel and am sorry to even mention it because it had such fabulous potential - the noise in my room from adjacent rooms was not even funny! I was treated to a coughing. Woman in the room next-door on the first night, a screaming child (I really could hear every word) the second night, and was treated to the showers and toilet visits of those staying above me. I am sorry that this was the case because it really is a great hotel and it isn't something that the staff can help- their service was exemplary so this noise problem was such a shame. Finally, the hotel is sliiightlynout of the way but as mentioned above, the frequent shuttle service and plentiful taxis rectify this problem. In fact I really enjoyed a walk through nearby Wampoa and along the harbour front to the shops on Salisbury street so again i didnt consider this a real bugbear. TAKE EARPLUGS!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: yauany
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hong Kong during new year, fun city! Hong kong is definitely very convenient for tourist, the signs and directions are clear. The hotel service is great, but for the price i paid for, i think this is what i should get . And you have 12 choices of scented pillows or pillows that says can help you sleep better or good for your back and neck....very interesting, we chose no 7 and no 12 on the pillow list, but forgot to ask them which one is which, so we trying to smell the difference, but...they smell like the same...oh well, we did sleep very well tho. Also this hotel, has a airport shuttle bus from and to the airport, only HKD$150 per person, but if you are travelled more than one, definitely get a taxi, its only around HKD$350 from the hotel to airport. Hong Kong island, this side is less tourist, the area near the hotel is very quiet, not much going on; unlike kowloon; also, being very close to the Metro station is a big plus!! Overall, a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKarl
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Nice pool although a little warm'. Good bustling hotel lots of people watching to do. Nice room with fantastic view. Would recommend anytime..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: outofaustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive - the lobby is enormous. My room had harbour views (I have a feeling that all the rooms have harbour views). The bathroom was one of the best I've ever seen - so good that I even took a bath, and I'm not usually a bath kind of guy. The pool and gym are both excellent, modern and good facilities. No free wi-fi though. The hotel is less than 5 mins walk from Fortress Hill MTR station and it's possible to wheel suitcases all the way if necessary. Even though it's a good location, next time I would probably stay somewhere nearer to Central, where the shopping / restaurants are.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but the pool was too cold to swim in!”
Reviews.Author: aichii
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.Rooms are modern,bed was very comfortable, the pillow menu was a nice extra touch and the big bathroom with rainforest shower and separate bathtub was very impressive.(Housekeeping staff were especially efficient and nothing was too much trouble)As other reviewers have mentioned.....a few small mechanic shops between the hotel and the Fortress Hill MTR station...about 5 minutes walk away.There are many small restaurants and bakeries in the back streets near the hotel...and the Western Union money exchange on the way to the MTR station gave us a very good rate. If you are planning to go into the Central area then take the free hotel shuttle bus (First come first served)...and for the airport the shuttle will drop you off in front of the IFC CENTRAL TERMINAL.It was so convenient to check in here for our flight and for 160 dollars for 2 people you can take the Airport Express train to the airport.(The hotel might advise you to take a 150 dollar per person bus transfer each way to/from the airport) The outdoor (heated) swimming pool was the only real disappointment.It will close for a few months from the middle of January..but for us it was too cold to swim in December..even though the hotel staff said that it was over 20 degrees. Overall..well worth the money we paid..good harbour views from the room and take the tram car from in front of the MTR station to the end of the line (past North Point) to experience a local Hong Kong fruit,vegetable,meat and fish market....if you don't fancy battling the crowds near Hong Kong and Central stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Amazing City, Could not Fault!”
Reviews.Author: Angela_williams19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year Celebrations. We paid for the extra club floor privelages which believe you me, was well worth the extra cost! The service, free food, free drinks (soft & alcoholic) and views from the floor were absolutely beautiful. - I have stayed in many nice hotels accross the world, and this by far beats anything I have stayed in before, even the JW Marriott Mumbai. The rooms are not the biggest, but the views do make up for the lack of space. We stayed for 5 nights and the space was plenty big enough. Shower and Bath were so nice! - And a hotel room with a menu of pillows, is fine by me! - The cleaners of the hotel do such a good job, always busy and attentive, nothing was too much. The rooms were spotless and cleaned every morning to a high standard. The food (breakfast) was absolutely beautiful on the club floor, I cannot comment on the lower floors, but the club fllor was beautiful! Even the Eggs Benedict! Transport was close by this hotel, whether it be the MTR, Ferry's, Taxis or Complimentary Coaches, everything was easy to use, close by and dirty cheap!! This city is somewhere I would return in a heart beat, and I don't often say that about a place! It is beautiful, you have your tranquil area's, bustling city area's, cheap market area's and high end fashion area's. All of which are spotlessly clean and tidy!!! I cannot say enough good things about this hotel!! I think if you're reading this, your mind definately should be made up....NOW! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a good location”
Reviews.Author: TassidorDunedin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December for 5 nights.Beautiful hotel, very nice rooms. Also only 5 minutes walk to the underground station. Also only 5 minutes to McDonalds and Burger King for a cheap breakfast (if that is your thing). We saw 3 weddings in the hotel in the time we were there. They also have there own shuttle bus that takes you to shopping centers on Hong Kong Island. The best way to get to the hotel from the airport is by taxi. Cheap and convenient. We had 4 adults and 4 suitcases and one taxi took us all.

Reviews.Title: “Maggie,s veiws”
Reviews.Author: maggie w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harbour Grand on a three day stay stopover on our way to Australia. If you stay at this hotel it really is worth paying the extra to upgrade,we did and found ourselves on the 40th floor, were the view over the bay was out of this world. the hotel is very central for getting about.Transport is also very easy to use, the people are so friendly. A must see is the night market, AND definatly The PEEK. Try your hand at eating with chopsticks in the local restaunts, fabulous fun.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated yet Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Damian S
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the Harbour Grand is a very awesome hotel. We stayed for 14 nights after booking around five months ahead (getting a 15% discount too). After landing at the international airport we made our way to the hotel via the Airport Express and then the 'Island Line' to Fortress Hill. To get to the hotel, you have to exit the station from exit 'A', then cross the main road and walk down Oil Street for a little over three minutes. Though this is a very quick walk and very connivent; be prepared to walk through a very isolated part of Hong Kong (there is a car repair shop and also a waste treatment area you have to basically walk through). Once you get to the hotel, the lobby is amazing. Check in is simple (on the 41st floor if your in a Club Room) and if you get to the Hotel after 11.30am you should get the room depending on the time of year. The rooms are very large compared to some Hong Kong hotels, and are very moden and clean. If you want the internet, be aware that it's a HKD130 a day charge. This is an awkward hotel to recommend due to it's location, mostly due to being over 10 minutes train ride from the center of Hont Kong. If your either a solo travler, or a family with teenagers this would be a hotel to look at. Family's with young children and also business travellers note that the Harbour Grand is a long distance from anywhere and a different hotel might suit. Also for any couples, this is a good hotel due to it's luxurious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “ACCOUNTING SYSTEM ARCHAIC/EMBARRASSING.”
Reviews.Author: Rick B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotels New Year (2012) package, which included a number of things, but namely, the evening buffett and breakfast buffet. Our room (which was upgraded to a suite) was without a doubt one of the best we had ever stayed in definately 5 Star. But what let this hotel down was their cumbersome and archaic accounting/bill system, which went something like this: 1. On attending the New Years Eve buffet, you stopped at the reception area and quoted your room number, then escorted to your table - all good so far!! So the only thing you had to pay for was your drinks, sounds easy doesnt it?? But as your relaxing and enjoying your food, a female dressed in a Santas Costume approaches and produces a print out with your meal bill (remember already paid for) and your alcohol bill - by this stage I'd only had one beer. After explaining that youve paid for the meal, please check our room/account on your computer, I want to drink so more so give me our alcohol bill at the end of the evening. 2. Nope, you guessed it, some 15 mins later same lady returns for round 2, same paperwork, now outdated as Ive had two beers, insisting I sign it, then giving her the same explanation again. She then moves away to bother other guests. Similar arguments and grimacing as this just didnt make sense. 3. Now she's back again (on third beer) now go through step 1, step 2 and this time tell her to go away of I'll call the manager regarding her conduct/manner. Santas helper thinks this is all very funny and moves away again. 4. At this point in time, both my wife and I are really angry regarding this upsurd behaviour and billing system. Never have we encountered staff harrassing guests during meals to sign paperwork for meals already paid for or sign drinks bill/s when guests clearly havent finished drinking. 5. Most Hotels not just 5 Star Hotels which boast hosting international travellers, request your room number on entering the rest (to check payment/s) or if you have some coupon produce same at the rest reception. 6. Then at the completion of your meal, request your drinks bill then pay for same (or charge to your room), not pay for drink by drink!!! 7. Our overall experience at this hotel was tarnished by this crazy and embarrassing practise of annoying/harrassing guests whilst they are eating. We were not the only ones harrassed by Santas helper. And to top if off, this same practise of approaching/harrassing guests during their meals continued over to the breakfast buffet on new years day. 8. Really Harbour Grand Hotel, is this the practise of a 5 Star Hotel?? We wont stay nor eat at your hotel again. We dont care how great the room or view is, it just isnt worth this type of behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: djdTorfaenWales
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have recently returned from a three night stay at this amazing hotel.Everything from it's perfect location to the amazing views and fantastic rooms helped to make this a most memorable holiday.We had decided to book the executive package which proved to be worth every penny.The food was amazing, the staff were most attentive and the little extras made this a very special break indeed.The only downside was that we were there for such a short time.Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: maxeebob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days on the first leg of our 3 week holiday at the end of November.The immediate area is not very attractive but a few minutes walk and you are on a main road and the MRT station to take you where you want to go. Our room was very comfortable (if somewhat on the narrow side) with wonderful views of the harbour.Breakfast was very good and service quick and polite.This is a very good base for a Hong Kong visit and worth its 5 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Good service to relax”
Reviews.Author: ysugiura
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3nights and all staffs gave us excellent services during the stay. Harbour view was beautiful from club lounge and restaurant on 44F. Also, they gave us free upgrade to Suite room.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Club”
Reviews.Author: Choppercopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for a city break. Free transfer from HK Station to arrive in a opulent reception area. Upgraded to club which gave the 42 floor access to light meals. Fab views and a very nice breakfast. Location was grand for public transport. All in all 5 stars from me

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Service - Great Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: ms321
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in April 2011 at the corporate rate which was quite reasonable. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with lots of choices. Room was nice size with a harbor view, and the hotel looks brand new. Like the previous poster I would have thought the neighborhood was a bit sketchy, but it is Hong Kong, and my company's office is a block away in a Class A office building. And in a bit of serendipity, the tailor I used many times when I lived in Asia was still in business with the same phone number. He came over from TST and met me at the hotel the first morning I was there and made me a blazer which fit perfectly, and delivered it to the hotel as I was leaving for the airport the next afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't pick on it”
Reviews.Author: s00ki
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week under corp rate (about 1300hkd per night), good value for money. Consider the cost of hong kong hotel , this is not a bad choice with accessibility of being on HK island/MRT station. Stunning view from top restaurant. Staffs are helpful. Breakfast was ok. Rooms are quite small but good enough for couple. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel, great for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: BarryChoi
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night, so was not able to check out the neighborhood until the next morning. At first glance, the surrounding area seemd a bit shady, but on second viewing it was very close to the subway station, with Starbucks and other facilities nearby. The hotel is brand new, the rooms a bit small for the price tag. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with a wide variety of food. It's great for a business trip, although not sure about a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccommend - One of the best hotels in HK”
Reviews.Author: AussieTrvler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice this year. It is absolutely fantastic. We stayed in the club rooms and I highly recommend travelers pay the extra to do so. The breakfast, internet access, club lounge and free drinks make the extra cost worthwhile. The service we received has been exceptional both times. We had booked two rooms and upon arrival we were placed in rooms which were next to each other and given complimentary late checkout without even needing to ask. Further to this the concierge go out of their way to give outstanding personalized service. In fact the concierge recognized us from our previous stay. The breakfast is extremely good with a range of foods to satisfy everyone. The rooms are very very nice and include views across the harbor. The hotel is located very close to the MTR, in addition the area is very quiet which makes it ideal in order to get away from busy areas. There is also a fantastic cafe walking distance from the hotel. I have to note a special thanks to Kayan (I hope that is how you spell her name) and Leo who have gone out of their way to provide us with exceptional help and service at each of our stays. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again - It is one of my favorite hotels in HK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: demonchild
Reviews.Content: stayed 1 week in this hotel .the rooms are very nice had a good view of harbour. located down the road from mrt station there are plenty of shops around the area to eat.the room had a big bath whuch i took advantage of.i would definatley stay here again .the breakfast was not too bad but expensivearoun $30 au so i only had twice there is a little shop down the road which i used for the rest of my stay cost about$10 au.the staff at the hotel were very polite helpful and friendly .i cannot find any faults with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great except cashier”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTrottersChina
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with view, often crowded; swimming pool and expensive spa, clean and modern room. Bad cashier experience twice looking for charging extra costs like minbar not used or Internet while already included in the room rate. They even back charge using your credit card without your agreement after your check out. Be aware!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to use as a base for a visit”
Reviews.Author: MeltonJerry
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel at the end of November 2011. We upgraded to the Club rooms which was tremendous value at the price quoted to us. It added breakfast, internet, club rooms, a lounge on 41st floor, coffee and soft drinks all day, early evening cocktails, hot canapes and afternoon tea. We found it well worth the money. The only reason they don't get five stars is that we were woken a couple of nights by a noise from close to our room. The management did investigate but had not resolved it before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Health hazzard”
Reviews.Author: Banksp
Reviews.Content: We found dried blood on our bed sheets, holes in the sheets and for all this when we complain the management of the hotel do not apologize and it takes forever to get the sheets changed !!! When we asked room service for clean cups he went in our bathroom swilled them out near the toilet and passed them out as clean .... Health hazard from beginning to end....

Reviews.Title: “Club Lounge is the best....”
Reviews.Author: Travebug
Reviews.Content: our room was a let down. I booked a Grand Deluxe Harbour View room, and we looked at buildings! Our friends on a higher floor, in a cheaper room had a better view than us. The room - very small, badly laid out, with a minuscule bathroom. not much light either real or even with all the lights turned on. Beds were comfy, and at least the room was spotlessly clean. The good - we LOVED the Club Lounge. The food, drinks, breakfast and view were beyond spectacular. despite what I have to say about the room, it's worth staying here for the club benefits.

Reviews.Title: “really, really horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: objective_feedback
Reviews.Content: If you can sense someone being dishonest with you, you won't enjoy staying at this hotel. If you don't like hotel staff who have an expectation that you will spend more than just the room booking, and if you don't like their attitude that they can just take it from you, you really won't enjoy this hotel. If you don't like leaving a hotel with the feeling that some surprise charge is going to be taken off your credit card, definitely don't stay here. If you do stay in this hotel, and you have any complaint, don't waste your time telling the staff. They don't care. If you ask for a manager, the front desk girl lies and tells you she is the manager. If you ask her to fix something, she says she can't. In my mind, that's not the definition of a manager: a manager is someone who takes responsibility, but these people just make excuses. Every day, we saw people having arguments with front desk staff about surprise charges at checkout, and each day, we were even more miserable as we anticipated what tactics they would try on us, as we continued to observe the way other guests were mistreated.
