If you are traveling on business and your company doesn't care what unexpected charges the hotel puts on your corporate credit card, however, you will still be disappointed: although the hotel has a glamorous lobby and nice pictures on the web site, the rooms are a bit tacky and worn, with dark colors and a feeling that they are half-heartedly trying to preserve some feeling from the 1990s.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here : )))))))”
Reviews.Author: matt999west
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now - day 3 of 5. Sometimes it is best to have a short journey to your hotel as you get to see the real people and places with the added bonus of better value for money and that's exactly what I have experienced here. The views of the harbour are fantastic, the place is very clean and posh and I feel like we are in a special place that is not too stuffy. The staff have been really helpful. I asked the house-keeper for an extra bottle of complimentary water on the first day and now every time I see him he rushes off to get me more! We were unsure if we should upgrade to the Club Floor when we arrived (£40 per night) but so glad we did. The Club Lounge has the best views and such a special place to have breakfast. Included is brekky, afternoon tea, happy hour cocktails (18:00 - 20:00), Scooby snacks during happy hour, soft drinks and beers all day (help yourself from a glass fridge) and internet (only one device, additional ones are extra). The room size is just fine, not huge but there are a lot smaller in Hong Kong and again the views are amazing. There is a lot of construction work going on towards the harbour, just in front of the hotel and the noise is more obvious if you are around the pool area but it has not bothered us at all and I would certainly not let it put you off staying here. I spent months trying to pick the "right hotel" and I am so glad that we are staying here; it has made our holiday very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranlew
Reviews.Content: In October 2011 we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in a Harbour Club Harbour View room and had a wonderful stay. The first two rooms, while excellent, were not to our particular liking but we were able to change to a great room that suited our requirements. The staff were more than happy to see that we were satisfied with our lodgings. Throughout our stay the staff provided excellent service. In particular my wife and I would like to thank Buta, Mika, Smile, Leo and Karen. Our room and the Club room provided excellent views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon including the laser night shows. The Hotel is very conveniently located a few minutes walk to the Fortress Hill MTR. Using the MTR for our return trip to the airport was especially convenient as we were able to check-in our luggage at Central Station and not have to worry about our luggage until our next destination. For us, this was a great hotel and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, but not completely smooth.”
Reviews.Author: Promethium P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-October 2011 with some extended family. Most of us had standard rooms though one family was upgraded to a suite. Overall the place looks fantastic- fancy lobby, pool area, restaurants. The bathrooms in each room are glass-front with fancy fixtures and a walk-in shower. This is where we found the style-vs-substance start to become a problem. The faucets are to the side of the sink, which would be fine as a design choice except that somehow water just seemed to get all over the counter. Our walk in shower was lovely, except that the water never fully drained from the floor. Towels and toiletries were basic, actually a little less nice than what I would have expected. The rest of the rooms themselves were ok. We had rooms with two doubles, which was somewhat laughable because the beds were literally about 3 inches apart from one another. Beds and pillows were comfortable and towels were plush. Views from the rooms all seemed to be great harbour views. The suite was obviously larger, had a meeting table and full kitchen, but didn't appear to be all that much nicer. We found the location to be great. We weren't looking for a tourist/ex-pat bar scene/designer shops. This is a hotel in a real peoples' neighborhood in HK and we appreciated that. It's within easy walking distance to MTR stations, and near the stations are plenty of places to eat (fast food, bakery, congee-and-noodles type of restaurants). There were even multiple grocery stores to choose from to get snacks and drinks. Because of all the local activity we never felt unsafe. We went out at night to local restaurants, got up early and went to fruit stands and small cafes. Slightly to the east is Victoria Park. We even walked through the park back to the hotel after a late dinner out and felt completely safe. Service was a huge disappointment. One of the families we travelled with wanted to change rooms (to be on the same floor as another family) which first staff seemed to accommodate by offering to have the switch made and luggage moved. However later that day we arrived back to find them claiming to have no record of such a thing. The family was even dealing with the exact same individual whom they had talked to that morning! It was straightened out eventually. More disappointing was the concierge. They gave undesirable information (advising one family to take a cab up to Victoria Peak, rather than the much more popular double decker bus ride and Peak Tram!), or were just plain wrong. Ie told us that Maxim's at City Hall was open for dim sum in the morning on a weekday. We even called the restaurant to verify; when we noted that nobody answered the phone the concierge said "Oh, they just don't take reservations." Our family wasted significant vacation time because of that. Paying for internet at all was really ridiculous when theoretically you could just go to the nearby McDonald's and use theirs (with a purchase). It was also relatively expensive. That being said, it was fast and easy to connect. Overall, it was clean and stylish, and generally we were satisfied with our stay. However, for the amount we paid we were expecting much more professional service and more functional rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Amazing hotel and view”
Reviews.Author: aw2010
Reviews.Content: This was the third and final hotel of our Asian holiday and was a perfect hotel and finish a perfect holiday. I'd read some of the other posts on here and was a little concerned about the service and the distance but we found the hotel to be in a great location with breathtaking views. We took the airport express to Hong Kong station and picked up the free airport express shuttle bus. The hotel is stop two so its just over 15 minutes from the station. We had paid for a club level room so when we arrived we were taken up to the lounge on the 41st floor and given a welcome drink by Jay, the lounge host, while we completed the formalities. Our bags were automaticaly taken to our room for us. The hotel is very close to Fortress Hill MTR station, around a 5 minute walk to the station, with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Some other trip advisors have noted the immediate area being a little tatty. There is a garage opposite the hotel which is a bit dirty, but the area is safe and busy. We booked a harbour view room on the club floor which offers an amazing view of Hong Kong Island, Kowloon and the harbour. The view from the club floor is simply stunning. The room is smaller than the other hotel rooms on our holiday, but that was to be expected given we were stopping in an expensive city. The bathroom has a walk in bathtub which was very enjoyable after a day walking around, rainfall shower and high end complementary toiletries. The AC was very powerful which was a big plus! We had breakfast each morning in the club lounge which offered a good selection of hot and cold food, both western and asian. Eggs are made to order and was a selection including eggs benedict, scrambled, omlette and fried. During the afternoon an afternoon tea was provided, which included sandwiches, desserts and hot food, together with hot and cold drinks. Of an evening canapes were provided along with alcoholic drinks. After a tiring holiday this really was the best of the three hotels we stopped at. The service from all the staff was exemplary, nothing was too much trouble and the staff were friendly, polite and helpfull whenever we needed anything. The food was of a very high standard, and there was a varied selection every day. And finally, the views both during the day and night were amazing. One minor point, and in agreement with other tripadvisors, you would really expect a hotel of this quality to provide free wifi/broadband. As we were in a club room we could access wifi for free in the lounge, but we would have had to pay for access in our room. The costs quoted were extremely high so this is something to be mindful of. We will make this our hotel of choice whenever we visit Hong Kong again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “grrreat hotel”
Reviews.Author: myrtal
Reviews.Content: We had a hiccup on check-in confusion with room booked but once sorted had a grrreat stay, we booked a club room, well worth paying the extra the room on 37th floor views great across Victoria Harbour and the light show nightly, breakfast afternoon tea and evening wine and nibbles till 8pm, also tea,coffee, soft drinks and bottled beer till 11pm, this was perfect and made our stay, the staff in the club lounge were fab!! It is a couple of minutes walk to the station and there are shuttle busses to the central.Hongkong transport is one of the best we've ever used. The street it is on is a bit of an eye sore with garage workshops working all hours, but that was no problem the hotel more than made up for it, the pool was a welcome oasis in such a busy city, and a nice place to relax after a mad day, All in all the Harbour Grand is Grreattttt

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CJHa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Harbour Grand and had a great time. The room was wonderful, bathroom had a great sunken bath, we were upgraded at no extra cost (they did try to charge us but we just said no and as they didn't have any other rooms we had the upgrade). Breakfast are good and set you up for a day exploring Hong Kong, they are expensive but we had paid for B&B maybe go somewhere else if you haven't taken this option. The hotel is within easy access of the MTR and the Trams (definitely take a tram if you have a bit more time and see the sites and you travel). We ate in the 180 restaurant, the food is good quality and the service was excellent, the prices are a little expensive but you are paying for the views and they are definitely worth it. Definitely will go again

Reviews.Title: “Large and best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PunitKumar
Reviews.Content: The place is huge. The rooms on upper floors really offer Great view. The location is central.

Reviews.Title: “Business Visit... Annoying Niggles!”
Reviews.Author: OLPOL
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is great. Large, well appointed rooms and good facilities. It is a bit barn-like with high ceilings and big public spaces, and a lot of marble. However, 1. Daily Internet charge, which is really unnecessary on a $200 room- and annoys business users. 2. Internet charge for EACH device- i ended paying double for my Ipad one day. 3. Location was not an issue as taxis are cheap, BUT on one morning we waited 40 minutes for a taxi as the hotel is a bit off the beaten track. 4. Went on an evening tour on advice of Concierge. The tour consisted of swapping busses a couple of times and trip of hotel pickup points. Amateur. All in all, it was FINE as a back-up, but would probably look elsewhere next time. Not quite sure who the hotel is aimed at, but if a business market, it needs to step up.

Reviews.Title: “Taking advantage of travellers”
Reviews.Author: YBarlow
Reviews.Content: Nothing is granted to you at this hotel - separate wi-fi charges for each device used, laptop and iPad! Beware of this. Full breakfast charge even though I only had coffee (ok, my choice, but the buffet was far from appealing). The location means stepping over hoses, pumps and oil drains enroute to metro. This is a hotel to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New Hotel with Great Value and Views”
Reviews.Author: RNG1008
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel in HK with harbor views. But service is sub-par and not comparable to a western hotel chain's equivalent of 4.5 or 5 stars. My wife and I stayed here earlier this year, primarily because of the fantastic rate we found. The location is convenient to the MTR (subway system) but quite frankly it's not ideal for a first-time visitor to HK. For those who have been to HK before and is familiar with the city already (we go once a year), then it's much less of an issue. Worth considering, IF, the price is right. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Booked Harbour Grand HK despite several TA comments about location. We did not find the location to be that out of the way or problematic. Yes there is an auto detailing shop across the street, but there are a sufficient number of cafes, restaurants, shops, bars, etc to meet most needs within easy walking distance. The Fortress Hill neighborhood is not Central, so don't expect the slick, luxury goods stores. It feels like a neighborhood where everyday HK residents live so in that sense we found it refreshing. But there are two Starbucks nearby, several interesting local noodle bars, etc so we didn't feel deprived. The walk to MTR is easy and the ride into Central is quick. As for the hotel itself, it is quite nice. Rooms have a luxurious feel, beds are comfortable and the views are excellent. We found the service to be very good too, particularly the concierge desk which was quite helpful during our stay. Only minor complaints are design-related. Grand, over the top opulent lobby with soaring ceilings, gaudy lighting and marble has virtually nowhere to sit down. I've never seen such a huge lobby with no seating. Was meeting a colleague one morning and waited thirty minutes with nowhere to sit - can't imagine what they were thinking. Likewise, two minor design flaws in the rooms - the shower/tub is quite large and works well but it is extremely difficult to get into. You have to slide open a glass shower door and then step into the tub over a roughly 18-24" high wall into the tub. This is awkward and would be very concerned about an elderly person attempting it. Also the single oval sink has the spout and handles on the side, not behind the sink, which makes it quite awkward to reach one of the handles. Basically you have to reach over the spout or put your hand through the water to reach it. Once again, chalk it up to what were they possibly thinking? But on balance a very good stay with a very professional staff, and I am returning again in January.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable views”
Reviews.Author: fec1
Reviews.Content: The lobby for the hotel is exceptional and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. We had our room upgraded and had the most wonderful view of the harbour. If you are staying, you must go and have dinner or a drink in the bar on the top floor, the 180 degree views and floor to ceiling windows really are spectacular (as our the views from the pool). The location is a bit further out than some other hotels but it takes 10 mins on the metro to get into central hong kong and the metro system is very easy to use and cheap as well. Definitely worth staying and have the pancakes fro breakfast-yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless hotel and rooms but very few services available unless you upgrade to a club room.”
Reviews.Author: petmadness
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are amazingly clean but prices for eating in are excessive even by Hong Kong standards. Sizes of rooms are as to be expected for a large city and room service was excellent. The hotel is not in a central location so is good if you like a quieter location and is only a few minutes from fortress hill MTR. If you want to eat out then an MTR or taxi ride will be needed but travel prices in the city are very cheap. Lovely hotel if you are prepared to travel a few stops but if you like to be at the centre of things then this is not the place for you. It is also a popular place for local weddings so if you want to people watch and get into some local traditions Henie is fascinating to sit in the lobby or bar and watch the goings on around you - especially looking at what fluffy toys have been hose to tie to the front of the bridal cars!

Reviews.Title: “Best of both world at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: FayCheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in August. We also met up for a few days with a cousin of mine. They had both been here before so I had a distinct advantage. The hotel is set in an area where local people work. It will not appeal to everyone so if you prefer to be nearer to high end shops then central will be more to your taste. We love the area as we got to see local businesses and people go about their daily lives. Such lovely, hardworking and cheerful people. We never felt any fear no matter what time of day we were out and about. My only advice on that score is be careful on the mrt at rush hour times. The mrt is a stones throw away from the hotel and is a cheap and wonderful way to get round HK. The old Government buildings opposite the hotel are to be demolished so that will mean that there will be a better outlook. Once inside the hotel it's a different world. I can only review the club floor as we paid the extra money and boy was it worth it to have that extra luxury. The room wasn't so big but in such a highly populated place you could n't expect it to be. It was very clean and there were a good array of toiletries. The newpaper arrived each am in a velvet bag. There was fruit every day and compementary water. It was our anniversary whilst we were there and we arrived to a lovely rose on the bed. Ten minutes later we received a complentary bottle of champagne and a card from the management. So far we loved it We were on the 37th floor and the club lounge was on the 41st floor so you got the best views while you tucked into breakfast. Eggs were done to order. Afternoon tea was included with the club perks and was very welcome after a long day sightseeing or shopping. There is also a buffet at night . Cocktails and wine is served between 6pm and 8pm. Beer and soft drinks are served all night and the buffet is repenished till about 8pm. I only drink wine so the lovely Gloria who looked after us made sure that I had wine if we arrived late. The other hostesses are wonderful to and make sure that you want for nothing. This can be anything from booking a meal or taxi to help with planning a trip. Daniel one of the concierge on the front desk in the lobby was wonderful to us and always gave us extra info when we were going to say the peak. he told us to go up on the bus and down on the tram. Then told us about the area we then found ourselves and what there was to see, buy and eat. There is a outdoor swimming pool and gym. I only used the pool but the gym looked in good order. We didn't actually eat in the hotel restaurant and I think it was mega expensive(188). The only part of this hotel I didn't like was leaving and even then late at night Gloria came down and saw us off with a hug

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: R A
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great, but has a long way to go in meeting expectations for the prices charged across the hotel. Food is overpriced, the extra 10% service charge on everything makes it even worse and then if you still don't feel like you've paid enough, there's space for more tips on the bills they present. Unbelievable. I don't mind the location as it's a chance to get away from the busy parts of Hong Kong, but would not suit anyone who likes to shop, as it's far away from the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “bad location”
Reviews.Author: dan934
Reviews.Content: this hotel is far from everything You need to take a taxi to go everywhere. Not a nice area to walk around. May sound a good investment for the owner because of the development going on, but until then , keep away from that hotel. In the corridor they must keep the blinds down to hide the view of old and poor buildings facades Our upgraded room was quite small. A big plus though: the huge bath which I prefer to the pool...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MyBoyBlu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for business. Chose this hotel as it was walking distance from office in North Point. Got upgraded to Premier Suite on check-in, which was a very good size - particularly for Hong Kong - with large living room, nice bathroom, and panoramic views of Hong Kong Harbour. The hotel is relatively new and very comfortable, with a really nice bed in the rooms. It's priced lower than comparable hotels on Hong Kong Island and I would recommend it for value. Fortress MTR is a 3 minute walk away - although I would recommend checking directions before traveling as it's not obvious how to get to hotel when you walk out of MTR station the first time. Breakfast is okay not great. Wifi worked well although did cost around SGD20 per day in addition to the room price. I only have three small complaints during my stay: first, I went to the hotel bar on top floor for an evening drink at around 11pm, but was told there was no room - even standing at the bar - which i found strange considering i was a paying guest of the hotel. Second, there are different lifts for different floors, which makes it awkward if you are visiting a friend/colleague staying in the same hotel. Also, the lifts were very slow. Third, I tried calling room service three times during my stay, and all three times noone answered the phone. I had to call front desk and ask them to have room service call me back, which was frustrating. But otherwise, a good value option for North Point and somewhere I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst !!!Hotel In HongKong”
Reviews.Author: truman W
Reviews.Content: Horrible serivice and management ever!!!!! It was really unpleasant stay in this hotel! The hotel told us that breakfast was included in the accomodation fee at beginning. But charged us extra 200 dollars per day per person when we checked out. Thats a lot of money. I cant belive it was happend in 4 star hotel. When we argued about this, they palmed me of with some like manager is not here sort of rubbish excuse! Most unbeliveble thing is 3 days later, Since they copy my credit card when I checked in. They directly draw the money without giving any decent explaination!!! Do not trust this hotel!! Its a shame of HongKong

Reviews.Title: “Club floor rooms worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Felicity L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grand for 5 nights in October 2011. There were 4 adults and we had 2 club floor rooms. The staff on the club floor made our holiday and stay at the Harbour Grand incredibly enjoyable. On arrival after 12hours travelling we were sitted in the club lounge and provided warm finger food and wine whilst we completed our check on procedures. It was very welcome given that we had arrived late and had been fed very little on our travels that day. Karen on the club floor reception could not have been more helpful even arranging 4 massages for us at 930pm we were impressed. Yes the hotel is a little out of the way but the Fortress Hill Mtr station makes that not an issue. We found the rooms to be clean and we did experience turn down service. We would definately stay again. The hotel views of the harbour are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Becky186470
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Really super.

Reviews.Title: “when can i move in?”
Reviews.Author: PrestonGeorge
Reviews.Content: pa for the upgrade to the lounge. well worth it. what a lovely relaxing stay. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: jaynemary
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 weeks as my husband had business in HK. Its a very large hotel with a stunning lobby and it is very clean and new looking. The rooms are luxurious with amazing views of Victoria Harbour,they contain large flatscreen. T.V's and plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space, there is also the all important safe.The bathrooms are very luxurious with a very useful range of freebies, e.g comb, toothbrushes with mini pastes, lovely toiletries. The beds are massive and very comfy my persistent lower backache has gone since I stayed here.We ate in their 188 restaurant with its stunning views, however this is an expensive thing to do, the food is good but the portions are small and the choice is poor if you don't want fish or meat. My husband and I had just drinks one night and paid £45 for 3 very small wines and a beer.This is not a restaurant for the children they won't like the food choices. We had no breakfast in our room rate and this was not a problem, we got hot breakfast outside and also there are an abundance of pastry shops.The area is fine, I did some of my best shopping locally and Fortress Hill MTR is very close, you are in Central in minutes.There are a couple of laundries nearby, I was getting a big bag of clothes washed and ironed for less than £2.50, in just a few hours. the laundry prices in the hotel are ridiculous and for people with more money than sense if we had used the hotel laundry we would have paid close to £150 instead of the £7.50 we did pay.Its is very easy to get cabs directly outside the hotel there is a constant stream of them. The lifts are fast and efficient and the concierge is charming and professional.Doors are opened for you all the time and the staff are very polite and helpful. Housekeeping are discreet and thorough.I have read people moaning about the area, a few mechanics on the road outside, honestly, this is rubbish, its great and like all HK very safe,, loads of shops and places to eat nearby even a Starbucks and Macdonalds just down the road. Everything is available in HK.The only negative is some of the reception staff have poor English, It took nearly 45 mins to complete checkin and after a 13 hour flight this was not fun, I think if you scratch the surface with the receptionists you will come across some problems. A special mention to Lily Yung who was beyond helpful when one of my sons fell off the bed and caught his head on a desk and had to have 5 stitches at the local hospital, be careful of the beds, they are that bouncy.The lobby staff can arrange trips and China visa's, It has been a marvellous stay and we would definately return, my husband has loved it and he is a good benchmark as he moans a lot and likes things done well, he has loved the pool and the way the rooms are laid out with Feng Shui principles in mind. I can confidently recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.Shame about the weather”
Reviews.Author: svwallis
Reviews.Content: we had booked a grand deluxe room with breakfast included but upgraded to a premier room.on arrival. were on 36th floor with view of causeway bay.central and kowloon.This was spectacular.Room spotless and large as HK standards go.As others have said easy travel with hotel shuttlehourly to HK station/MTR metro 2-3 mins walk away/tram/taxis close by and available .Area different with car maintenance shops and a bath tub chained to a pole used to clean car parts.Buffet breakfast so abundant did not need lunch.Small restaurants nearby for supper.All hotels seem to charge exorbitant prices for drinks so didn't have any in the hotel.Staff mainly charming and helpful so surprised by negative reviews.Would love to return to HK sometime and see it in sunshine.It rained for all but 3 hours out of 4 days there.went to stanley by bus/peak tram/star ferry/ladies market/temple and china club so packed a lot in.This hotel is a bit cheaper than others of same rating I think in view of location but transport so easy I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “An unpolished gem with service to forget”
Reviews.Author: Shawn L
Reviews.Content: Was testing this place as a possible corporate hotel. Surprisingly, it failed terribly from the time I walked up to the front desk. This is really the place where it makes or breaks the first impression, and in this case, it absolutely broke it for me. The front desk executive took more than 15mins to process and allocate my room reservations. They messed up my colleague's room and could only assign one room after a long 20mins. My reservation was for a non-smoking room, but upon exiting the lift, the whole corridor smelled "smoking floor" to me. The assigned room was no different. Went down to request for a room change and was asked (the first time in my 12 years of business travels) to sign a "room change request" form! This was totally unexpected and unheard off! What more from a 4/5 star hotel? Never was my impression of a hotel in Hong Kong so poor. I've stayed at Marco Polo (The Gateway and The Hong Kong), The Langham Kowloon, Novotel (Hong Kong and Citygate) and Intercontinental and never once did I experience such service. Breakfast service, food selection and quality were all lacking. Only thing that was very prompt and urgent was the bill signing. The sous chef (giving the chap too much credit) was not interested in cooking noodles and decided to close the station whislt maintaining the eggs station. Terribly disappointing. Rooms were clean, but small. No "turn down" service in all my 4 days there. Something that I thought was rather strange given the "class" of the hotel. Lobby lounge staff were above the way-below average service standards. The thing that really "aced" it all was when a bell hop told me that there were no more umbrellas for guess (yes, it was raining daily during my stay.....sounds really dramatic). Whilst at the hotel driveway deliberating my next means of travel, low and behold, another hotel guess walked out with a new hotel umbrella in hand. I went back in and demanded an umbrella from the concierge manager and "surprisingly" was rewarded with one. I could really go on and on and on.... This place really lacks service and quality control. Absolutely nothing like what the other guest have written regarding the Harbour Grand Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay at End of 10 day trip”
Reviews.Author: George R
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after extensive research to end a 10 day business trip in China. we wanted a place to relax for a day before flying back to the US. There was a slight problem during check-in regarding free internet service, but Angel handled this within 45 minutes and everything was corrected. My business partner had a slight water problem in his room upon check-in , and this was corrected in 10 minutes. We booked club level floor, and the personal service we received from Angel was exceptional. The Harbour Club has magnificent views from the 41st floor, and the restaurant next door the same. The breakfast and evening drinks are excellent, and are well worth staying on the club level. The concierge service was extremely helpful in helping review my one day sightseeing agenda. The metro station(Fortress Hill) is only 2 minutes away and from there you can get just about anywhere hassle-free. The MTR system is one of the best I have ever been on anywhere. The view from the Harbor View room was very nice. The room was small in sq. ft.but exceptional in other ways. Overall, a great hotel experience, and I stay in many hotels over the course of 12 months and rarely write reviews. Not cheap, especially on the Club Floors, but relative to Hong Kong prices in genera, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: soptulka
Reviews.Content: As you step into the Harbour Grand you will feel like you're walking into the Ritz in London. They always say '1st impression counts' and this did it for me. From then on i just enjoyed every minute of it as we didnt stay long enough. Amazing view from the French restaurant called '360 degrees' - hence the gorgeous view that speaks for itself. You can also watch magical 'the Light show' thats usually @8pm. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: golisw
Reviews.Content: From the floor to ceiling windows in the rooms and bathroom, the pool, and 180 view resturant. Don't wear sandals to restaurant! Most places actually need.closed toe shoes. Views of the harbor and skyline. Good metro location. On metro line to shopping etc. on HK island. The suite had a dinning room table and microwave, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Die richtige Wahl fuer einige tolle Tage.”
Reviews.Author: Lutz R
Reviews.Content: Sehr gepflegtes Hotel dass dem 5 Sterne Anspruch immer gerecht wird. Tolle Zimmer mit Blick auf Hong Kong und Kowloon gleichzeitig. Ausblick aus der Bar Le188 - 41 Stock jederzeit sentationell. Der Harbour Club verwoehnt gegen einen Zuschlag mi Fruehstueck und permamenten Getraenke Service in der Lounge im 41. Stock. Direkte Naehe, max 5 Min zu Fuss zu U-Bahn, Bus und Tram (sehr zu empfehlen) Das Harbour Cafe bietet das beste Buffet in Hong Kong (wir probierten auch renomierte wie Shangri-La). Das Hotel bietet eine wahrlich Top Preis Leistung.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: FiMillar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic staff, excellent value. Great location (don't be put off by autoshops and building works nearby). Easy access to MTR and good choice of shops nearby

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely Stay On Hong Kong Island"”
Reviews.Author: Lissielou71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong. All rooms have views of Victoria Harbour and the location of the hotel is close to the Fortress Hill MTR in North Point which was a 2 minute walk up the road. Staff were very friendly and the rooms were lovely and modern being only 2 years old. Breakfast was good plenty on offer and the pool was great. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boulevard of Broken Dreams”
Reviews.Author: Gough08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 3yr-old child stayed at the Harbour Grand for 5 nights in September. We were there for business and needed to be close to a friend who could babysit our son for a couple of days, so we chose the Harbour Brand based on proximity and hotel reviews. This review is quite wordy but I wanted to detail the particular events that occurred so people can have all the facts prior to making their booking. We stayed in a Premier Harbour View room which was around AUD$1650 for 5 nights and did not include breakfast. We requested an early check-in and when we arrived we were offered a room on a smoking floor until our non-smoking room was ready at the regular check-in time of 2pm. We were happy to be accommodated and arrived at our room and immediately ordered room service - wagyu beef burgers and 2 japanese beers - Asahi if I recall correctly. The meals arrived however the beers were Budweiser and the beef patty was slightly undercooked although tasty. We fell asleep for several hours and woke around 3.30pm - I called the front desk to inquire about our original room and we were informed that it was still not ready. As we were going out we said we could relocate when we returned in the evening. We returned around 7pm and immediately went to the front desk to organise our relocation. They said someone would call us in half an hour to relocate us. So we trooped upstairs - half an hour later the call came to inform us that someone would be at our room shortly to relocate us. Another 15-20 minutes ticked by - our son was ready to fall asleep and we made another call to check on what was happening. They assured us someone was on their way and again we waited another 10-15mins. My husband then went downstairs to see what was happening and make a complaint and 5 minutes later a bell-boy arrived and we were relocated to our original designated non-smoking room. I had requested a roll-away bed for my son but this was not present in the room and I didn't bother to ask for it as he was ready to fall asleep so he slept with us in the king bed. When my husband complained the response was that the hotel was extremely busy and hence the delay. The following day I was contacted by the Guest Services manager to discuss what had happened and he acknowledged that the level of service we received was not acceptable and we were offered a late (6pm) check-out as recompense. As we did not require a late checkout I asked for a car service to the airport on departure - this turned out to be a long-winded journey on a very tired-looking airport shuttle bus rather than the private car service I had envisaged. In the interim we enjoyed good customer service although room service meals were consistently served with missing items that were specified on the menu. Also for the entire duration of our stay there was only white bread available - all other bread options specified on the room service menu were not to be seen for reasons unknown. The hotel was well located for MTR services (nearest station Fortress Hill) however access by taxi was difficult as it resides in a rabbit warren of one-way lanes. Consequently waiting for taxis was also fraught as the only available taxis were those dropping off people to the hotel - there was not a steady run of vacant taxis on offer. I waited for half an hour one morning with my son from about 8.10am. Our overall experience of this hotel for AUD$330 a night was disappointing. Whilst there were many good qualities including good customer service response (apart from the first day) there were too many mistakes/issues to overlook and for the amount we paid I expected more bang for our buck - there was nothing complimentary included and the recompense offered for the poor service received on Day 1 was a little insulting. Based on our experience we would be hard-pressed to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the moment..”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneKerry
Reviews.Content: We are on club floor! Its the first time we have ever done Club and yes well worth it! Other than one lunch out we have not had to buy meals out... The breakfast while not a huge selection it is still very good and so quite. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or Club floor. The staff are so lovely, speak wonderful English and go out of their way to make you feel special!! We found it no problem to get around from here. We were here while the typhoon hit ( category 8 ) all shops and transport shut down for day and again was well looked after and we sat in out on the 41st floor watching from our comfy chair with staff reassuring us that all was well. Special mention to Leo for amazing customer service in club lounge as well. Sadly bye from HK and harbor grand. Kerry

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wardyp
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning and we were amazed at the welcome we received. Originally booked a club room but we were upgraded to a suite on the 39th floor which had sensational views over HK harbour. Hotel is only 2 years old and in a good location. Exceptional service, close to MTR and free shuttle bus, will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Enjoyed the Harbour Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: negli99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November 2010. Our group consisted of 2 adults and 1 child in each room. We enjoyed our stay here very much. The complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails made the stay very enjoyable. Complimentary coffee, tea, juice, soda and beer were always available in the lounge as were computers and free wifi. We took taxis and the MTR to go to different attractions. The outdoor heated swimming pool was very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Lush and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Jen9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. I am not a frequent guest in five star hotels, and I thought the service was impeccable from start to finish. The location is not central, but there are taxis and MTR, so if you are sightseeing you may head out for the whole day so it doesn't matter. The building, entrance, glass panels make for a grand welcome. The breakfast restaurant is located at the front so overlooks the harbour. Breakfast is spectacular with everything you want and didn't know you wanted. We had a double room looking out of the harbour spectacular uninterrupted views, was just magnificant. Then there is the pool on the roof - WOW! Lovely pool to relax in and lounge about. The room was great - lovely double bed, sitting chair all the things you need. We arrived late to check in and were exhausted, however to met by welcoming and friendly staff made it easier to cope with our fatigue.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Comaxco
Reviews.Content: the Harbor Grand is a really good hotel with reasonable prices, good service and very friendly staff. For families they offer rooms with 3 beds, most of their rooms have harbor view. They have a nice roof top bar, with sensational view in the evening. Breakfast is good with a large choice of international and asian food. The pool is nice and has harbor view, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerryShropshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear for five nights from the 29th August. This hotel was very clean and had a beautiful lobby. Checking in was very quick and easy and we were soon in our room. The room was on the 28th floor and overlooked the harbour and we had plenty of room. We had lots of advice and any requests were dealt with speedaly. This hotel was in a very convenient place close to the underground station and plenty of food outlets close too. We found it more than comfortable and their was always a beautiful smell in the air. We used the pool the sauna and steam room when we had time all of which were clean and well kept. Very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy on the outside, poorly run on the inside - Not worth the money and the stress!”
Reviews.Author: SweetKell
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've stayed on my Asia tour this summer. The property has a fancy building that overlooks the harbour, and a nice website. To be fair, the hotel is conveniently located nearby the MTR station. But, that is about it. The front desk people spoke poor English (Yes, English is official language in Hong Kong), and they were really not nice. My husband and I have requested a non-smoking and king bedroom prior to our arrival, but the room was not granted to us. We asked again when we arrived, and the front desk lady said, "Oh, we can't accommodate everyone." When I asked the concierge about the Airport Express bus schedule, the guy didn't explaining anything and handed out a peice of paper with the time chart. As a frequent traveler, this was a real let down. The hotel staff really need to be retrained. Amenities in the room were really strange as well. The mirror in the bathroom hung too low, which made it difficult to use the basin. The bathroom has a rain shower head..but the drainer did not drain as fast as the water fell down. We tried to put up with the bad service at the hotel, but we just couldn't.. so we moved to another hotel for the rest of our stay. This hotel is like a fake designer purse that belongs to the china town - fancy look outside and poor quality inside. Definitely not worth the money and the stress (especially when you are traveling..!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bnetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club floors for 4 nights in September 2011. The main lobby of the hotel is large and very welcoming, staying on the club levels you are directed to the 41st floor for check in. Upon checking in you are invited to take a seat in the club lounge while they arrange the paper work. We paid A$191 per night ( big variance in the different web booking sites ) and this was great value considering what you get with the club level. Breakfast was served in the club lounge which is very private and offers a great view over the harbour with a good selection of food and your eggs are made to order. Afternoon tea and cocktails are serviced in the afternoon and at night, again with a good selection of food. Rooms are standard Hong Kong size being on the small side although we spent most of our time when we were in the hotel in the club lounge. Pool are nice again with a good view over the harbour. Outside the hotel in not the best although it is only a small walk to the metro and buses which will take you any where in Honk Kong. Staff on the club level were very good and made us feel welcome every time we came in. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore or haven for relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Deluxe Harbourview Room for 10 nights and also opted foe 'The Club' which entitles you to access the Harbour Club Room on the 41st floor for Breakfast, afternoon tea and free cocktails from 6pm - 8pm daily. You also get free fruit delivered to your room, a higher floor room, 2 pieces of laundry pressed a day and selected savings for the restaurants at the hotel. Overall, the service and quality of the hotel is astounding and having access to these facilities was an added bonus. The pool was VERY good and was attended daily as the temperature was in the thirties throughout! The location is good if you don't mind getting the MTR (Metro) to whever you need to get to for sightseeing and just a short walk away to the North Point pier for cruises. I particularly enjoyed the food and view from Le 188 restaurant, also located on the 41st floor. A fantastic hotel and a fantastic holiday overall, well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Benzi-R
Reviews.Content: Compared with other 5 star hotels, this one offers very reasonable rates. Probably because of its location at North Point. It is not in a walking distance of any attraction or a nice shopping area. However, it is 5 minute walk from the Fortress Hill MTR (the Hong Kong subway system) station. Taxis are very affordable in Hong Kong and a ride to Central - where the Posh shopping is in the Island - takes 10-15 minutes. Central is also not very far from the night life areas of SoHo or Lai Kwai Fung. The hotel itself has an impeccable service, but this is typical to Hong Kong in general for this type of hotels. It has a reasonable gym with new and well maintained machinery and weights. The pool is beautiful. They have a restaurant/lounge on the 41st floor which has one of the most amazing views of Hong Kong (for me to say something like that is significant after visiting Hong Kong at least 40 times). They have a view of the Harbour from three sides without any obstruction - meaning that no other buiding is in front of them before the water front. The lounge is called Le 188 degrees - although having views to 3 sides means that it is at least 270 degrees, but the Chinese like the number 8 and is considered a lucky number. I gave it 4 stars only because of the location, but it is reflected in the price so maybe I should have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Grand views of the harbour indeed!”
Reviews.Author: larissakorporaal
Reviews.Content: To get some well needed R&R we decided to pamper ourselves and shell out a lot of money for a room on the club floor of the Harbour Grand in Hong Kong. When it comes to city views, this really is a grand view. Because of it's location on North Point, you overlook both the Kowloon and the Central parts of HK. The hustle and the bustle of the river by day and the beautiful lights by night. The room was well appointed and had a nice round 2 person bath. The bed was comfortable and the view really great. Benoit and Andres made us feel welcome in the club lounge and the pool was really well laid out. Unfortunately there are not enough sunbeds so if you come too late, you have to sit in a chair. Another discord was the fact that we couldn't choose if we wanted to have our breakfast in the club lounge or in the main restaurant. This is strange because in all the other 5 star hotels we've visited the choice was always ours. Either eat at the main restaurant with more choice for breakfast or eat in the club lounge where the choices are fewer but with more service and quiet atmosphere. Not in the Harbour Grand. After asking about this, we were informed that if we 'insisted' on eating downstairs, we would have to pay extra. And we were paying 320 USD per night for a room already! This is the kind of inflexibility that doesn't fit a 5 star hotel. Apart from the lack of sunbeds and the forced club breakfast, we did enjoy our stay in the hotel. Without those two things, it would have been a excellent stay. Now it was 'merely' very good. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Big luxurious hotel at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: CedriCeCCentric
Reviews.Content: Pros:Impressive lobby. Very clean. Beautiful views of the harbour and the hills from our large room. Close to MRT. Rain shower and separated bath. Beautiful lush pool area. Cons: No free internet access. Though close to MRT, not a very fun neighborhood. There are a lot of wedding parties at this hotel which can make it noisy in next door rooms and corridors. Overall this hotel is quite luxurious for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but some negatives”
Reviews.Author: enginerd
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I stayed at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong. it is a 3 minute walk to the subway (blue line fortress hill) and also within 2 starbucks (on the way to subway). The general neighborhood location could leave something to be desired as you have to walk past car repair shops. However, they didn't have a room ready for us when we arrived at 11p and instead wanted to upgrade us to a smoking suite - we wanted non-smoking. The view of the harbor is great from their top floor restaurant but they wouldn't let my husband and I go in for a drink b/c he had shorts and sandals on. There was no one in the restaurant either! Also - as mentioned below, having to pay for internet is annoying, and you can only use it one device. I think for the price, we'll be looking for a better value hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “don't bother to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cmice
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit small but ok and the location is fine and close to MTR. One thing so tick me off is how they charged the internet access is based on the device(s). I've stayed at different hotels in U.S, Canada even in HK that with complimentary free internet access... It is fine that for me to pay for the access free but i can't believe that the Grand Harbour Hotel in HK is charging the internet access service by device(s). How lame it is!!! So, don't bother, and i won't recommend this hotel to anyone given that there are a lot of choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “the most beutiful view point”
Reviews.Author: yuki41
Reviews.Content: this hotel is even little bit far from central and tsim sha tsui but it just takes 5-10 min, by subway to center of HK. and we were provided free upgrade service so we stayed on the 38th floor harbour club. the window of room is so wide , we could see both central and tsim sha, about room facilities, there are 2 TV in room and bathroom, many chanels are available. and wise and clean bathtub and double bed size is almost wide king, i've never sleep like this wide bed ever before :) breakfast and room service charge are also reasonable, harbour grand also have 12 types of pillow,so customer can choose after check pillow menu next to bed. if I have a change to visit hk again, i wiil book this hotel again!! it was very beutiful experince in HK.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Nice Views”
Reviews.Author: abeb1900
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Grand in the last week of August. While checking in late at night, the lobby seemed a bit empty and impersonal. After that I found that all the staff were very friendly and helpful - Room Service, Housekeeping, Restaurant, Bellhop... In fact they went out of the way to find me a taxi. Great room and spectacular views - its just that it rained or was overcast whenever I was in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with views to die for”
Reviews.Author: sheepster1964
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, conveniently located very close to Fortress Hill MRT station. The room was amazing; spacious, comfortable with a view across the harbour to Kowloon which was breath-taking. Breakfast was in a large airy room with wonderful light coming through on two sides. Again, you could see across the harbour. The food was first class with a great variety on offer. I heartily recommend this hotel which was great value for money, except for evening meals. Just walk out of the hotel (right, right, left) and you can find a wonderful little Vietnamese restaurant serving up authentic cuisine for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with harbour views ,good location, nice pool,food not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: martinr56
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family, typical Asian hotel: high quality amenities ,good service, very new, well located , secured early at a good rate. Only the food , which is highly rated locally , a disappointment..Definitely would short list to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, view superb from Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsJol
Reviews.Content: Sorry for late review - forgot. Excellent hotel, very swish and service is very good. We paid for the upgrade to a room with access to the club lounge and didn't look back. Although our room had a view over the harbour it was looking away from 'the main harbour view' - not a problem since the club lounge had a spectacular view and we spent a lot of time up there. All food and drink was inclusive so if you didn't want to sample Hong Kong's restaurants you could easily eat and drink your fill. All food was excellent. It was very easy to get to/from the subway (Fortress Hill station if I can remember correctly) and especially easy to find when dark since it's neon sign is easily visable from the subway exit. I did twist my ankle early on the holiday but there is a tram stop close to the subway station, which was easier to manage than the subway steps. All in all, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: trawellphreak
Reviews.Content: The location is a mixed blessing. One the one hand, you have some beautiful views of the Victoria Harbour from the rooms (especailly from the high floors...Ask for harbour view room when you book). On the other hand, the Fortress Hill area is decidedly low-brow. You step outside of the hotel and its very clear that the area is a working class neighborhood. A car mechanic garage is what you see first when you step out, and the grimy walk to the Fortress Hill MTR station is about 100 meters away. McDonalds, Subway , Starbucks and Burger King are right around the corner. I paid 1680 HKD for this room. Internet access and Breakfast were included. Rooms have all the basic amenities (hair dryer, DVD player..), but no iron was provided. I asked for it, and they obliged right away. I noticed that the lobby was a vast cavern, with absolutely no place to sit and lounge. (OK ,,3 or 4 sofas were spotted at the far corner) Quite a few children running around in the lobby. They have a free shuttle bus that departs about every 45 mins, taking business guests to Taikoo Place. Overall ..not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding views for the off-beat location”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: One could liken this place to the Langham Place in HK, both tower over their out-of-the-way neighbourhoods and are oases away from the bustle of central HK or Kowloon. Both are new and flash; both go out of their way to try to please. Langham Place though, has much more shopping around the hotel compared with the Harbour Grand. It is just over 5 minutes to Fortress Hill MTR and the main street, where buses are plentiful; of course a cheap taxi may be hailed easily from the lobby. There are Burger Kings and Starbucks around the corner for the cuisine-challenged. Local neighbourhood stores are interesting and finding a cheap laundry was a bonus. Hotel is on Oil Street, presumably named after the number of garages that service cars and machinery in this immediate area. The hotel suite on the 39th floor was neat and small compared with international suites, but well appointed. Fruit basket, free water. We had views in every room of the harbour, including a very sizable bathroom - full height glass (and privacy blind) with a full view of the harbour. Lush. The Club area again had marvellous views and a reasonable breakfast service in their restaurant, which has one of the most impressive aspects in HK. The Club evening snacks were plentiful albeit a little pedestrian (sandwiches, mini-quiches and spring rolls). A very ordinary wine selection, but their cocktails were great. Pre dinner drinks with that great view was a treat. Very nice gym & sauna facility, pool was in a pleasant environment albeit a little exposed to the restaurant next door at breakfast time. If shopping and dining in the immediate area are more important, go to Central/Wanchai or Kowloon. We found those areas offered options of older hotels, poorer views and higher room rates for the well appointed hotels. I would recommend the Grand Harbour HK, if newer facilities, views, price-point and hospitality are important, as access to shopping areas/convention centre is via metro or taxi. In Hong Kong, it's always a balance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would go back now!!!”
Reviews.Author: 222henry
Reviews.Content: Never stopped in Asia before but my friend who lives in HK helped me decide best hotel for us. Lovely smart clean and tidy hotel. We felt like royalty when we arrived. Had a lovely stay.The staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. Area a bit strange, but 3 min walk to metro, Fortress Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very clean and the breakfast was a feast!”
Reviews.Author: jleew
Reviews.Content: We had such a good stay at the Harbour Grand in Hong Kong. It was our first wedding anniversary and they gave us a red rose in the room and a complimentary beautiful bottle of champagne and 2 nice glass flutes. The staff are all really helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Lovely warm swimming pool with plenty of clean towels and beds to sit in the sun. The breakfast was a feast - all sorts of foods from your typical British menu to vegetable curry and rice if you fancy that early in the mornings. Nice breads, juices, fruits and eggs done to your liking as well. Plenty of dim sun, parma ham, smoked salmon etc etc. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus service every day, every hour to the centre and stops on the way if you want to get off for other attractions. Public transport so cheap - unbelievable. 20p each for the tram, until you get off and the MTR trains come along every 20 seconds, my husband counted them! They have an Octopus card which is like our Oyster card but we just paid daily. Again the trains were so cheap it made travelling very easy. The Star Ferry was about 25p each way over to Kowloon and well worth doing. Had a fab time and would definately stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - location brilliant for travelling around city”
Reviews.Author: donnarhi303
Reviews.Content: Easy check in and upgraded to a deluxe room on floor 36 with wonderful views towards Kowloon and the harbour. Comfortable beds. Beautiful breakfast. Very helpful concierge who directed us towards the Underground system which is excellent and easy to use and very cheap. Would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: trubshaw
Reviews.Content: If you want a room with a view in Hong Kong the view does not get much better than this! Stayed on the 39th floor - club privelages - very nice and worth it - the view from the club room is amazing and pefect for watching the nightly light show between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Excellent service and great friendly staff. In a city where hotels are quite expensive this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: elpasokib
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel close to where I needed to be for business purposes. We upgraded to get lounge priviledges which also include free internet and some other discounts. Every morning we enjoyed free breakfast in the lounge. The food is adequate but the view is breath taking... such a wonderful view of the harbour. In the afternoons they serve tea with finger foods, including sandwiches and desserts. At night there are unlimited bar priviledges. I recommend the mojitos, but there was a good variety of drinks, including beer and wine. The evening spread was adequate for us for an evening meal as we ate lunch out most days. The view in the evening was amazing. I could sit in the lounge for hours to enjoy the city lights over the harbour. The rooms are not large but are well appointed with a desk, printer/fax, internet connection. I really like the bathrooms which have the shower area combined in a room with the bathtub. It is a unique and interesting design. I do have a harbour view room but the drapes are behind the desk so it is not easy to get them open for the view. Hotel service is very good and the hotel staff is very attentive. We ate two meals in the hotel restaurant on the third floor (there are multiple restaurants). They serve both a lunch buffet and evening buffet. The first night we ordered off the menu. The next day we had the lunch buffet. The food is average, as is the service, but it is nice to have it available in the hotel. We toured the fitness room. There are a few pieces of equipment and a swimming pool. The pool was pretty busy so I did not use it during this visit. There were a lot of families in the pool area and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Mike9000ft
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Hyatts in the world. Great location in Hong Kong, with access to airport train, great food, health club, and restaurants. A little pricey, but not bad for a really high end hotel in this part of the world. Also, great access to the convention center!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobby_Lam
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Harbour Grand hotel, such a nice place! We got a room on 31st floor, which offer a great view of the harbour. The room is very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. MTR station is very near to the hotel. The only negative thing is it's quite far from city center. We will still choose to stay here again in our nearest trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “A Queen and Prince for 5 nights!”
Reviews.Author: MelindaTravels
Reviews.Content: My son (13 years old) and I travelled to Hong Kong for a short holiday of 6 days. After much research we chose to stay at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong and thoroughly enjoyed our whole experience. I decided to pay the extra to have the "club room facilities" I was so so pleased that I did. Once we arrived to the hotel, we were guided to the 41st floor to book in. We were immediately greeted and seated with refreshments and personalised check in. I found this really helpful, Shan recommended places to go and the best way to do them. The view from this lounge area was breathtaking, changing constantly with the weather. We used this club room daily, buffet breakfast was included (wonderful choices) and from 3pm refreshments and small pastries with hor derves were available, as well as free access to the internet with the 3 computers provided. It was a very exclusive treat, being greeted by name each time, we loved the luxury that surrounded us. Sometimes at night we didnt feel like a heavy meal, after a long hot day seeing the sights, so we would just retreat on the lounges and enjoy the night view, helping ourselves to the pastries. Our room was compact, yet had all the amenities required, immaculately clean, furnished very tastefully with a wonderful view of the harbour, situated on the 38th floor. Yes I agree the hotel is situated in a grungy area, car repair shops and vacated buildings. BUT in life we are all surrounded by the ugliness and beauty of the world, in all types of aspects. We felt completely safe where ever we ventured, night or day! I would have let my son travel on the trains at night or walk the surrounding areas alone, if he wanted, where in Melbourne I would never permit that. The MTR (public train system) is so close and so speedy, I am still amazed how perfect it was. A short walk 5 - 10 minutes to Fortress Hill Station and then the wait for a train is only 1- 3 minutes, unbelievable! Each train interconnects and you are in the shopping districts within minutes, highly recommend. Buy an Octopus Card at the airport, only HK$150 (cash) and you just swipe and travel everywhere you like on all public transport, until it runs out or just add more cash and off you go! So you can be where you want to be quite quickly, also the hotel provides a shuttle service at specified times, to designated areas which is also useful. The hustle and bustle of the city makes you feel alive with excitement and when the day ends we would go back and shut the doors to our peaceful hotel, this was much appreciated. We were lucky with the weather as in it didnt rain, but wow was the humidity high, relief was found by jumping in any air conditioned shop you could find. I am so happy I chose this hotel, very happy, worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice personal touch”
Reviews.Author: luv2ravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights from Xmas 2010 till New Year 2011, last minute booking through Virgin Holidays and it was a good choice for value. Good hotel, clean, modern & all rooms with good view. Location is on the island & a little bit outside centre, free transport is provided but we took the tram to the centre (10 mins) which is fun & part of the experience. Our package didn't include breakfast but nearby the hotel there are lots of small local restaurants which open most of the time, cost about £3 for a meal and they are good. We had 2 issues during the stay and they were resolved perfectly. One of the guest made so much noise one night (shouts a lot in the corridor, probably drunk). The next day the manager apologised to all the guests on our floor, explained the problem (also, this drunk Russian guest has been asked to leave the hotel). Plus, the hotel gave us a big beautiful fruit basket & some drinks as an apology, with personal letter too. The manager spoke to us personally. The other issue was we left our mobile in the transport to the Airport, they found it, kept and sent it to our home back in the UK. I thought that little touch were great service, personal attention. I recommend this hotel for its facilities & good service :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lindsay3180
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel absolutely wonderful. Our room was gorgeous and got a free upgrade to a deluxe suite which was great! Some people say it is out of the way however we found it fine. A couple of stops on the MTR (the nearest station was 5mins walk from the hotel) and you were at shopping area. I would say it was a great location considering how great the public transport it. Staff were helpful. Only complaint I would have is that the restaurant on the top floor was a bit pretentious and we were made to feel as we weren't good enough to be in it which was extremely disappointing. However this was the only time in the hotel that we felt like this so not sure if it was just the attitude fo the staff that worked in that particular restaurant! I would still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but you can get better for your money closer to the 'action'!!”
Reviews.Author: franb51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3n at the end of a long trip away from home mainly to 'break' the long journey from UK to Australia. We'd been to HK before but a very long time ago. Previously we'd stayed at the Excelsior on HK Island and we found it to be extremely good. The only reason we didnt stay there this trip was because they dont have a pool and, thinking (laughingly!!), we'd have time to sit back and relax a bit!! The hotel is a bit 'far out' located past the Wan Chai area and amongst motor repair 'shops' some of which are done out on the street! The general area is one of major renovations going on. On check-in we found the cavernous Lobby to be stunning but sterile, with, seemingly, miles of marble flooring. Crystal chandeliers abound - and thats about all you can see, There was classical harp music playing somewhere - turned out to be on the stairway!! We noted that we couldnt see the other parts of the hotel easily, like the bars or lounges etc. We were informed we'd been "upgraded" from our Superior Harbour View room to a Deluxe one. This was apparently one of the "Club" floors but without the Club access/priviledges. When we asked what they difference was, we were told it was a higher floor hence better views. OK!! We asked how much to upgrade to use the facilities( as we had considered this when we booked the hotel) but it was something ridiculous like $200/n!! No free Wi-fi either, anywhere in the hotel. Most hotels in Asia have this free in the Lounge at least. The time it took for the lifts to appear was unbelievable. They were SO slow, you could've been waiting for a funeral procession. But once in the lift, they moved PDQ!! The room was very nice and the shower was unusual with the fact it had a glass wall separating it from the b/r.It had a separate bathtub which was quite small and angled into the corner. The bed was very comfy (no complaints there apart from the weird thing these hotels have about not having a top sheet in the bed linen). At least the doona was adequately sized so you didnt get cold 'nether regions' when you turn over in bed!! I was so thirsty I opened one of the bottles of water not realising the ones in the fridge are NOT free of charge, only the ones on the dresser. Bugger!! I never consume anything out of a mini-bar because of the ridiculous price....but, too late this time. I thought I'd just replace it but couldn't find one the same size. You had to call Housekeeping to get a bucket of ice (we had our Duty Free to drink) all the time. The tea and coffee weren't replenished which is annoying. Its such a small thing to do and yet they obviously couldnt be bothered.. We didnt eat in any of their restaurants, so can't comment on that. However, one night we went to go to the pool and were told it was closed even though the staff were still in the Fitness Club, we were too late! We found the Concierge to be very helpful, but there wasnt a lot of info re the hotel shuttle buses, as to where they went - same for the airport shuttle. It was a bit confusing. The MTR was quite close and were a few small supermarket-type shops and the usual fast food outlets. As my mobility isnt great, that was the major thing for us - being able to get around without too much trouble. As others have written, taxis are plentiful and reasonable and the MTR close-by. Overall, it was a nice hotel but was a bit too far out to enjoy local restaurants or ecen 'window shop' in the local shops.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tikka87
Reviews.Content: beautiful big luxurious rooms, big tv, tub, double sinks, great view of the city, good location as well, really friendly staff, very clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, outstanding breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Melovechocolate
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this hotel and it was a shame we didn't stay longer--we would have stayed just for the buffet!!!!! Wow--all the food was incredibly delicious..we had a tour so we didn't have to walk to sites, It was raining (keep in mind that rainy season is in summer, pack an umbrella). Having transportation is helpful, although we were able to use the subway without a problem and get around (we don't speak the local languages). The lobby is beautiful, as one of the reviewers mentioned, it's truly grand. We had a great view from our room, we were very comfortable, and as I mentioned, absolutely loved the food from the breakfast buffet--some of the best croissants we've ever had! We were traveling with two kids, and the administration was courteous and tried to meet our needs as best they could. We found that rooms are for triple occupancy at most in China, so we had to get 2 rooms. We feel this is one of the nicest hotels we've been in (aside from the Jin Mao Tower) and our kids and mum & dad thoroughly enjoyed the stay..Hopefully we could go back one day and have that buffet again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Expensive and Far”
Reviews.Author: MPCLDC
Reviews.Content: Harbour Grand Hong Kong is a high quality hotel. Amazing breakfast buffet (but expensive), good gym/pool, grand lobby. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from MTR, past some auto repair shops. The hotel boasts that every room has a harbour view, however this means that most rooms have only an average view, if you stand directly against the window.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lulushke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. However first I got a Deluxe-Habour view room - I was not impressed when I saw it - as it was quit small. I went to the reception and asked if they sure gave me Deluxe and not Standard room. They said that the only diffrence between 2 rooms is the view - Deluxe room has a Habour view, but the size and the rest is the same. As I wanted to have a larger room they proposed me a Premier- room, I had to pay extra, but I liked it. As the room is larger, nicer and has a separate sofa- this room corresponds with a 5* status. But I think if you count all together the price will be the same as 5* hotels in Kowloon or Central, so may be no need to go to North Point if you take Premium room. If you are satisfied with Standard ot Deluxe room (small) then for the price it worth to go to Habour Grand as it will be cheaper then Intercontinental or so. The swimming pool is nice, as well as sauna. Breakfast also very goods , also the view from the main restaurant . Convinient free shuttle to Airport Express - only 10 min.(however in the hotel they said it will take about 40 min. as the bus has to go to other hotels as well - not true) Would only go back if I would take Premium room or Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: Doc_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as a stop-over on route to the UK. Is slightly out of the way but there is a train/metro station on a minute or two walk up the street that connects with Causeway Bay and the main areas of Hong Kong island. Room was excellent, front of house staff very helpful, the pool was very refreshing after a day in the heat and humidity of Hong Kong, and the view over the water between Hong Kong island and the mainland was superb. Paid the extra to be upgraded to the "club floor" - worth the extra - afternoon tea if about, happy hour every evening, cocktails and canapes that constitiuted a full dinner every night. Excellent breakfast and the view was amazing. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Near enough NOT good enough”
Reviews.Author: mlt00
Reviews.Content: It's all about the view. It's remote (North Point), surrounded by motor repair shops (hence Oil Street), delapidated vacant buildings and the working part of the harbour. The general feel is Chinese new money meets ersatz art nouveau - perfectly underlined by the harp played in the evenings in the cavernous, sterile, stone clad lobby. The deluxe rooms look straight up the harbour (it's all about the v iew!) but are small. The fittings are getting a bit worn and shabby even though the hotel is less than 2 years old. I think they were all made at a B grade mainland factory. Appearance is more important than practical comfort. The service ranged from great -the Concirege, Daniel, a veteran of many HK 5 star hotels- to incredibly rude - the shuttle bus driver couldn't give a damn (3 trips and always the same rudeness). Don't bother with the Club. The staff to guest ratio was low and the range of food and drinks merely adequate. Having just stayed at the Westin in Guangzhou, the difference was huge. (no eggs for breakfas tunless specifically ordered, repeated requests for replenishment and a queue for the one, self operated coffee machine). The Harbour Club manager should visit some other real 5 star hotels to see how it's done. The extra US$100 a day is NOT worth it - except for the view, after all, it's what the hotel is all about. Then to top it all of they charge ANOTHER HK130 a day for internet, even in the Club rooms. This is NOT a 5 star hotel. Stay somewhere else - I'll be at the Langham Place again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: sweetpotato84
Reviews.Content: I paid around 1400 HKD a night for a Superior Harbour View, which was good value. The room was small but adequate size, with a very comfortable bed, flat screen TV with a reasonable selection of channels. Loads of wardrobe space, and the bathroom was good with a separate bath and shower. The view of the harbour was not towards Kowloon as I'd hoped, but more to the East. Still a nice view though. The location is okay, if a little far from the main sights. 5 minutes walk to Fortress Hill MTR station, or, for the cheaper option, the nearest tram stop is just a few minutes walk. Tram journey to Admiralty is around 10 or 15 minutes. The free shuttle from the Airport Express station is efficient, taking around 10 minutes from the station, and about 20-25 mins to get from the Hotel to Hong Kong station on the return. It runs every 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Add on charges, everything extra, not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VooDooTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel BUT the Reception staff is not well trained, friendly or accomadating. Breakfast is nice but a bit steep at 210 HKD per adult and 140 HKD for kids. There is pressure from reception staff to upgrade the room for only $45 USD per night - but Superior Room and Deluxe Room are exactly the same square feet!!!. Internet is $17 USD per connection. So if you have 2 adults with laptops and a kid with an iPad - you pay $51 USD extra for internet! Nothing too much near hotel, you have to take a taxi or metro everywhere. Pool is nice, health club is too small. Roof restaurant and bar are nice. Rollaway bed does not easily fit in Superior or Deluxe Room - so you have to pay for an upgrade - so for 2 adults and 1 child count on $245 USD per night plus breakfast - so over $310 per night incl of breakfast. Many nice hotels in Hong Kong can beat that with better address.

Reviews.Title: “For business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Milou0401
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our toddler and needed a babycot, so there was no space to move around with it in the room. But space is a general problem in hk tough ;) Breakfast buffet was pricey for what was being offered.
