In general customer service sucks i hk, and you are often looked down at if you do not wear the right branded clothes or show off clothes, and this was also the case at this hotel. The male staff at the gym was unfriendly and cold. The pool had a very nice view. This hotel is probably good value for money if you are a business traveller but i would not recommend it for families w small children. The staff knocked on our door, but would immediately storm in uninvited. The purpose of the visit was to check on how we were doing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aribendaniels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong in the month of April 2011 on a business trip. The hotel does boost of a spectacular lobby. The Views of the harbor were impressive. The concierge desk is well staffed and very helpful. Internet was reliable although at a cost of HK$130 per day is expensive. Unfortunately there no movie channels, which at time could have been a plus. The frustrating part was waiting for the cabs every morning to get to work. Overall a ok experience

Reviews.Title: “Quite wonderful! Looking forward to the next stay!”
Reviews.Author: herbsandspices
Reviews.Content: Our room was an Executive Suite, and we were truly delighted with it. The suite was not just tastefully decorated, it was thoughtfully designed too. And the harbour view was good (though it was amazing in some other rooms). The sofa was plush and comfortable. There were two large TV sets and two DVD players, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The TV in the bedroom was on a swivel stand. The bathtub was the most comfortable and well designed one ever! We could have privacy with by letting down the electric roller blinds or take a bathe with a semi-harbour view (plus blue sky and white clouds in our case). The bathtub took a surprisingly short time to fill as well. We were surprised to see a pillow menu offering complimentary exotic pillows for different sleep needs! For fun, we ordered two different kinds. Unfortunately, when they arrived, we could not tell one from the other. It would be great if they could come with some kind of label, to put our doubts to rest. (Since we couldn't tell them apart, could the staff? If they could, did they bother to give us what we requested?) I appreciated the thought they put into decorative and practical elements as well. The bedside reading lamps could be adjusted to point where you wished. When the door to the bedroom was closed, it blended in with the rest of the living room wall. There was a multi-outlet power strip next to the work desk. We asked to view the other room types. They were all quite good, but beware that the bathtubs are different in different rooms. We might have got the best one. Now for some of their weaknesses, which were not showstoppers. Noise outside the door was clearly audible. The hotel phone made odd beeping noises sporadically which kept waking us up until we unplugged the phone. The housekeeping staff did not understand when we requested additional bath salts and came with a bar of soap. The blackout curtains let in light from all four edges, so the room was never completely dark. I can see why some guests might have had unpleasant encounters with the counter staff: some of them were a little curt and unpolished (like giving an incredulous look when a guest wanted to check out and mistakenly gave an 'impossible' room number). Oh, and the hotel lobby is rather grand, but the impressive marble surfaces turn it into an acoustic nightmare when there is a bit of a crowd! In-room dining tip: For those of you who eat your hardboiled eggs with butter and a teaspoon, you may need to specifically request the butter and teaspoon.

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK however location and Le 188 Restaurant is not good”
Reviews.Author: JohnA010856
Reviews.Content: Room on 36 floor was very comfortable but a little small .. twin beds stuck almost together .. about 2" between! Views were spectacular over harbour. Internet was reliable although at a cost of HK$130 per day is very expensive. No movie channels or pay TV ... not normally something I worry about however it was raining the 2 days we were here and we would have liked something to watch (in English) other than news tv. Reception service was fine even though they had no record of us having paid through our travel agent .. this was sorted very quickly and efficiently. The most disappointing of all was the 'Exclusive' Le 188 restaurant. Having been to the "peak" to the Cafe Deco Bar & Grill the first evening and had an great meal with excellent service .. I thought we would end on a 'High' at the top of the Hotel at the Le 188. The service by two obviously very new and very poor English was not a great start .. but the view is great so not to worry. Then the wine list comes and to say it was basic is to be kind! I am only comparing this to the Cafe the night before not some high class Sydney or London Restaurant. I had figs with parma ham .. very tasty however it came with thin toast (Almond Bread possibly) but it was soft not crisp. Not to worry the main was one of my my favorite dishes .. Gnocchi .. I only tend to order this in 'good' restaurants as I have been disappointed so many times over the years. It was was very nice all being considered this was not and never would be like a top Italian Restaurant .. the source was tasty and the Gnocchi light, no complaints. My son had a desert and I said I would just have coffee ... when the waiter said 'would I like hot Coffee?' ... not would I like espresso, cappuccino, latte or american I was a bit taken back .. I just said yes that will be fine as I could see he was struggling with English. My sons desert arrived some 15 min later .. not a problem .. but so did the chocolates to go with my coffee .. so i said 'could I please have a refill .. it was normal perculated coffe .. nothing special .. 'We do not refill sir would you like a second cup of coffee' .. NO thank you that will be all. I later went and spoke to a fellow who had been 'hovering' all night and doing little to help the obviously junior and inexperienced staff, he said he was the supervisor or manager and I told him I was disgusted in being asked to pay for a second cup of coffee which had arrived 15 min prior to desert and the sweets which accompanied the coffee. This is a great location for a restaurant with fantastic views as well as a pleasant two piece band .. unfortunately with inexperienced and untrained staff with poor English. For the price give it a miss as there are much better restaurants in HK.

Reviews.Title: “We got vegemite at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EvilParrot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife for a conference that was on at the HK convention centre. There were a large number of Australians staying at the hotel for the same purpose and we were made to feel very welcome. They even somehow acquired vegemite (a popular Australian yeast based bread spread) to offer us at breakfast. Food was a superb variety at the buffet breakfast, the staff were very helpful, the room was nice and had a very large bath, the views of the harbor were spectacular. The close location to the fortress hill mtr station made everything very convenient. In addition it was significantly cheaper than most of the other hotels on the conference list.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackd_10
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The lobby is stunning and service was exceptional. The location and view are excellent, especially the harbour view from your room. The rooms are a tad small, but beautifully appointed. The room design is very unique with lots of glass and is quite functional. For a hotel of this quality, we found the prices to be reasonable. We wish it was closer as we'd love to stay there again. J from Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Under rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: YG500
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews about this hotel and had some reservations about staying here. However I had received a rate too good to refused so decided to go ahead. Fortunately the hotel turned out to be awesome. From the front desk ( wow what a lobby ), to the spacious, modern rooms, great buffet breakfast and fantastic recreation facilities, I just couldn't fault the hotel. Even the location turned out to be good. Many reviewers complained about the distance from Central or Kowloon, but they really are not taking into account how close the hotel is to the mtr and how efficient the system is. Plus, there are a few cheap but tasty eating places close by. So to sum up, stay here if you are looking for value without compromising anything.

Reviews.Title: “Really good service and room with great view on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: MademoiselleAmandine
Reviews.Content: Amazing view on Kowloon ! Really confortable room and beds. Service perfect. Breakfast was good. Closed to the subway so place is really convinient., Has a swimming pool but not a lot of seats

Reviews.Title: “The heart of HK”
Reviews.Author: stormcometh
Reviews.Content: Harbour Grand has been my best experience till date. Have managed to stay here twice , the first time in Oct 2010 & then again in Dec 2010. The view from the room was spectacular at all times and this place has the most friendly staff. The hotel also has a superb gym The banquet hall is quite large but not conducive for a business conference thought it would be a great location for a wedding The location is convenient to get around HK and that makes a huge difference to the trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lightbulbsmcf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbour Grand for two nights in May. Had a 30th floor harbour view room, which had a fantastic view across Hong Kong. Room itself is very well equipped, large beds, huge bathroom. There is a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom but there is an electric curtain for privacy! Hotel is new and stunning inside, lobby is very grand, restaurants all very good. Go to the top floor bar for the best views of Hong Kong (they are better than from the Peak which I went to the same day). Hotel is well located in Causeway Bay and not a far walk from major shops or other sights. Would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTOS03
Reviews.Content: Simply the best value for money available, on par with the best hotels anywhere, the view from the breakfast club floor is amazing and everything just works....very impressive. Rooms a little small but that's HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good size, good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeMickey
Reviews.Content: This is a solid hotel with good size rooms and a great price for Hong Kong. The foyer is very grand, the gym is a reasonable size and the service is good with all front office staff speaking excellent English. It is very close (a short walk down the aptly named Oil Street) to Fortress Hill MTR, which is 5 easy stops and 5 HKD from Central. Taxis are readily available, but be warned for trips to the hotel that around 1/2 the drivers do not know where the hotel is - remember to take the full address with you. There are a variety of food shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jmox
Reviews.Content: Pretty faultless - would highly recommend. Very modern, great decor and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel on the Hong Kong Side”
Reviews.Author: HawneysWorld
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel on the Hong Kong side with great views of the harbour and peaks if you can see thru the smog. Not as great a location as the Kowloon side but still very good. Exceptional service from porters thru to waiters. Pay a bit extra and shout yourself to the club lounge with free food, booze and internet.

Reviews.Title: “great stay pity the weather was cloudy+raining”
Reviews.Author: hazyManchester
Reviews.Content: first impression when you walk into lobby wow it is huge with a staircase to your left were a women plays the harp,no problem with check in the staff were well trained and could understand English.they were all well presented in good style uniforms and nothing was to much trouble what ever you asked if they could not sort it they wold contact someone who could,bed rooms were clean with a big comfy bed just what you want after a long flight.bath room good size with bath and separate shower towels change everyday if you want.Concierge were very helpful with good recommendation on restaurants and things to do.Doormen always there to open doors and call a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: BarbM2015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grande Hong Kong in late Feb. 2011 for 3 days based on the reviews written on this site. I actually made the booking directly on the hotel website as it was a better deal than the discount hotel websites. We were not disappointed! We booked a harbour view room which had a good view, but since the top floor lounge had an amazing view, I probably would get a city view the next time. I strongly recommend that you get a floor on the Club level which gives you access to the lounge on the top floor. The view is incredible, and there is a complimentary happy hour every evening with nice snacks. The other advantage of having lounge access is that the public areas downstairs are small and noisy. This hotel hosts lots of large group meetings and getting away from the noise is nice. The service is incredible, and the concierge made great restaurant recommendations. The hotel is a short walk from the Fortress Hill Metro station and in a very convenient location. The room was clean, the bathroom was spacious with nice amenities. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: BenLaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour Club Premier View Room for a week to kick off our honeymoon. This hotel was better than we expected. We had average expectations because the price was considerably less than its other 5 star competitors. However, after staying there we realised that it certainly does live up to its 5 star rating. The room was as you would expect from a Hong Kong room 'cosy' but plenty of space for our holiday. The bed was super comfy and we had plenty of channels and a decent TV. A unexpected bonus was a small LCD screen in the bathroom. Better than reading a book :) The bathoom is very nice. A combined bath/shower, but spacious and very clean. The view from our room was fantastic however we never used the couch other than to dump our shopping on. The harbour club is a fantastic extra, so I would highly recommend potential guests to consider paying extra to upgrade to the benefits. The biggest reason is because of the excellent service we received. They were always friendly, remembered our names and even remembered our cocktail orders from the night before. The most impressive example of this was the first morning we asked for a special muesli order which required ingredients that weren't in their club room buffet. They were kind enough to organise a bowl of oats and a green apple thinly sliced. When we returned the next morning they greeted us and asked if we would like the same order again (Just from memory, not from information they had save on the computer) and we never had to remind them again for the remainder of our holiday. I will say this, I thought we could have had access to either the large buffet downstairs but was informed that we could only use the buffet in the club lounge which is a much smaller offering. The view however is fantastic. I think if I pushed the point, we might have been able to get a morning down there, but there was a reasonable amount of variety to keep us happy. The gym is pretty good and served it's purpose, but it's not far from a Fitness First, so we were able to use our Australian membership there as we remembered to take our cards anyway. The location is not the most convenient we have stayed at in Hong Kong (Wan Chai is a much more convenient location) but because the public transport is so good in Hong Kong, it really wasn't that big a deal. The shops in Causeway Bay are only a short $2HKD tram ride away or a quick underground train ride away from the Fortress Hill MTR station which is short walking distance. There are plenty of food options around in particular a great 'hanging meat' restaurant where we had plenty of roast meats, rice and kai lan for only $13AUD for 2 people. Whilst it is not the best hotel we've stayed at, it certainly is one of the best. Value for money (Room, Service, Club Facilities, Location), Harbour Grand is hard to beat in the 5 star hotel category. We will definitely return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value 5 star hotel with excellent Club, wonderful views and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lapetiteanglaise5
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel on HK Island with 5 star amenities and great views for half the price of other five star hotels, pick the Harbour Grand Hong Kong. It's located two minutes from Fortress Hill MTR, which is just a few stops from Admiralty, Central and shopping at Causeway Bay and near numerous bus and tram routes. Having stayed last time in touristy Kowloon we loved this hotel's location in a local neighbourhood still close to the action. An authentic HK mix of high end offices and hotels, local shops and eateries and yes, one or two small mechanic shops which truly aren't a problem. Very safe day and night with people out until late, shopping and returning from work. We booked two adjoining rooms for 3 nights on the Club level which was definitely worth the extra expense - with the endless round of free breakfasts, afternoon teas, cocktails and canapes we rarely felt the need to eat out! The Club has a spacious lounge on the 41st floor with soaring ceilings, plush furnishings and spectacular views from each side of the room through floor to ceiling windows. It has a casual vibe which means you are free to come and go as you please, help yourself to drinks, make use of the free wi-fi/computers and stay until late if you wish. Our girls loved their non-alcoholic 'mocktails'! Most mornings breakfast was served in the restaurant which juts straight out over the Harbour with 280 degree views of Central and Kowloon. Our Grand Deluxe Harbour View rooms had great views to Central and across to Kowloon and some of the most comfortable beds we have slept in. Finally, leave time to laze by the infinity pool, which has comfortable loungers, poolside snacks and wonderful views out over the Harbour. All in all a great hotel at an affordable price which represents arguably the best value luxury hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Take the Harbour Club Package!”
Reviews.Author: Leela79
Reviews.Content: If you don't think you can afford to stay on one of the Harbour Club floors, here's some advice : SAVE SAVE SAVE. The upgrade is worth every cent. The views from the Club floor are completely out of this world. Every part of our experience in this hotel was wonderful. We stayed in a Harbour Club Grand Deluxe room, which had beautiful views of Victoria Harbour. The rooms are average HK size and are very modern and comfortable. The hotel is very close to Fortress Hill MTR and its easy to get around HK. The staff are so wonderful here, I was so sad to leave. Undoubtedly, this is the best hotel stay I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ryjs_isonholiday
Reviews.Content: My 4th time visiting hong kong and rather than stay on the mainland with friends i opted for something further out. I picked the harbour grand because of its gorgeous views and was hoping that id get a great lookout over the harbour unfortunately the local police station that is directly across mostly blocked my sites, but nevertheless it was nice to feel close to something environmental in such an industrial country. I managed to score myself continental breakfast every morning downstairs at one of their 4 eateries. The food was good, nothing special and to be honest their vegetables tasted freeze dried, but their congee and more local dishes were superb! Closely located to the MTR i was able to go to and from the mainland quickly, about a 15 minute tram ride with a few stops @ which point i had to swap lines. The hotel provides a bus transit to and from the local tourist shopping spots which came in handy. The hotel also offers a tourist attraction booking desk which i used frequently. The room was nice and clean, i had a bit of a problem managing the room safe and had to get hotel security to help me out a few times! Overall it was a lovely stay, different from what i was used to in Hong Kong but worth its money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaybargain
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had a lovely 4 night stay in this hotel at the end of January 2011. The hotel itself really is breathtaking and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Deluxe harbour view room and it was very nice with a lovely bathroom and cleaned every day. I thoroughly recommend the restaurant on the top floor, the food is awesome and view is ever better! I think it was voted one of the best views in hong kong. The restaurant is pricey but you really pay for what you get, delicious food. Our only disappointment was that the swimming pool was unavaliable due to maintenance, something we were not aware of or told of before we booked. Location wise it is perfect, just a short walk to the metro which is very cheap and you can use this to see all the sites. My girlfriend would highly recommend the ladies market if you are in for to your bags as she found some good bargains (or though fake, very good fakes) and remember to haggle on price. Overall we had a fantastic time is a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “COULD GET BETTER HOTELS AT SAME PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Dustsettler
Reviews.Content: If you decide to visit hong kong, and staying on either side (kowloon or hong kong) isn't a problem for you, then you should avoid this hotel. We booked a room (club deluxe), and when we arrived there, we found it surprisingly small. There wasn't enough space to even walk around. So we had to thrown in some more cash, got it upgraded to the next level. This room was a welcome change, and was big enough. Also, it offered good views of the Harbour. Food menu was limited, not a lot of international dishes on the menu, paid around 200 hkd for a four-cheese pizza. But you find a Subway, Burger King, Mc.Donalds, Starbucks right next to the hotel. Finding cabs, bus or a metro is not a problem if you're staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply sensational”
Reviews.Author: JandJteam
Reviews.Content: We are (sadly) coming to the end of a 9 night stay at this very lovely property. It has met our expectations in every way. We tossed around the idea of upgrading to the Club Floor and then, thankfully, decided to do it and this enhanced our hotel stay considerably as the Club Lounge located on the 41st floor is a delightful place to enjoy the complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks complete with some canapes. It also has free wifi as well as the most amazing views of both Hong Kong island and Kowloon. Service has been friendly and efficient at all times. During your stay, you can enjoy good food at Henry's Kitchen and right next door they do a great manicure/pedicure. The MTR is less than 5 minutes walk and is a pleasure to use for accessing most of what Hong Kong has to offer but taxis are also very cheap. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “nice & a luxurious place... centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: devanshubhatia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel next to the harbor. The MTR is just 2 minutes walking and so is the seven eleven, coffee cafe, ATM and others. They upgraded us to a deluxe room and it was nice. Their roof cafe is splendid too. Book in advance and go there at 7:45 PM to enjoy the lights show on harbor at 8 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: selliohw
Reviews.Content: Just got back from yet another wonderful holiday in HK. On the last 2 occasions we have stayed at the Interconitental Grand Standford. However, this time we decided on a change of scenery. After reading some of the reviews posted about the Harbour Grand I was a littlle worried. I need not have been, our stay was wonderful we opted for a club room as there was a deal on when we booked, glad we did now, it was worth every penny. A tranquil oasis after the hustle and bustle. The staff, down to a last one, were courtious, friendly and helpful. The hotel is placed on a an aptly named Oil Street, where there were car repair shops. I found this interesting as you get to see a glimps's of Hong Kong Life and was not at all off putting. Being vegitarian was OK the hotel was more than happy to accomodate us and we found one or two local buddist places that were fine. Tried the MTR this time as it was at the end of the street, would really recommend it. Cheap, clean, efficient. On our last day my husband lost or had his camera stolen we contacted our insurance company who wanted a police crime no. as it was our last day we did not get time to do this. We has since contacted the hotel who have been brilliant and have contacted them on our belhalf, and have supplied us with the information we need to make a claim. once again , fast efficeint, brilliant. If i had to make a comment it would be that there is no place to meet and sit with friends. we had friends staying at a nearby hotel and it would have been nice sit in a bar and have drinks together. (just a minor point). on the whole we found this hotel excellent, the rooms comfortable and staff friendly especially Anna, Gloria and Rodger in the club lounge. Thnak you for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, very close to Fortress Hill MTR, Clean and inviting”
Reviews.Author: 222tess
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Harbour Grand with shocked faces! (Good that is) The sheer 41 storey hotel was a towering sensation. There were two men to help us unload our luggage and asisst us through to the check in desk. Once we were checked in, we used the lift to the 32nd floor. Our room was beautiful, with lovely views of the harbour. There was a flat screen T.V and complementary water, towels, dressing gowns, toothbrushes, shower caps, the list goes on. The next day, we made our way down to breakfast (3rd floor) which was absolutely amazing. There was a huge variety of breakfasts ranging from english, chinese or japanese. I would advise to go inclsive with breakfast as it is a bit expensive. We then walked to the MTR, which was extremely close to the hotel, a two minute walk or so. Luckly, all the main shopping districts and attractions are only a few stops away. (Causeway Bay, Admiralty and Central) Over all I had a fantastic stay and I hope this information has helped!

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: DavidBasilious
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in july for 10 days , and i was seriously so upset that i had to leave . I love this place . I t really is so Grand! From the moment that you enter this hotel , you feel like royalty. It has a really big foyer and reception area with fantastic lighting , and it really is a great way to start your stay!! The rooms are very luxurious and the room service is very nice . They have a buffet breakfast , lunch and dinner . The food is seriously some of the best food in Hong kong and when you take into consideration that you are have a buffet meal , with drinks deserts and coffee, it is very cheap and really it is of 6 star quality. the location is fine , though some people feel it is a bit away from all the action . This is actually a goog thing , as you get to come home/ hotel and the end of each day from the madness of the down town areas. In saying this , there is a subway station literally 200m away , and you are about 4 or 5 stations away from the epicentre of hong kong , which takes probably 8 minutes to get to , alternatively you can take the free hotel shuttle from the hotel , which departs every 30 or 60 minutes , and this takes the scenic route into the city and it is for FREE!! Got to love it!!!! The hotel and its staff have a very professional approach to all the quests adn there is even someone at the front entrance to the hotel who opens the door for you regardless off the time.. OMG . This hotel has a very nice fitness centre , so you can work off all the dim sum that you indulge in , and also has a sauna / steam room and heated spa , with a very nice heated outdoor swimming pool , with Victoria Harbour as the Backdrop! This is really nice , and makes for a very romantic place to sip on a cocktail at night , with that special someone!! if i ever go back to HK , i will 100% stay in this hotel! Thank guys for a truly remarkable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but really needs an overhaul in terms of customer servicing.”
Reviews.Author: NSB83
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel from April 14-April 17 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The reception looks alright - nothing exceptional but an average 5 star. The check in was quite poor and during the course of our trip I realized that the service staff in this hotel is quite curt and just refuse to smile - if anything, we had to keep saying 'Thank You' without a word from them! It's close to the MTR, so that's great although the neighbourhood is nothing fancy - it's a slew of car workshops. The room was a typical 5 star hotel average room. Housekeeping was very very slow and needed constant reminders. Overall I would rate it as average but my biggest pain point was that I have never met more uptight, curt and non-smiling faces in any hotel that I have travelled to than this one. Don't go with high expectations here.

Reviews.Title: “location not ideal, wouldn't go back again”
Reviews.Author: loveJP
Reviews.Content: The surrounding location not a nice walking atmosphere area. nothing interesting to see in the area. I would opt to stay around Central, Causeway Bay, or Kowloon. the room was clean, although small (which is the standard in HK). As for the habour view, adequate, but since the room was small, the windows were small as well. Internet is $130HKD per day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daznatnoa
Reviews.Content: The biggest disappointment is that we only stayed here for 1 night. Superior room was large and modern. Staff were all friendly. Location only 5 minutes walk to mtr and only a few stops from central. Previous reviews mentioned problems with delays in the lifts however they have now implemented a system for express lifts to high floors. Gym was great and only drawback was that it only opened at 7am. This would be my hotel of choice for my next stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: cityhooper20
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in a club room which although costs more , is well worth paying the extra as you get excellent views over Victoria Harbour from the club lounge and rooms (floors 35-40). In the club lounge (41st floor) you can get breakfast, afternoon tea and canopes and cocktails all inclusive in the club room price. Soft drinks, beer, tea and coffee available all day (7am-11pm). Everything you need is provided in the rooms including bathrobes and slippers. Restaurant Le 188, also on 41st floor, has fantastic views all around the harbour and the light show can also be seen, but the food although well presented did not quite hit the mark as far as taste. We had two courses with a bottle of wine and sparkling water for 120 UK pounds. There are two other restaurants to try, a Japanese and a buffet, Can't comment as we didn't try as there are so many other restaurants to try elsewhere. Location a little out of centre but very easy access to HK metro station (Fortress Hill) just 5 mins walk away. Large heated swimming pool on 3rd floor overlooking harbour. Open 7am-7pm. All in all I would recommend this hotel for a reasonably priced stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ryanbruce
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and many staff friendly but several very rude and unhelpful. There's a lack of signs in the hotel therefore finding a bar is difficult. The restaurant has a dress code (which is not apparent until you arrive). Had a bad experience witnessing a member of staff who was extremely rude to a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great views, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Thefox_11
Reviews.Content: Good sized, clean rooms if you get upgraded to a club room. Beds and bathrooms are very good and easy to get use to. The location is a little out of the main tourist areas but I found this great to explore a little further, but 100 mts from train, buses and trams and 2-3 stops to causeway bay / exhibition centre. A good work / polished travellers hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jack K
Reviews.Content: Away from the hustle and bustle of Causeway Bay is this gem of a hotel near North Point. Got a free room upgrade upon arrival and it was the start of a wonderful 2-nite stay. The view from our room was superb but actually we were quite far away from the most beautiful part of Hong Kong harbour. The attached bathroom and jacuzzi bath was beautiful and there was also a small lounge for TV viewing in the Grand Deluxe Harbour View Room. We did not try the hotel breakfast as good and cheap Dim Sum was just around the corner. We tried 2 Dim Sum shops recommended by OpenRice.com and were not dissapointed. Traveling to everywhere else was easy as the MRT station was within a 100m from the hotel. This hotel is still new and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad pub but don't use the airport shuttle bus!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Panda006
Reviews.Content: Having stayed on Kowloon for 25 years this was our first venture onto the island prompted by a conference down the road. This is a relatively new Chinese owned hotel, clean, reasonably priced for a 5 star pub and with attentive competent staff. A few gripes, the room internet connection is a ridiculous HK$130 a day and you need to be a contortionist to get over the lip of the bath into the shower, not user friendly at all. Make sure you stay on the club floors, the breakfast is good with spectacular harbour views and the club lounge serves up good cocktails in a happy hour between 6 and 8pm. However DON'T whatever you do take the airport shuttle bus. It costs the same as a taxi but takes twice as long. We were told it would take just over an hour but in fact by the time we'd waited outside another hotel for 20 minutes for people who never showed up and driven past our hotel twice it took nearly 2 hours. The trip was a shambles with the driver and someone highly agitated shouting at each other over the phone and no one having any idea what was going on. It soured what was an otherwise fairly good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Dont be put off by the location!”
Reviews.Author: Hants-Travellers
Reviews.Content: The large 41 storey hotel sits on the harbour front in North Point Hong Kong. The location is great for a local feel of Hong Kong and a great local food market - worth a visit for the sights and smells! It is two minutes from Fortress Hill MTR station (get an Octopus Card HKD150) and hence only minutes from all the tourist areas. We really suggest you book or upgrade to Harbour Club floor - you will be surprised how much it will save you. This room include breakfast, afternoon tea, and complimentary cocktails. The breakfast is great with cook to order eggs and lots of cooked options, plus fruit, yoghurts etc. Both tea and cocktails come with complimentary snacks and hot nibbles - you really don’t need any other meals! For breakfast you can even use the main restaurant for more choice! Also on this floor you have a small TV in the bathroom to keep up to date with the news etc. All of the staff were fantastic on our stay and checking out was a breeze in the Harbour Club lounge - no queue! The downside - it is located next to a derelict old tower block, with broken windows, now used as a car park. It is however a listed building and will eventually house a museum. Oil Street is car repair land too, so expect to find car on jacks and tyres being changed. Forget all this though as the hotel is truly wonderful with the most magnificent view from the 41st floor restaurant over Hong Kong bay towards Kowloon and the Star Ferry

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel backed up by great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Snakeboy10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place for us to stay in Hong Kong and round of our months trip to the Far East and Australia. It has superb views of the harbour and is a two minute walk (past a couple of excellent Chinese bakeries!) from one of the mass transit stations giving you instant access to Hong Kong Central, Kowloon and beyond. However, we did not get off to the best start. When I booked with the hotel I requested the use of their airport shuttle bus to transport us to the hotel which was acknowledged and informed them that I would be arriving at 5.00am. Upon arrival into Hong Kong at 4.30 am ahead of schedule, I follwed the instructions and headed to the hotels desk in the arrivals hall to find it closed. An employee arrived at 5.45 am and informed me that the first shuttle didnt run unitl 6.30am. I was far from happy and we hung on to get the first bus. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was immiediately taken to the 41st floor to check in at the club desk as I had paid for a club room. On arriving at the desk the staff were extremely helpful and acknowledged my frustration with the shuttle service without me mentioning it (their airport employee had phioned through!). They then informed me that they had prepared a room for me straight away which was such a relief following our long journey and we were able to shower and then enjoy breakfast in the club lounge which had superb views accross to Kowloon and down to central Hong Kong. We had breakfast in the lounge on each morning of our stay and enjoyed afternoon tea and complimentary drinks and canapes in the evning as well as their being soft drinks, tea and coffee being avalable all day. The staff on the club floor were extremely helpfull and able to advise on trips we had planned around HK as well as taking an interest in us. They also extended my check out time on our last day in recognition of my shuttle issues which allowed us more sightseeing time. Thankfully there were no shuttle issues heading home and we were quite sad to be leaving as we had been made to feel so welcome by everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb views of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: acostin76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and it were not for the location i would have rated it with five stars. Location in itself is not terrible but if you spend just 1-2 days in Hong Kong is better to stay in Central. The rooms are spacious for Hong Kong standards and the hotel is new and modern. Overall a good experience especially because of the great views of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodation and great location”
Reviews.Author: CymroDyserth
Reviews.Content: The Grand Harbour offers a range of excellent facilities, especially if you opt for the 'Club' level accommodation. This gives you access to the Club room, with free drinks and 'nibbles' and superb views of Hong Kong harbour. In addition, breakfast is excellent with a vast range of European and Asian foods. Club Rooms are spacious with king sized beds and large bathrooms. Fortress Hill MTR station is only a few minutes walk away, giving you quick access to downtown Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: WOPDingo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in two years. The first time was my first trip to HK, and I liked the place so much I figured I'd go back. The lobby smells great. I know that's an odd statement, but it does. Whatever scent they have piped-in is amazing. The lobby itself is huge and beautifully decorated. I reserved a room on a Club Floor, requiring that we check in on the 41st floor, but mistakenly attempted to check-in at the front desk. One of the staff escorted my friends and I up to the 41st floor and made sure we were situated before heading back down to the lobby. Check-in was quick and without issue. I had forgotten to select some preferences during my online booking (I forgot to request two twin beds and a third, rollaway bed) and had emailed the hotel shortly after. All my post-online-reservation requests were met without hesitation or inconvenience. All the staff were incredibly gracious and spoke English very well. The rooms are average-sized for Asian 4- and 5-star hotels. Three people in one room felt a bit cramped at times, but we made do. The beds are wonderful and the furniture is modern and comfortable. In all, the room was well-appointed and actually looked exactly like the pictures online. The bathroom is great. Of the four walls that make up the bathroom, the "wall" facing the living area is actually just a glass panel, allowing an unimpeded view of Victoria Harbour. This makes for a beautiful scene. The privacy curtain that comes down to allow bathers to do so without an audience *did* let a lot of light through, though. This was especially bothersome at night while using the bathroom as you undoubtedly disturb anyone sleeping in the room. The tub was round and big enough for two, and the rainshower feature was great. The lightswitch for the bathroom, however, was near the front door to the room, which was a bit inconvenient in the middle of the night. We had access to the Club Lounge and was very much worth it. Breakfast in the morning was small, but had all the general Western and Asian necessities and we never left hungry. Plus, there were refreshments and beer available all day, and an afternoon tea that made for a nice snack before heading out for dinner. Plus, Internet access in the Club Lounge was free and relatively speedy. The furniture in the club lounge is nice and modern, but the chairs were not particularly comfortable for "lounging" - they were really big and it was hard to rest against the back of your chair AND reach your cocktail table at the same time. We didn't try the restaurant, 188 Degrees, so I can't comment on that. But the view from the Lounge, especially at night, are amazing. The hotel has a pool and fitness center, neither of which I used. The pool is under renovation, but looks great. The fitness center is actually decently-sized for hotel standards, and all the machines looked new. Maybe I'll save that for next time. A few minuses: -Internet fees in the rooms are astronomical. I still don't understand how that's possible given the rates for the rooms. Internet is so common these days it should be like running water and heat and A/C: standard. If it weren't for the Club Lounge, I wouldn't have had access at all during my time. -The location in North Point is very close to Fortress Hill MTR station, but the two blocks immediately surrounding the hotel are a little dodgy, and full of car-repair garages and other light-industrial businesses. We never felt unsafe or at risk - though we were three men who could handle ourselves in most situations - but it isn't a very picturesque walk from the MTR station to the hotel, not a scenic cab ride. -The hotel has 8 elevators, if I remember correctly, that serve all floors. The only "Express Elevators" they have, are two or three additionally elevators that only serve the ground floor through the 5th floor. I think that's a horrible waste of resources given that there're 35 or so floors of guest rooms. On more than one occasion, a tour group arrived in the lobby at the same time as my friends and I, and we had to wait upwards of 5-7 minutes to get an elevator, and then we were crammed into an elevator like sardines. They need to re-evaluate the concept and allocation of the Express Elevators. Even with the couple of nit-picky things, this hotel was great a year ago, and it was great last week. I have recommended it to friends already. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gapyeargrannie
Reviews.Content: We had great service, if you really want the inside deal on HK ask Sunny in the Lesiure Suite, he knows HK like the back of his hand. Spacious deluxe room, well equipped. There is a modesty button the bathroom wall to bring down a blind on the glass bathroom walls. Being jet lagged it took a day or two to notice it, during which time my husband had to look out the window! We ate in the Chinese Restaurant and had a great chinese western style meal, the staff did teach me how to use chopsticks! Very clean and very grand but not snooty. Would stay again. Internet facilty very expensive Short walk to underground station. Underground easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Hong-Kong on business...with business people”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: I do not go to H-K on business very often, but I usually find the regular business hotels there a bit disappointing. This one has a good sea facing location, but fails to turn it into anything memorable. It works around the clock (i got myself a very good burger at 2am) and the rooms are very comfortable, but there is nothing that makes you want to come back.it is packed with business people, the breakfast room is a giant cantine, and the area is not particularly attractive so you may well stay in (and if it rains you will wait 30m at the taxi rank anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Nice place to say with awesome view of the Harbour from the room”
Reviews.Author: NeelXL
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location & awesome view from it's harbour view rooms... Rooms are well appointed albeit a bit small than you would rate a luxurious room. Food is great so is service. Really enjoyed our family vacation stay during christmass holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, however a little too far away from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Midsmatty
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were automatically given a late check out at no extra charge due to our depart flight time. Nice touch. Our room had a harbour view, it was very clean with good levels of equipment. Buffet breakfast option very very good, again really good views of the harbour. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The only slight negative would be that it is a fair distance from the city centre, however we didn't mind as the underground system was very good and our closest station was only a couple of mintues walk.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing that let this hotel down was pokey rooms!”
Reviews.Author: heatherhoward100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing in most respects - huge chandeliers, good location and amazing views, however the small rooms really let this hotel down. I guess it's a similar story around most of Hong Kong, but we stayed in an executive room so expected a little more from our room. The executive complementary food and drinks were good - especially the cocktails! And the views from the execuitve lounge are just stunning - it's so nice sitting up there whilst there's a storm goin on and watching the rain and lightning all around you! We didn't really explore restaurants near the hotel as we tended to eat a late lunch and head back to the hotel for complementary canapes, snacks and drinks in the evenings. this meant that we saved a bomb on food and drink in such an expensive city, so I would definitely recommend upgrading if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Club at the Harbour Grand comes Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Brist0l01
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We booked a Club Room which was well worth the small premium. Dedicated check-in, access to the Club Lounge, complimentary cocktails and canapes each evening, daily breakfast and free internet access. The hotel has aspects of art nouveau styling with luxurious rooms overlooking the harbour. The bathroom was small but chic and spotlessly clean. We particularly liked the 'pillow menu' with over 12 different types of pillow to choose from. We stayed here on our last leg of our honeymoon and were welcomed with a bottle of champagne and lovely congratulatory card from the hotel team. It was a lovely touch and made our stay extra-special. During our stay we dined in Le 188o restaurant which is highly recommended. The live jazz contributed to a relaxed and indulgent atmosphere with spectacular views of the harbour. The food was excellent, much better than that of Kwan Cheuk Heen restaurant on the fifth floor which was cold, rushed and poor in quality. Definitely to be avoided. The Club Lounge Reception staff were particularly attentive and offered excellent service. We stayed here for three nights and wished we had stayed longer. Our flight home departed extremely early in the morning which meant we missed breakfast in the hotel. This was not overlooked by the Club Lounge Reception staff who offered a breakfast box to take away without us asking for one. This was delivered to our room at 4.30am prior to check out and was vey impressive packed full with fresh continental breakfast goodies consisting of boiled eggs, pastries, yoghurts, fresh orange, water, muffins, sandwiches etc. The hotel was situated in a good location, away from the hustle and bustle and only a short walk from the metro. For sight-seeing we would recommend the Big Bus Company tour which we caught from the Central Pier. It was roughly 25 pounds each and although expensive in comparison to the local transport it offered a very informative tour taking in sights around Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, Aberdeen Bay and out to Stanley Market. The tickets lasted for 48 hours where you could hop on and off at various stops and included free tickets for the Star Ferry and Peak Tram. For a luxurious stay offering great value for money, don't miss out on the Harbour Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Az0i
Reviews.Content: A nice Hotel , only 18 months old, room was fine with a nice view of the Harbour. No free broadband, cost was $140hkg a day ! Too much.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: copy_that
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for New Year's Eve 2010 The hotel is very well appointed with really trendy bathrooms. We stayed on the harbor side and absolutely loved the view. We could watch the fireworks and laser show from there (but we didn't, we went onto the streets!) The hotel was very clean and quiet even though several events, including a wedding reception and New Years, were being held downstairs. Staff was friendly. We never ate at the hotel as we wanted to try a bunch of places on our visit, so can't comment about food. We found the area easy to navigate and just a subway ride away from anything we wanted to do in the city. Can I just reinstate that the bathrooms were amazing and immaculate? This was our "splurge" hotel at the end of long backpacking trip in Southeast Asia, and it was the perfect "relaxation in civilization" hotel. Soft beds, perfect climate control... just really nice and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: richmondlady06
Reviews.Content: If you want fabulous views of the Harbour and a trendy bathroom, this is the place to stay. The bar and restaurant on the top floor is well worth a visit. However, the food is overpriced for what it is. I also thought the Mediterranean buffet served in the evening was far too expensive and not particularly good quality. The breakfast buffet was excellent but we were rather surprised one morning when we arrived one minute after 10.30 and were told that the buffet was closed, even though guests who had arrived on the dot of 10.30 were still helping themselves to food. We were made to order from the menu and put in a corner like a couple of naughty school children. I would expect more flexibility from the staff in a hotel of this category, given that the customer is usually the top priority of a hotel like this. To give him his due, the buffet manager let us off paying the bill for the breakfast that was served to us off the menu after we complained to him. The hotel is in a very good location with buses and a metro nearby. I wasn't keen on the decor in the lobby - it looked a bit nouveau riche.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views - Ex Value for Money - Book the Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JIV64
Reviews.Content: Half the cost of equivalent luxury hotels on Kowloon and no catch. We booked a club room which came with dedicated reception, lounge, internet access, breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails. Excellent views over the river to Kowloon. Good comfortable bed, and powerful shower (& bath), excellent service and fantastic staff. We had an early check in and breakfast and access to lounge until room was ready. This was especially welcome as we'd arrived at the airport at 5am. Similarly late checkout and lounge access until we left for a very late flight. Hotel is very near MTR station and easy access everywhere. Trams at top of road and ditto buses. Very safe area with more locals and atmosphere and no touts. Hint - get an Octopus card (like Oyster) for use on all transport. Try the Fish Spa at the Victoria Peak Gallery & take advantage of the free Cultural opportunities especially the Tea Appreciation class. Happy Valley Racing well worth a visit but go it alone not on an organised trip. $10 entrance!!!

Reviews.Title: “We found a hidden gem, a fantastic hotel for comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: Roger073
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure in staying at The Harbour Grand on our way to Sydney, unfortunatley we only stayed for 2 nights, looking back I wished it had been longer. We had booked into the club floors and do they live up to a 5 star rating, the staff that looked after us in the club lounge went out of their way to make you feel welcome, the service was outstanding. I know its wrong to single out individuals but Cecelia and Kayan deserve a special mention for their dedication. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of planning a stopover in Hong Kong, Yes it looks slightly out of the hussel, but it is well worth the odd cheap taxi ride back. also the hotel provides a shuttle service into the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & what a view”
Reviews.Author: Marvick5520
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in January 2011 with my wife. Requested a room with King size beds, on arrival, the check in staff acknowledged & check in was smooth. The slow lifts was the only hitch (considering there are 9 banks of elevator) Our room is on the 32nd floor. Decent size room by Hong Kong standards, very clean, modern, with flat HD TV, cordless phone, very nice view of the harbour (could be better if facing the Central side). Can't really ask for more for the price I paid. The bathroom is probably the biggest I've seen in a Hong Kong hotel & get use to all glass wall. Like others have mentioned, not a lot happens in the area, the garage wasn't a bother, just another corner shop. The hotel location is a problem since its safe andit is close to lots of eating establishments & very close the MTR(subway) Fortress Hill station. It takes a few minutes to get to the station & the hotel provides shuttle to Central. Most of the staff I came across were polite, doorman always did his job with a smile. Overall, rate our stay excellent, I will stay at this hotel again. Service was good & location is close to MTR, we can't complain about the room & for the price, I don't think I can find another hotel in Hong Kong with higher standards. The only thing to watch for is local call is not free ($6/call) & internet access is $140HKD/day (considering this should be part of the price for the room for most places).

Reviews.Title: “Service not up to 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: PennyH2009
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after nearly 4 weeks in China, and reception couldn't find our booking. This took ages to sort out which wasn't quite a good start. We were eventually upgraded to a Club room, but its benefits weren't explained to us, and we only found all the things we could have had towards the end of our stay. We had booked a harbour view room, and the view of the island from our room was magnificent. Room large and well maintained, although not as well appointed as some of the hotels we stayed in in China. The breakfast restaurant was awful. Breakfast was supposedly served until 10am, but on the dot the staff started to clear everything away making it impossible to have a leisurely breakfast even if you came down at 9.30am. This we found very annoying especially as we were on holiday and wanted to start our day in a leisurely fashion. Although location a little way from the centre, very close to the Hum Hom ferry terminal and also the hotel ran a very efficient minibus shuttle every half hour to the centre. We do not have a laptop so went to the business centre to reconfirm our flights prior to our trip home. Whilst many 5 star hotels around the world offer this service for free, the hotel did not have any staff to do this, and wanted to charge for use of a computer to do this ourselves. Just a small point but really not acceptable. Whilst I could recommend this hotel in lots of ways, I would need to be assured that the niggles would be ironed out before I personally considered returning.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ak3888
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in January 2011. Requested a room with 2 single beds on arrival, the check in staff acknowledged, but when we arrived at our room, it was a king bed configuration... not nice after a 12 hours flight and anxious to hit town before the shops close, the slow lifts doesn't help either... However, when I returned to the lobby and reported the mix up to another staff, she apologised and quickly arranged the right room for us, then she personally walk me up to the newly assigned room and made sure everything was OK. Very nicely dealt with. Our room is on the 28th floor. Decent size room by Hong Kong standards, very clean, modern, with flat HD TV, cordless phone, very nice view of the harbour. Can't really ask for more for the price I paid. The bathroom is probably the biggest I've seen in a Hong Kong hotel. Like others have mentioned, not a lot happens in the area, the garage wasn't a bother, just another corner shop. Can't really say location is a problem since its safe and the MTR(Metro/Tubes) station is very close by. But at times, it takes a few minutes to cross each road(theres 3) to get to the station, quite annoying knowing that its so near by. And if its at night, after a few drinks, I just wish my hotel was more central. Most of the staff I came across were polite, doorman always did his job with a smile. But they let themselves down on the last day, when I was leaving for an early morning flight. I had plenty of luggages and literally needed someone to open the door. The doorman wasn't there, (ok I didn't expect a doorman to be on duty at 5:30am) but staffs at the concierge were busy doing their own work, I had to ask them to open the door, they didn't respond very well... Overall, if their rate stays low, I will stay at this hotel again. Services were hit and miss, location is not the best, but I can't complain about the room. And for the price, I don't think I can find another hotel in Hong Kong with higher standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Br0mleigh
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried by previous reviews about the poor service, but were pleasantly surprised to have no such experience. The hotel rooms are luxurious and well appointed (if a bit small), the bed extremely comfortable-- after walking around all day in Hong Kong it was nice to come home to our room (upgraded to the upper Harbour Club floors at no charge). While there are auto shops on the street it's located on (less than scenic), it is really only a 3 minute walk to MTR Fortress Hill Station, with 7-11, McDonald's, Starbucks nearby if you want a quick breakfast. Free shuttles depart every hour to Causeway Bay, door men will walk a distance away to grab you a cab if none are sitting out front...Overall, great value for money. Everything in Hong Kong is so close together, you are only a quick cab/train/shuttle ride away from everything. We will be back again and would recommend it easily to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - Great position - great service!”
Reviews.Author: laney365
Reviews.Content: We read a few reviews about this hotel and we were a bit worried about the location, but we had no worries when we got there. Okay, there are a couple of auto shops nearby but if you are offended by these, I don't think you will like HK! There are high end shops near stalls everywhere and the positioning of the hotel gave an insight into real life. The hotel is convenient for the tram, MTR and bus and the hotel's free shuttle will take you into town. It's well worth seeing the deals on offer, or ask, about upgrading to the Harbour Club. You can have breakfast, including eggs benedict, afternoon tea, including scones etc and alcoholic drinks from 6-8pm. This includes a range of cocktails. The staff are very helpful and warn you when the bar is closing! Having breakfast looking over the harbour really gets you going in the morning, ready to explore. Tea and coffee is available all day and free internet access. The rooms are a little small but who wants to spend time in their room! (Although the beds are really comfortable). The bathroom is a treat and the range of toiletries superb! (flannel, soap, shaving kit, toothbrush and toothpaste, sewing kit, shower gel, shampoo) See the travel desk as soon as you arrive and arrange some trips, we particularly recommend the "Come Horseracing tour" Also, take your swimmys, the outdoor pool (even in December) is beautifully heated and you can see across the harbour. We were very impressed that a lifeguard was immediately sent out as soon as we stepped out of the changing room.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: billybunter64
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the harbour Grand, we stayed on the club floor, and spent a lot of time relaxing in the Club Lounge on the top floor, drinking and eating with spectacular views of the Harbour, it was well worth the extra. We used the train a lot which was very close by and convenient. The food at the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Babychipster
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and clean. I love the fact that it was away from the tourist areas and I love the local feel. The Fortress MTR station is just about 3 blocks away from the hotel. The hotel employees were nothing but kind and helpful. They showed me what my charges were at check-in so there were no surprises at check out. Housekeeping was great, they provided bottled waters everyday and even brought more at your request. The only negative thing about the hotel is they charge for Wi-Fi. I believe $15US for 24 hours or $40 HK for15 mins. If you go to the local Starbucks they provide free Wi-Fi for up to 20 mins. The Hong Kong Public Library which is about a 15 min walk provides free Wi-Fi if needed. Overall, great place to stay, never heard any noise from other rooms. Hallways are a bit smokey but you don't smell it in your room. Bathroom was awesome. I will plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - well located, away from all the chaos!!!”
Reviews.Author: Goofy05
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in 2 rooms with husband and 3 kids. Was a bit wary of the hotel after reading some of the reviews but was very pleasantly surprised!! We were upgraded from the basic room to one that was slightly larger as we had a rollaway bed. Rooms were still quite small but probably quite large in Hong Kong standards!! The hotel is still quite new so everything is lovely and clean and fresh. The view from the room is the main reason I chose this hotel and it didn't disappoint. The beds were probably the best hotel beds we have ever slept in - very plush and comfy. The bathroom was fantastic - lovely big bath with overhead shower head - very easy to use. Location was not an issue. There are a few small car repair places around the hotel but it is definitely not a problem and I always felt safe. It was actually quite nice staying out of the madness that is Hong Kong, and I think the view makes up for this. Breakfast buffet at the hotel was a little disappointing so we only did this once. Very expensive and almost no fruit to speak of. The eggs they use for the omelettes came out of a carton which totally put me off!! The dinner buffet however, was exceptional!! There are plenty of little eateries around the hotel (Starbucks x 2, McDonalds, 7Up, small bakery etc) so we got breakfast from these each morning. Train station is only a short walk away (2-3 min). Room service was great - reasonably priced and tasty. Concierge were helpful and they have a harpist playing in the lobby every night which is a lovely touch. Taxis are cheap (around $40 from hotel to Central - Star Ferry), plus they have a free shuttle bus that runs hourly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone - and I am quite fussy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “O.k”
Reviews.Author: ABDIUL
Reviews.Content: Location not central. Service could be better. Hotel excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with less money”
Reviews.Author: Fintravel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Harbour Grand for three nights and we really enjoyed our stay. We had booked a Deluxe Harbour view room. The hotel is not located in the busiest center but it is very near the MTR station and the Causeway Bay shopping district is not too far away. Service was almost excellent and the hotel was very clean. Rooms were quite small but we didn't think it was a problem. Beds were excellent! We would definitely recommend this hotel. Positive: + Nice rooms with a great view + Beds + Service + Breakfast + Facilities Negatives: - They tried to charge for one breakfast when we were checking out even tough we had already paid it earlier - They haven't got a free shuttle bus to the airport - Soundproofing between room and corridor was poor - There was not free internet service

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdventure22203
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights en route to a conference in Guangzhou. The location is just slightly off the beaten path near some (smelly) auto shops, but it is very accessible with a Metro stop 2 blocks away. I think the reduced price relative to comparable hotels in more central locations was well worth it. We paid just over $200 US /night and were upgraded to an amazing suite! We had a paranoramic view (about 270 degrees) of the Harbor. Very comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom with shower and large tub, a separate door to the bedroom, large sitting area, eating table and computer table, small fridge, and microwave and two burners (didn't use them). Room service was just OK and overpriced (as in just about every hotel). Pool was very nice. Staff was very nice. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: joandgr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Harbour Grand for thirteen nights and had a very good experience.On arrival the receptionist was friendly and helpful and we decided to upgrade to the Harbour club floor which was expensive but for us was an excellent decision.The service on the club floor was excellent,very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast with eggs to order,afternoon tea and evening drinks with canapes were all good and the view over the harbour amazing.Free internet access was available as well as free local calls etc which was very useful for us as my son lives in Hong Kong and we were waiting for my first grandchild to arrive. Our room was very comfortable with a good view and an excellent bathroom with a super shower and a bath. The hotel is not situated in a touristy area and is described as 'gritty' in one guide book,it's a working area with car workshops etc but is not at all threatening and is interesting.It's only about eight minutes walk to the MTR and the buses and trams,make sure you get an Octupus card at the airport,excellent value. We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants,they are very expensive,if you want to eat locally walk towards the main road and on the first road on the right is Henry's Kitchen,second right is Coffee Millano which we thought was the better of these two Italian restaurants or try the Woooden Table opposite. Otherwise go to Causeway Bay on the hotel shuttle bus or the MTR or taxi where there are lots of restaurants Red Pepper was our favourite.Also a Thai restaurant in a small street of restaurants just to the left of the world trade centre where the hotel shuttle bus stops. A taxi back is very cheap. Our only negative comment about the hotel would be the lifts as you usually have to wait a long time for one! All in all good value,the hotel would be a lot more expensive if it was more central. We will be visiting Hong Kong again next year and will almost certainly stay at the Harbour Grand.

Reviews.Title: “5 star appearance 1 star customer service”
Reviews.Author: sigal
Reviews.Content: I had been travelling for a month around vietnam and cambodia and to finish off our holiday we had 4 days and 5 nights in Hong Kong so we decided to treat oursleves and booked Harbour Grand as it was a 5 star hotel and the website looked amazing, however I was so disappointed with the service. Dont get me wrong the hotel is stunning and the location was good, but the customer service did not match. I was paying over a £1000 which in my book is a lot of money and for that you expect a level of service. they have 800 rooms so of course they dont have time for each customer staying there, it's very much like if you dont take the room someone else will. RUDE, UNHELPFUL, ABRUPT. made a complaint and was told the manager would call me back- did he......NO It took them 1 hour to send us tea bags to our room, we had to call house keeping 3 times, the breakfast was so average, reception are not helpful at all, top floor bar is nice but not as nice as others in Hong kong. we stayed in a no star hotel called moment in hanoi in vietnam just before and they had customer service and style to a tee. they were more 5star than harbour grand. It's a shame because the place is nice but they'll make you feel annoyed by staying there, spending serious cash and having the most rudiest people around you. Dont be fooled by the website.

Reviews.Title: “All at your convenience”
Reviews.Author: HooliganHugo
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, convenient accommodation, good location

Reviews.Title: “Super Service”
Reviews.Author: MarGio06
Reviews.Content: Indeed, rooms are good and views amazing but I haven't seen many reviews here yet about the Grand's amenities for meetings. I stayed at the Grand in October 2010 (first time) where I had several meetings in different parts of the hotel (conference center and top floor), all of which were organized perfectly and featured impeccable service. I've been around for business in HK, with meetings in different hotels, but the Grand tops them all. Plenty of staff around, all very helpful and attentive, great food (during meetings and for lunch) and pleasant meeting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but this review is for Indian visitors”
Reviews.Author: Akshat T
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel ,excellent view,excellent facilities. Indians visiting this hotel should keep in mind that the Indian food selection is hardly there and also they will not try to please you with special requests. Also of you are visiting Ladies market or any other part in Kowloon or Jordan area it will be hard to get taxis in the night to this hotel. There are quite a few eating places near this hotel also the MTR and good stores are around here.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Grand - the pro's and the (many) con's”
Reviews.Author: kemgjp
Reviews.Content: FIrstly, we love Hong Kong and this hotel is in a wonderful location with possibly the best views of Victoria Harbour. The rooms were clean, modern and well appointed. That is where the "positives" finish. We travelled with another couple, both booked Grand Deluxe harbour view rooms. Our friends were given a lower category room and wouldn't have been the wiser until they saw the room we had, despite being charged the same room rate as us. Afte staying for 5 nights, we decided to upgrade to a suite on level 37, giving the hotel over 24 hours notice to arrange this for us. When the time came for us to re-check into our suite, it wasn't ready, despite being assured it would be ready by 3pm. They said "you can have it at 6pm". This was totally unacceptable. They then offered us a suite on the 32nd floor, which was ready immediately, so we took it as we did not wish to wait 3 more hours for our original suite request to be ready. No apology was given. We entertained 4 guests that night in the suite. The suite had a kitchenette with 2 electric elements for cooking, a fridge and a freezer, yet there was not a single utensil in the entire kitchenette. Not a knife, no wine glasses, no plates, no dishes, nothing. For the (hefty) price we paid, we would have expected the suite to be kitted out with glasses, utensils, dishes, etc. It was bare. We then asked for a late checkout (3pm, only an extra hour) and were assured that was fine. Upon returning to the hotel at 2pm our room cards no longer worked. Front desk never apologised, they just re-activated the room cards. We were also quoted incorrect pricing several times, even after quering the pricing. There were too many incorrect prices supplied to be an innocent mistake!!!! Our friends were initially given a lower category room yet had pre-paid for a higher category one. They complained and were moved, once again, no explanation or apology offered. The hotel appears to be a 5 star hotel but the service, constant errors made, and lack of any professionalism on the front desk is not of 5 star quality at all. If you intend staying, beware of all room pricing given to you and expect lengthy delays and errors if you wish to change rooms, request late checkouts, etc etc. We will return to Hong Kong again but will not stay at Harbour Grand despite the great views. There are far better run / managed alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIEW”
Reviews.Author: LABUNNY
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night, but having stayed at other Hong Kong Hotels, I though that the value of this hotel was very reasonable. My mother and I were upgraded upon our check in and we were put in a double room with a sofa. The room was very large and comfortable. The beds were firm yet soft. Down comforters and great large pillows. The decor is modern, simple, and very tastefully decorated. I loved the bathroom. It had a big round bathtub that looked like a jacuzzi. I only wished that it could have been a jacuzzi, it could have come in very helpful after a full day of walking. The was a huge shower head from the ceiling as well as hand held shower from the wall. The tiles from the bathroom were beautifully decorated, and overall the bathroom looked like a spa! The full view of the harbor was amazing! When I booked, it said harbor view, but I thought that I would only get a little peak at the view. Upon entering the room, I was actually surprised that it was almost full view! The metro is only 3 short blocks away. There are lots of restaurants near by. The service of hotel was nice. I didn't have too much interaction with the staff except that the TV was not working and they sent an electrician to fix it right away. The hotel has a nice heated pool with a view overlooking the harbor. I wished that I was able to use it, but I didn't bring a swim suit. The only draw back is that the hotel is next to the freeway, so the location of the hotel is kind of hidden and the surrounding of the hotel is not so nice, but it is OK and safe. The pro is that the MTR is only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled twice into staying, but won't be fooled again.”
Reviews.Author: Trebor68
Reviews.Content: I stayed her twice in the last 6 months, the second visit lasted over 2 weeks. The hotel is good enough, the rooms are well appointed, the views pretty much what they promise by way of views, etc (but how important is that?!). The major problem with the hotel is billing. On both occasions, reception tried to levy charges to my bill which were included in my room rate. Be very careful of their online "special offers". The hotel claimed not to even know of the rate package I purchased online in July, trying to charge me for internet which was included. Then the breakfast charges... the restaurant never got it right and both stays I spent 20+ minutes on check out arguing with reception over restaurant charges that should be included. Anyway, the management of this place left with me such a bad taste that I will never cross the door of this hotel again. It is seemingly run by management intent on screwing every last $ out of its guests, in a very shady fashion. The tactic they perform at reception is also very distasteful, with threats and ever higher managers being wheeled out to argue their point, with no consideration for the guest's claim (I was asked in July to provide proof of the hotel's own online rate offer!). Never again Harbour Grand, I hope you all the worst business! Anyone booked to stay - make sure on check in you understand the complex ins and outs of their "offers". Anyone considering it, well your choice. But there are better, more honest and hotels with far better locations to choose from (Langham Kowloon for me next time!).

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag. Overall pretty nice but rooms too small for the $$$$ you pay.”
Reviews.Author: Jacketwatch
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here last mo. on a holiday. Overall the rooms were very nice and comfortable. The bed was great though I must say except for the added dimensions of the bathroom the overall sq. footage was about the same as a balcony room on a cruise ship. For about $250.00 per noc I did expect more. The breakfast buffet was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oliver007India
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Not only as a structure and the fact that all rooms have a great view, but the staff and people are tremendously efficient and pleasant. In spite of a language constraint the effort people make to take care, follow up and look after a customers needs speaks volumes of the kind of training and quality of people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Value, Great roof top bar.”
Reviews.Author: TL28
Reviews.Content: I'm fortunate enough to have stayed in a good number of hotels in Hong Kong over the years, and have a pretty good knowledge of the Island. This Hotel is in North Point, not an area I usually stay, as I've always preferred to be a little nearer down town. That said this hotel is no more than 5 to 10 minutes by either underground or taxi, to most of the hot spots of Causeway bay (shopping and eating), Wanchai (Bars) and Admiralty/Central.(Shopping/Eating/Bars/ star ferry).
