Remember Underground and Taxi's are good value in HK. It's located opposite Fortress Hill MTR. Is a good base either for Business or leisure. The rooms are a little bigger (I was on the 32nd floor), than some hotels, and were clean and comfortable. You do though get a little road noise. The service good. I got a good room rate , the breakfast buffet very good. This hotel has one of the best rooftop bars in HK, great views of both HK and Kowloon, drinks though are pricey at about £7 for a bottle of beer. I'll stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Astrobop
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as the last stop in my round the world journey and chose it on the basis of wanting a bit of luxury and indulgence before returning home. I wasn’t disappointed. This was an excellent hotel and generally fantastic experience. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes from the main subway (MTR) station and then less than 10 minutes from Hong Kong centre. The staff and service in this hotel was near perfect . I arrived at 6am (well before the scheduled 2pm check in) and they put me in a room immediately without asking. The room was a good size with great harbour views. The hotel had all the luxuries you would expect from a five star hotel, great pool, fantastic gym and the staff went out of their way to help. I didn’t use the spa facilities but wish I had. I would definitely recommend taking your breakfast at the hotel as you can have a full international feast that will keep you topped up for the whole day. On check out they let me keep my room for 3 hours extra with no charge and then could use the gym facilities to freshen up before my late night flight. All in all I was a very delighted customer. I would recommend this hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good view, decent quality”
Reviews.Author: freeier
Reviews.Content: Used it for a self planned business trip: 1. decent price for a business hotel 2. was upgraded to a suite and the views from the sitting room, bed room and bathroom was fantastic. 3. overall quality of room was good.. 4. heated outdoor swimming poor was fantastic.. decent size for lapping and great atmosphere... 5. lack of taxi is a major problem.. but easily overcome if you are flexible and can take the subway. 6. not far from the city central and yet convenient enough for business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels in HK”
Reviews.Author: imex500
Reviews.Content: the hotel ins very new, luxurious with a great harbour veiw, room is reasonable comparing to hong kong hotels cosy and well furnished, although we were in a premium room but the view is impaired by the hotel building side, service was ok and the conceirge has no answers about many important city attractions, and very arrogant.not up to the hotel level

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JackieOC
Reviews.Content: First of all, thank you so much for those who wrote reviews for this hotel; it really helped me plan my trip. I stayed in this hotel for four days. I was impressed by how clean the room was. Everything was spotless. The bed was so comfortable, it really helped me to rest after a long trip on the plane. The shower room is one of the best, you don't have to wait at all for the hot water. The locations is excellent and convenient, for it is near the Fortress Hill MTR station. BTW, there is a money exchange nearby the hotel on Oil Street, the rate there is better than that at the aiport rate. My only complain is that you have to pay 130 HK dollars for internet connection. The restaurant in the hotel on the third floor is overpriced ( for breakfast) There are better chioces nearby the hotel. (walking distance)

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: UkFordy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Every request was met. Customer service was excellent nothing was to much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bex2683
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too sure about the location of this hotel but it's close to the MTR and taxis are great value in HK. This hotel is on the island so great for nightlife and if you are heading to the convention centre which is really close by. The bar is great with amazing views and lots of small private areas that can be used for meetings. It also has an outside area which I imagine is really popular in summer, but it was easily warm enough for a drink when I visited. I will be talking about the bathroom in my room for months to come which was easily the most luxurious bathroom I have ever seen, and bathrooms in HK are a very high standard. The room itself was compact but had everything you need and a beautiful harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business and leisure....”
Reviews.Author: kashyapsagar
Reviews.Content: The Grand harbour is a very beautiful property by the harborfornt and gives you an amazing view be it day or night. the rooms are comfortable with mini bar and all other facilities that you could expect in a 5* hotel. It has glass bathrooms with electronic curtains which when open could give you a surprise as people may nhot be aware how to operate the curtains. Located about an hour away from the airport and disneyland , this hotel is on the hong kong island and centrally located. The only problem that someone could face in this property are the elevators. they are slow and take ages to come by. it has a beautiful restaurant on level 5 and the roof top one on the 41st level is just awesome. the perfect place for a candle lit dinner with your spouse with the hong kong skyline in the background., just amazing!! a great ballroom on level 1 which are very well done up with artistic chandeliers which leave you awestruck. The hotel also boasts of a spa and swimming pool on level 7 and 3 respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and style”
Reviews.Author: Birene
Reviews.Content: We spent hours deciding on a hotel in Hong Kong, our sixth and final week of our European and HK holiday. Not having been to Hong Kong for 25 years, and realising that it had changed considerably, we debated about a harbour view, and whether we preferred a mainland or HK Island location. Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked Harbour Grand Hong Kong on line. Their instant confirmation and very friendly correspondence set a positive tone for our stay. After flying overnight from London we took the Airport Shuttle Bus, a journey of 45 minutes, and arrived at the Hotel at 8.30 a.m. As experienced, independent travelers, having covered all continents and extensively explored 75 countries, we realise that everyone’s impressions and satisfaction levels of hotels differ widely. However, we only got as far as the foyer door to be certain that this was to be a special stay. Quite obviously this hotel knew what service meant and that guests were very welcome! The sophisticated elegance of this hotel’s entrance foyer is dramatic; but it was the smiles at the entrance that said it all. Despite us telling the reception staff that we were hours early and could we please have our luggage looked after until check in time we were immediately taken up to Floor 41 - we had booked a Club room. We were shown to a table in what we came to realise was the Club lounge, and ten minutes later were treated to an unexpected but very welcome breakfast. By 9.30 a.m. we were unpacking in our luxurious and spacious room on the 40th floor and gazing out at the fabulous harbour views. For one glorious week we enjoyed the Club hospitality - smiles, chats, genuine interest in where we had been and what we had planned - from staff who can only be described as wonderful professionals. They are absolutely world class. It was a pleasure to stay here, have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would definitely stay again. Sure, it is located to the east of Causeway Bay, but is easily accessible via trams, buses and the quite brilliant MTR underground system [Fortress Hill station]. In its price bracket this hotel is an excellent option and well worth considering. By the way - on Trip Advisor there were comments about this hotel being in a local area where ‘locals’ live and where car servicing takes place along the road. Yes, there is and it does; and this adds to the interest and great charm of the North Point area. This is Hong Kong, the real Hong Kong, where we wandered at night down to Victoria Park to watch the beautiful lantern Festival; and admire the locals by day as they exercised, chatted, lived; where it took but a few minutes and a couple of stops on the MTR to reach Causeway Bay with its restaurants and shopping; or to take the quaint trams that rumble through the main street to Central and beyond, thereby accessing The Peak, the Central bus station, Star Ferry to the mainland; and so much more. We purchased a transport card and highly recommend them. It’s called an Octopus Card. For the equivalent of $20 Australian each we made multiple daily trips on trains, buses, trams and ferries, including ferries to two of the outer islands. This was exceptional value, but best of all it was very convenient as there is no queuing up. At the end of the week we were taken by the Hotel’s courtesy coach to the Central Railway Station where airline check in was completed in minutes, and the technological up to the minute train whisked us to the amazing airport for our homeward journey. Now we’ll save to be able to return to HK and Harbour Grand HK.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I had a wonderful time at this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhassinger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in November 2010. Beautiful hotel and great service. Easy access to MTR and cheap taxi fare to Central and other locations. Beautiful view of Harbour. Not located in the center of the typical tourist areas of Hong Kong, but only a couple miles away - and certainly well worth the value. Breakfast buffet was average. We would stay here again. The hotel helped us arrange two tours - one to The Peak and one to the Big Buddha. Both were fun. We also did the Harbour Dinner Cruise to see the light show. Within walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVA again”
Reviews.Author: Marko K
Reviews.Content: My second visit this beautiful hotel and all is the same, the best, spetial Sleep quality is the best of the best..something perfect....only one thing is minus...i connect my iphone in restoran on internet and charge for 24 hours 120 hkd on my room number and this is ok, but when arrive in room i try connect whith my notebook and must pay again 24 hours rate. I know that this are 2 devices :), but is not correct charge twice on same room NUMBER. If it's charhe on name and room, why i must pay twice...very strange...i'm alone in room and have 2 devices and pay connect for booth.....:-)....all other perfect...

Reviews.Title: “Impressive value for HK Island”
Reviews.Author: KLBOS
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights - odd location but only 2mins to Fortress Hill Metro and less than 10 mins to Central for $5hk so getting about in the evening was fine - not mant restaurants in walking distance - hotel was over all very comfortable - best beds ever - we were upgraded to club floor and comfort was excellent - be aware of electric screen to separate bedroom from bathroom ! bar on top floor fab although on one night it was booked for a private party and even residents couldnt go in buntil really late - breakfast good but kept being seated well away from the food so felt like a long walk even to get juice! definately worth paying a little more for HK Island - I would stay here again if only for the fab bed and pillows!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: dlerital
Reviews.Content: we have stayed 8 nights at this hotel and we were very pleased with the hotel. i chose this hotel on TA, based on recent comments and pictures. we were in room 3605, facing the bay. the room was very nice with a huge bed, a sofa and a fantastic view. the bathroom was very big and there was a big bathtub. the only drawback is the internet that was not free. the hotel itself is very nice with an amazing lobby and the bar on the last floor offers a breathtaking view of the whole bay. the staff was very nice and quick. the swimming pool is really nice as well. the hotel is located at the fortress hill station which is not really in the heart of the action, even though it's really fast to go to causeway bay by taxi or by tube. do not forget to buy an octopus pass when you're there. also, don't forget you might need five minutes to go from your room to the lobby taking the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Looked better on internet”
Reviews.Author: TRS06
Reviews.Content: The room was good, if a bit on the small side, reasonable views £180 per night for a standard room, not jusify the price tag. No Free wifi in room or internet in hotel, £13 per day for wifi in room (scandalous). Out of the way a bit, further than causeway bay.Staff very friendly and helpful. Looked amazing when i booked it from their website, but not as good in real life. Just extras all the tme and very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and good vibe”
Reviews.Author: jaksdad
Reviews.Content: New hotel out of the centre but convenient for MTR and taxi's relatively cheap to/from downtown. Fabulous views from pool area and 41st floor restaurant towards Kowloon and Central.Best bits include star ferry from Kowloon at 8 pm to see light show from skyscrapers ,travelling the escalators at night and diving into bars,galleries,street markets and restaurants. Nice quiet area surrounding hotel with 1/2 decent and cheap bars and restaurants - also felt very safe walking around. Rooms small but comfortable - nice bathrooms but maids make noise after 9am. Restaurants in hotel expensive but good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accommodation, personalised service with attention to every detail. Staff ratio to guest numbers exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsfromSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean and the staff were of the highest quality. Nothing is too much trouble. Scheuled buses take you to Hong Kong Central. Great gym with swimming pool and outside area where patrons can practise yoga or tai chai. Could not have asked for more. Exceptional 5 star hotel at an affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise...will stay again in future”
Reviews.Author: Anthony2003
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning after a long flight and they were able to get me into my room. Check in was smooth, the room was quite small with nice and modern decor, view of Central and Kowloon was amazing. Bed and bathroom were comfortable and clean. The pool was beautiful and was not busy throughout my stay. There were a lot of restaurants in the area with a Starbucks nearby. The location was within a ten minute walk from the Fortress Hill MTR station and did not bother me at all. There were plenty of taxis available at very reasonable rates. The concierge was fantastic and super-friendly in helping with restaurants, travel arrangements, etc. Would I stay at the hotel again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Hong Kong experience”
Reviews.Author: MrsOgg
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from Grand Harbour Hong Kong and have to say the hotel is very good. Having read others comments about the area this hotel is in, all I can say is, North Point is the real Hong Kong. Yes, you find locals living close to the hotel, just like anywhere else. If you don't want to be so close to real Hong Kong locals then stay in Central. I never felt uneasy around the hotel at night. There really is no problem with transport, the MTR Fortress Hill stop is 5 minutes walk away. Do buy an octopus card for ease of travel. The view from the top floor restaurant is stunnung, but the restaurant is quite high expensive. The Cantonese restaurant is much more reasonably priced. The rooms were very clean and I have no problem recommending this hotel. I had a wonderful time reliving my childhood days of growing up in Hong Kong, after my business in Hong Kong was concluded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: xiaopu
Reviews.Content: Font desk was very pleasant and professional. The room was a bit small but it was cozy and sufficient enough in size. The decor/amenities of the room and bathroom was very nice. The heated outdoor pool, sauna and steam room was very enjoyable. The outdoor "jacuzzi" was not much of a jacuzzi though because it was joined with the pool and had the same temperature. We had dinner at the Chinese restaurant in the hotel and very much enjoyed our meal and view. I really liked the scent of the lobby. The hotel is close enough to the subway station and that was very convenient. We did not need to use the taxi at all. Overall a great stay and I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Why Pay More To Stay in Central?”
Reviews.Author: Wilso83
Reviews.Content: A great find in Hong Kong. From arrival to departure a perfect stay. We stayed in a Harbour Grand Club Room (The cheapest Club Room available)... believe us it is worth the extra for the club floors. Access to a lounge of 41st (Top Floor) where breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails and food are served between 6pm amd 8pm-- all of which are included in the room rate. Plus the views across the harbour and seeing the nightly lights show is worth it alone.The bedroom was also perfect with a huge KS bed and again open views across the Harbour (The Club Rooms are on Floors 36 to 40). The staff could not have been more friendly, from Bell Hop through to Duty Manager. We are not sure who some of the previous members met who wrote poor reviews of the staff. Perhaps they should visit a 5* Hotel in London to see how poorly staff treat some of their guests!! The location is near North Point, it is less than two minutes to the MTR, the HK tramway and access to the excellent bus routes feeding all of the island. There is also a free shuttle coach that runs all day to Central near Hong Kong Station. All in all one of the best hotels in Hong Kong and we will certainly stay there on our next visit. One final tip -- On arrival get yourself an "Octopus Card" to use on the public transport .. it costs HK $50 as a deposit and HK$ 43 is refunded when you hand it back...you then top it up as required and any remaining monies are given back to you as well as the deposit when you hand back in at the end of your stay... would you get that with an Oyster Card on London Transport!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flossy2310
Reviews.Content: Stayed here outbound to Sydney from the UK for 2 nights made very welcome room very comfortable - stayed in Club Harbour Room Staff very helpful and welcoming Room very clean spacious & comfortable bed Spectacular views from the Harbour Club Lounge & Front Lobby area Will stay here again on next trip Easily commutable on MTR to local attractions/markets

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: trek1006
Reviews.Content: Nice location, amazing views. Booked onto the Club floor to treat ourselves. Would of been nice to have a dedicated lift for those floors and the lounge, but other then that the area was flawless. Checked in on the 41st floor, checked out the room (Single beds) but comfy enough, and a fantastic view over Victoria harbour. Staff very attentive. Very close to an MTR station, and the hotel provide a shuttle bus to main city locations. Would highly recommend a visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a stones throw from MTR”
Reviews.Author: JacMB
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our short trip to HK, was worrried it wa sa little out of the way however the hotel is just a stones throw from Fortress Hill MTR so you can get to everytihg very easily just 4 stops from Central & as trains every couple of minutes its no problem. Hotel itself was very nice, nice room, very clean and looks like it had good facilities but didnt really spend any time at hotel as so much to do in HK. The view over the harbour is very nice and waking up to that made the stay enjoyable. Just outside the hotel there is a strange street with odd units (including a car repair garage) but didnt interrupt our stay and is pretty much HK summed up nice buildings alongside old.. Good place to stay if you dont want to stay in Central and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location great views super service.”
Reviews.Author: Sashaboo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grand for my wife's 40th surprise birthday holiday. On first reflection we thought the hotel was a little bit out of the way. But after doing a bit of walking around we found it's 2 mins walk from the very efficient very inexpensive M.T.R. It takes minutes to reach central Hong congaed the piers. The entrance to the hotel is huge all marble you can understand why it's called grand. On checking in we were offered a upgrade we declined a good move the room we booked was fine. On entering the room I could not wait to open the curtains what a view of the harbour all lit up it was amazing. the room was a little small but adequate all the mod cons of a 5 star hotel really comfy bed with a choice of around 12 different pillows at extra cost may I remind you the pillows provided were fine along with the really comfortable bed. We stayed on a b&b basis the dining hall was very well presented fantastic views of the harbour . Food was very nice everyone catered for from east to west. All in all I rate this hotel very highly and would recommend it to anyone visiting the vibrant city of Hong Kong . One final thing I have to mention just outside the hotel there are lots of small cafe/ restaurants where the locals eat it's so cheap and the food is fantastic most of the menu's are in English give it a try you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's grand, it's on the harbour and I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrytoes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Grand for 6 nights during holiday with my boyfriend. As soon as I walked into the hotel I was impressed! For starters, they upgraded us to a club room on the 35th floor which went down well with me and although we couldn't use the club lounge, I was just happy with the kingsize bed! The bedroom wasn't massive (probably because the bed was so huge), but the layout was well thought out and the bed was so comfortable, I wished I could have taken it home with me! It was nice to have a cosy duck-down duvet and pillows. You also get a pillow menu! The pictures of Hong Kong on the walls were a really nice touch, and we had a really good tv and a good range of channels. I also thought the bathroom was a good layout although dubious at first with the glass front. I shut the electric curtain down on that straight away!! Really liked the wet room shower, had a decent hairdryer in the room and there was a good space in the wardrobe with an ironing board and Iron. I found the room very quiet and the hotel in general, eg: the lifts, the corridoors and communal areas clean and tidy. So comfort in the room wasn't a problem at all! The service was impeccable. I found all the staff friendly, helpful and extremely professional. My bf and I were in the lift with a staff member and she asked us how our holiday was and took a genuine interest in how we were finding out stay. I also found all the staff at the concierge and the doormen very friendly, considerate and willing to help. The restaurants in the Hotel are very expensive but fantastic. I went to the Japanese restaurant with my bf which was pricey but it was excellent food and also had snacks and drinks at the bar at the top of the hotel which again, was expensive, but very well done. It's worth going upstairs for a drink (even if it's just the one) as the view is stunning. The location of the hotel is good. I noticed a few people mentioned it's a bit 'out the way' but the MTR station Fortress Hill is literally minutes away at the end of Oil Street, the trams and buses are plentiful and if you get the free shuttle bus with the hotel to admiralty or HK station, then it's really easy peasy to travel! To give you a bit of a guide my bf and I took a taxi from the hotel to get to the Peak tram and it cost about HK$40 which is roughly just less of £4 and it took about 10 minutes to get there (Travel time will depend on the traffic of course!). The surrounding area of the hotel is a bit 'old fashioned Hong Kong', basically quite 'local' but I actually really liked that. I found it safe and just around the corner of the hotel isa bar called 'Encore' which is cheap and cheerful. If you want cheap eats, then walk to the crossroads on Oil Street and go left and you'll find some local restaurants, very popular with the local chinese and some of the menus are in english which is always helpful!! You'll also find some interesting boutique clothing shops in the surrounding areas which I thought were decent value for money and very unique as I couldn't afford any designer shops in the main shopping malls. Also there are a few food markets around which are fascinating and great for going through to get a better feel of the culture of Hong Kong. (Take note, these are not posh farmer markets, they have livestock and are not for the faint hearted!) The facillities at the hotel are also good - there is a decent fitness space and a small swimming pool on the third floor. The lobby lounge by the japanese restaurant is nice and they have brilliant cakes! So all in all, I really loved the hotel, it was clean, comfortable and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A dream until you notice the cracks”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer101Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stop over of hong kong (2 nights). We had the club class harbour view suite. It had incredible views. But beware there is a constant fog in hong kong so may not be able to see all of it in September. We only saw the peak once on the morning we left :( Also the windows are really reflective so you cant see out without glare. We asked for a double but instead got two singles pushed together. The bath seemed clean until I got in and noticed the sides were not cleaned. Room service was average. and we got charged $115HK dollars for them to bring extra crackers for the cheese when it was their fault. The service is yet to be desired. The staff are extremely stressed out and was shouting at customers not a nice way to greet customers. The pool was clean and so was the gym. However, the jacuzzi's were cold. Take your camera to the pool as your get panaromic views so it is not that necessary to pay for the view in your room. It is noisy down by the pool as the motorway runs right next to it and there is a dredging/reclamation works happening too. I had amassage for 800HK dollars and it was nice, but the massage rooms were not very relaxing, there was beaming light in my face and not very professional. I would stay here again if I wasnt paying for it! The business centre is expensive. so takeyour own laptop with wifi

Reviews.Title: “5* view and room quality, but customer service is severely lacking”
Reviews.Author: High_J
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Harbour View Grand Deluxe Room on the Club floor. The views both from my room, the Club floor lounge and Le 188 where breakfasts are served were amazing. Quality of the room interior and amenities are great. However, the walls are quite thin as noise of room doors closing could be heard. Breakfast selection at the Club floor was also pretty limited and slightly cold. I wasn't that bothered by the location cos its just approximately HKD45-55 by cab to Central. Plus the MTR station really wasn't that far. As mentioned, there are scheduled shuttle services available. There is also a good choice of local eateries around if you do venture around the area. Service-wise, apart from the service staff on the Club floor who were pleasant, the service of the front-desk staff in the lobby were severely lacking. No smile offered during the multiple times I approached the front desk or concierge for help. At check in, the receptionist merely methodologically processed the paperwork and did not smile or apologise even though the room was not ready ( it was already 2pm). As I approached the concierge to leave my luggage, the staff behind the concierge counter merely pointed me to her colleague standing 4 feet away from her!! I then decided to head out since the room was not ready, but asked for my luggage to sent up to my room when its ready. Surprisingly, I was told to come back, get my card key from the front desk and then inform the concierge where my room is. On other occassions where I forgot my room key and had to ask for a replacement, the front desk staff eyes all appeared glued to their computer terminals and couldn't be bothered to raise their heads to help. Overall, if all you are looking for is a hotel which is new with an amazing view, then this hotel is fine. Otherwise, the hotel is still far from qualifying as a 5* hotel given its extremely poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wilma4
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with amazing views. Close to MTR. Didn't have a problem with surrounding area-just seemed typical of Hong Kong. Only negative was the breakfast, which compared to all the other hotels we stayed in was very expensive for what was on offer. Staff in the restaurant not overly enthusiastic / friendly compared with everywhere else in HK. (I know we could have looked for an alternative for breakfast, but to be honest it was too hot to go trekking round just for 2 days)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to MTR”
Reviews.Author: kritch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the height of their summer in August and the hotel was great. very close to the MTR station of Fortress HIll and yes while the area around the hotel looks a little dodgy, it is very safe. we checked in the evening and since the room type we had booked was no longer available they upgraded us to a suite which was quite nice. great view of the harbour. the staff were fantastic, the beds were super comfortable, our bathroom had a great tub that i relaxed in after a long day on my feet. We ordered room service at 10am on a sunday and it was there with in half an hour . very expensive but room service always is. the only negative i would say, was after a long day sightseeing, we wanted a nice cool swim. the pool was 30 degrees. ridiculous. also we went to Stanley markets on a sunday and when we asked the concierge how long it would take by the bus that was right next to Fortress Station, we were told 70 min (if there is not traffic). turned out it was just over half an hour. not really a negative on the hotel, just a point if you are told that amount of time. overall great location, great service. great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing definately 5stars!”
Reviews.Author: Emy82
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is not in central HK but that is one of things we liked about this hotel. HK is VERY hot in August and it was nice to be slightly out of the central area. There are plenty of local restaurants walkable, although some only have the menu in Chinese - food excellent ~£25 lots of food and beer for two! The room we had was fantastic 28th floor and excellent view of hong kong island and kowloon. Its worth asking to be as high as possible. Bed so comfy just what you need after long flight. Service was very good, maybe not as personal as in some hotels but this could be part of the chinese culture. Everything was very efficient and nothing too much trouble. Breakfast buffet was very good had everything you could think of wanting for breakfast although be warned it does finish at 10.30am on the dot. We also ate in the restaurant on the top floor 'Le188' food here was good although maybe a bit overpriced but totally worth it for the view it is just magical. Would def stay here again although prob not in August as was so hot!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Well located to explore Hong kong”
Reviews.Author: B002010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights as the start of our honeymoon. We stayed on one of the Club floors and found the friendliness and service excellent. The room was lovely, very clean and comfortable. Not so big but that is to be expected in most city hotels. Breakfast was complimentary with our room and was very tasty and plentiful. Staff in breakfast room were very attentive and helpful. Also included with our package was a complimentary return journey by coach to and from the airport. This was very convenient and easy to find at the airport. The hotel is a bit off the beaten track and the surroundings are not exactly pretty but inside is a total escape from the chaos that is Hong Kong. The city is bright and vibrant and in your face but immaculately clean and well kept for a city with such a high density of both residents and tourists. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk from the Fortress Hill MTR train station which can connect you to anywhere you want to go in the city. If staying for any length of time it is advisable to buy an Octupus card which can be used for most, if not all, of the public transport in the city and is the most convenient and efficient way to get around. There is also a very nice sandwich place near the hotel on the way to the MTR called Olivers Sandwiches which does an excellent club sandwich...!!!! Really enjoyed Hong Kong and the Harbour Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Mind Coming Again”
Reviews.Author: yishengzhengqi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel that overlooks the Victoria Harbour since I was traveling with a 3 month old baby and wanted an "exciting view" at night when my baby sleeps. We had a free upgrade and the view was magnificient. Service was excellent; staff were courteous and friendly. They could also speak rather good English, Mandarin (Chinese) and Cantonese. The pool was nice with a nice cityscape backdrop. It is also very near to the MTR station and many eateries including local ones and western ones like McDonald's, Starbucks and Subway. The only possible bad thing is the immediate environment outside the hotel. There are car servicing centres outside so that kind of is bad when we have to bring our baby out in the stroller. Pollution is quite a problem, but again, this is Hong Kong. Overall we are happy with the hotel and the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Quietish location but excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjfogarty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value and the staff are fantastic.The facilities are brilliant and the dinner buffet is the best ive had.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! - fell in love with this hotel and Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: CazzaLN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic from start to finish - I could have moved in here. We were travelling here for the last part of our china trip before going on to thailand and i'm so glad this was our last stop. From the moment we arrived in the airport The harbour grand was utterly brilliant. We used the 'luxury coach transfer' as a treat after some hair raising taxi's in other parts of china, and it was the nicest coach you'll ever travel in - i'd definitely recommend that. The location is fantastic, literally up the road from the fortress hill metro station (which can take you pretty much anywhere you need), and very close to the trams and all manner of other forms of transportation, but it is no where near as busy as Causway or admiralty. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we loved this hotel, it's not the best one i've been to, but it's very high on the list, the staff were lovely, and in the business centre they even confirmed our onward flights and did the ringing around for us. Upon arrival the fabulous reception was efficent, and stunning. We were even upgraded to a club floor as they had availability. The rooms was absolutely stunning, with spectacular views over the harbour and kowloon opposite. The room was modern, luxurious, stylish, and absolutely peaceful. the bathroom with the waterfall shower was blissful after a long day sightseeing. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return one day, i felt much safer in this area of Hong Kong than i do in London on a daily basis. Fantastic hotel and a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location. Luxury.”
Reviews.Author: BillParis
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice of hotel. Close to metro and trams, the nearby restaurants and harbour makes this a good choice. No hassles form people selling watches or suits, the neighbourhood is fine, even the nearby mechanics and tin bath adds a touch of realism to the up market experience given by the hotel. Traveling on a budget, we decided against paying the 27€ for breakfast , but don't worry, there are plenty of places nearby to eat! I did find the 5€ for 15mins internet connection a bit much, but maybe that's the price one pays when staying in such hotels. That aside, the stay was well worth the money and the view from the harbour view bar upstairs is stunning. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Diavia713
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon as we passed through Hong Kong. After the craziness of the wedding, and a week in Bali, we honestly hadn't thought much about the hotel we'd be staying in in Hong Kong. We expected to be out on foot most of the day. However, we were completely blown away by how beautiful and immaculate the Harbour Grand Hotel was. We upgraded to a club room with only came out to about $200 more for our 3 nights there, and this included a buffet breakfast (pancakes, dim sum, cereal, sausages, eggs, danishes, etc etc) also a free cocktail and appetizer hour (actually open for 2 hours). The rooms were perfectly fine for 2 of us - the king bed was huge and soooo comfortable, they even offer a menu of different pillows for you to choose from! The bathroom fixtures were modern and fun, and the view was breathtaking (a harbour view from every room!) It ended up raining hard for most of our time there, and though we made it to a few site seeing locations, we were so comfortable and happy at the hotel, we really didn't mind watching the rain on the harbour through all the floor to ceiling windows :) Also, they offer a free shuttle every hour to Central, so the fact that it's a little out of the way, is a non-issue, it was actually nice to explore the streets around there as well. This new hotel is truly top notch. I wish them well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfielanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights in June 2010. Arrived late and booked into our standard room and the following morning requested an upgrade to a Deluxe Harbour view with lounge access. Well worth the money and view of Hong Kong harbour from the lounge must be one of the best in Hong Kong and a great vantage point to watch the evening light show. The swimming pool is great to cool off in after a hot day out. The location of the hotel is fine and only a short walk from Fortress Hill MTA station. Do try walking further up into North Point or get the tram for a few stops and try some of the local restaurants, good value and good service. Don't bother with taxi's trams (if yo are not in a hurry! )and subwayare the way to get about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: viola789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week for business very nice clean hotel with comfy beds, lots of pillows. nice bathroom with big round bathtub. the hotel is not a cosy one, its a big hotel, everything is big, huge. friendly and helpful staff. very nice breakfast, a bit noisy room but nothing to coplain about. I do recommend the barbecue on satudays or fridays in the bar on ground floor. excellent food indeed the pool area is a bit noisy as there is a huge road below. the view from pool is nothing really. Its like the pool is placed in the back yard. The pool is very nice and clean but you dont go to this hotel for relaxing at the pool. i found the location of the hotel great, a bit off from the busy city center but that could easily be reached by the tram or the mtr. one night we woke up from a fire alarm saying that we should remain in our rooms until further information. that information never came so it was a bit frustrating for a while knowing i was in a room on 34th floor. but after calling the reception i was told it was false alarm. felt a bit strange i had to call to find out. beside from that i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: blueberry93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for nine nights, the only complaints we had were that we were in a room near the inside corner of the building so our views were slightly restricted.I thought we were in a deluxe not a grand deluxe room with being in this position but the staff insisted it was right but didn't seem to be very knowledgable about this.The other thing I didn't like was that the toilet wasn't clean, it had blue flush and the stains in the bowl were still quite visible and it stayed that way. Apart from that we had a very nice stay, the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. It was nice to go outside and not be pestered with people trying to sell you watches and make you clothes as we were on other holidays here. MTR is only a couple of blocks away as is the tram and we used the free shuttle on a few occasions. We had the buffet b/fast every morning and also had dinner at the Cantonese restaurant in the hotel both were excellent. Iwould stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience with great Harbour views from 21st floor”
Reviews.Author: Titu1971
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, awesome breakfast and nice view of the harbor from the room. How ever room was small for family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Great Ambience..”
Reviews.Author: goan007
Reviews.Content: Harbour Grand is one of the better hotels that you can stay in while you are in Hongkong - be it business or pleasure. One carries an excellent memories back after staying at this beautiful hotel. The service is excellent - Be it ordering water in your room or ordering a cup of coffee in the restaurant, you are sure to get it with a smile! The staff here is courteous as well. I recollect one incidence while I was staying here. At around 2 am in the night when I got up to go to the washroom. The bathroom entrance door was locked by itself due to some problem. I called the hospitality desk telling them about my problem. Within a matter of minutes, I had 3 people in my room (which also included the duty manager) and fixed the lock. They even apologised for the incovenience caused to me. This defines quality service. The room had a good view and was well maintained! It is just about great to stay there. The bathroom was also well maintained! This hotel is located very close to the Fortress Hill MTR. It is a 2-3 walk from the MTR. The hotel is also sourrounded by many general stores (including quite a few 7-11 stores) in case you want to pick up some essentials! It also has in it's viscinity, Starbucks and Mc Donalds and a few other locan restaurants. The bus bay and taxis are easily available too! The best thing I liked about this hotel is the over all stay and service. I don't recollect anything where I was dissatisfied. What the hotel could improve on is their respect towards Vegetarian Food lovers. It is a little challenging to get good vegetarian food around Hongkong as most of the local population there is Non Vegetarian. Hence it is expected that the same trend follows in majority of the hotels as well. The food quality and spread was indeed good in the restaurants. However, there could be more options for the vegetarian lovers! All one can survive over there is on Bread Toast, Fresh Fruits/ Juices and Danish Pastries. However, over all I will definitely recommend a stay in this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: Our stay was during the East Asian Games. The opening ceremony was around Hong Kong Harbour so we booked a Deluxe Harbour View Room to see the fireworks. In reality the sofa and desk were nowhere near the window and bed was set a bit further back creating a deadspace in front of window, so the view was completely wasted IMO. They built this hotel from scratch so found the long skinny configuration a bit strange. Decor was very China glamour, dark wood, gold leaf, cream, funny fixtures, so luxurious-esque but not really our cup of tea. I did like the sofa though. The sunken round bath tub which was the main draw for us was difficult to get in and out, so again the design was not well thought through. Service was average. Room was sound proofed, but not the bathroom. - we had a old men/young escorts tourists as neighbours over the weekend and one of the girls was a funny screamer. Annoying but we found ourselves laughing. Location was OK. We have stayed at the Shama serviced appartment next door, so knew what to expect. Its not terribly great for dining, a couple of good dim sum places nearby, but close enough to the restaurants and bustle of CWB which made the location acceptable. The quickest way is by tram in my opinion. We booked because it was new and we were tempted by the seaview. The price was quite good too. In the end the overall experience was underwhelmingly average and we should have opted for our other choice the Crowne Plaza in CWB. Oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent views”
Reviews.Author: Sunodyssey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this 5 star hotel this week. We chose it because it looked great on the pictures (hotel has good website) and the price was quite affordable for such a fine hotel. We took a harbour view room that had really fabulous views to both Kowloon and Hongkong sides. The pictures on the hotels site are great and give you accurate view of this brand new hotel. It celebrated it´s 1st year this week so everythin was brand new and shining. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They arranged the room for us even though we got there in the morning and for no extra charge! Pool was heated and had great views. Our daughter wanted to visit the pool every day. Room was very stylish, though not very big. Room had 42inch Panasonic flat hd-tv and there were many hd-channels available. The shower/wc also had a small tv as well. We thought that the location was great because the mtr (subway) station was just a few blocks away (and the MTR is fabuously clean, efficient, easy to use and cheap!!!). We stayed at the 37th floor so there were no traffic noise even though there is a big road just in front of the hotel. Breakfast was really good and had great variety of different kinds of food so even our daughter found lots to eat. I really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: am_vs_96
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two kids ages 12 and 4) stayed at Harbour Grand for five days. We had a wonderful stay. Check in was smooth and a very nice person at the check in counter upgraded us as we were 4 to a room. Very neat clean rooms. Nice food and the harbour view from our 16th floor room is something I won't forget!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: dora1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in may as part of our honeymoon, we were not initially sure if we made the right decision.......boy were we blown away, the staff were fantastic and cared to your every need, food was superb especially 'le 188' restaurant with fantastic views from the island to kowloon, rooms were great with a harbour view, the only little niggle would be that it is located at North point which is slightly out of the way and very far from the airport (although taxis are plentiful) GREAT HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Harbour Grand”
Reviews.Author: clairelou123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong for 4 nights in May as part of a multi centre holiday. We had an upgrade to a Club room on the 37th floor. The room was gorgeous, very modern and had an amazing view. The hotel is in a little bit of a strange location as you have to walk past car garages to get there but it wasn't a problem and felt safe. It was only 5 mins to the MTR station so it was really easy to get around. We didn't eat in the hotel but we had a few drinks in the bar area which was very nice. Make sure you go out to the back of the hotel as you can get some fantastic photos of the skyline. I can definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, good location to enjoy the city while stranded in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: etravelcho
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong during the Easter holidays and chose this new hotel. When we arrived to our room and looked out of the window…!!! Apparently every room has a harbour view and image lying in bed, switching off the light and just looking at the harbour lights! The hotel is a 5 minutes walk from the Victoria Park on Hong Kong Island. They have regular shuttle buses to the Central and to TaiKooShing where there are shopping malls and cinemas. Supermarkets, restaurants (of various cuisines), and shops are very near the hotel and therefore incredibly convenient. The underground (MTR) is only 2 minutes away. It was the day we were supposed to be leaving when our plane was cancelled because of the volcanic ash! Thankfully the concierge checked on-line and told me not to bother going to the airport but to extend our room stay because “there will be hundreds of stranded travellers checking into this hotel by the airlines!” Luckily we followed his advice and used our unexpected 9 extra days in Hong Kong to enjoy the sights while I managed to do some work thanks to the internet. I have to congratulate the team at the hotel in making our stay so comfortable and their efforts in helping us in every way during the crisis. We all agreed that if one has to be stranded, this would be the best place!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dipsomania
Reviews.Content: Nice 7 Comfortable is the best way to describe it. Very nice food. Very nice ambience. Brilliant staff. Cozy rooms. However the rooms were a little small comparatively. if u get a higher floor, very nice view too... All in All a nice choice for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother..............pay the extra and stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: drillfield47
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before booking this hotel and decided that it would be OK, well they were correct! The actual building is great, the recpetion is very pretty, the view from the top floor is very good but it is the staff and the little things that made it a very negative stay. At check in they tried to upsell us a room with a better view despite booking a superior harbour view room. After saying no to the extra "view" & cost we were given our keys and went to our room on the 39th floor. Given that the room faced the harbour & hong kong and the hotel only has 41 floors i am not sure how the view could be better!! This however, was if you could see more that 10 feet anyway............the fog or smog was so bad you couldnt see the other side of the harbour during the day for our entire stay so why try and upsell a view?? So the bathroom is a bit quirky as it is basically a green house............but the privacy bling did not work! After several visits to confirm that the thing was broken a handy man was sent who spent 20 minutes fixing it. Not a good start especially when recpetion refused to move us if they could fix it. Breakfast in the room was 1 hour late and it took 2 calls to even achieve this. Not once did the person on the phone say sorry. No free wi-fi in the room or lobby so asked to use the business centre for 5 minutes to check an email. Was asked how much time i wanted to pay for.............this is free everywhere else but again they wanted to make money. Following a busy day we wanted a drink in the hotel bar only to be told we couldnt go in because i was wearing shorts. I have no problems in restaurants/hotels in Singapore but here it was an issue. The bar was empty and only after causing a fuss did we get a drink in the corridoor to the bar. Not a good way to treat guests. To be honest the location is not an issue as taxi's are very cheap and the MTR is round the corner. The hotel is just ruined by the staff and complete lack of being able to sevice the customer. Either save your money and stay in Kowloon or go for a mainstream 4 or 5 star hotel that will actually be a 4 or 5 start hotel, not one that is pretending to be one. Hong Kong was great and the hotel did not impact the trip but if you have a choice stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “location & service lets the hotel down”
Reviews.Author: globalgal444
Reviews.Content: A newish looking hotel. but serivce delivery appears to be erratic. Hotel food & drink seems to be overpriced and pretensious. Facilities ok but if I want things to work, I'd go to The Four seasons or for more of a luxe experience, The Pennisula. Also, it's located in NOrthpoint which is out of the way for the average leisure/ business tourist. In teh evening, you cannot walk around the local area as it's grotty and very dodgy looking locale with disgusting bathtubs and other assorted rubbish on pavement. I would not stay here again-I only stayed b/c it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place - Excellent Views”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Harbour Grand. Its in a residential / commercial neighbourhood. Its got great views of the Victoria Harbour and the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island skyline. Its also a short walk from the subway. You can take a free shuttle from here to the Hong Kong train station where you can check in your luggage for international flights. You can also get a shuttle to get here from the airport. But that costs 100 HKD. The swimming pool is great too. In short, there was hardly anything at all wrong with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Marko K
Reviews.Content: First time on this perfect location, very near to expo fair (5-10 min whith taxi), a few steps to busy street whith many features. Very clean complete hotel, rooms maybe litlle to smal, but equipped fantastic, big LCD, work glass desk, fax, internet, perfect comfort bed whith perfect pillow (i never sleep better), bathroom very exlusive equipped including and TV ! Services and complete personal very profesional (maybe on moments to strict, but because of policy of hotel -:)). Prices of food and drink in hotel are too high (of chourse understend level of this hotel, but it's too much....). For shure is true: The best new city hotel in world (award that have this hotel). Enjoy...great value....

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well run and better than most”
Reviews.Author: rsm47
Reviews.Content: I endorse much of what has been said before...yes its on the edge of things and yes, there are garages along the short street nearby but it doesn`t matter as the ( very clean and frequent ) underground takes you to the heart of things on the island or Kowloon in a few minutes and there is aso a free shuttle bus. The location next to the harbour gives spectacular views from the 41st floor in particular where 188 restaurant is superb and pricey, but worth the price for one of the most fabulous nightime harbour views in the world. The Chinese retaurant is also very good and whilst the main buffet restaurant is fine for breakfast it is like a soulless canteen in the evening, and the staff seemed to us diinterested at the end of a long day. Good room and public areas and also fair value.

Reviews.Title: “All fine, bar the location”
Reviews.Author: JoggingPlans
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with great harbour views and good food. Rooms are of good quality, right size and recommended. The location however pulls down the rating in my view - it is a bit off the main road, so budget at least 10 minutes for a taxi. The street outside has many car mechanic shops and hardly any fine dine place, which means dinner will have to be at the hotel. The room tariff is attractive and is a draw; however, be ready for a 5 station ride on the MTR to Central.

Reviews.Title: “Objective Review”
Reviews.Author: Ionut C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great . The 41 th floor restaurant ( Le 188 ) offers great food and astonishing view over Victoria Harbour and Kowloon area . The room is very spatious but I had a room on the CLUB FLOOR ( Executive Floor ) I would recommend to reserve this kind of rooms . The lobby is great and luxurious . Also the entrance and there are 3-4 restaurants in the hotel . Breakfast is good . The only little minus of the hotel are the surroundings , little repairs shops around it , be anyway the hotel is closed to MTR station and Causebay area. The surrounding issue is not very important but I think that a good review should mention this . The hotel worth try it ! PS Great view from the rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: schalcs
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel it is 5* and shows it. Ideal location 100 yards from the MTV train. Shuttle service to the main shops. Breakfast buffet has everything you want. Sophisticated with a harpist playing in the lobby during the day. Don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and clean”
Reviews.Author: chikai
Reviews.Content: Was only there for 36 hours, but enjoyed the stay. Have traveled through HK island many times and this was one of the better hotels I've stayed at...however that's starting with a low base. I arrived late at night and was bumped to an executive suite, so wasn't going to complain about that. However I can't say everyone will likely get this type of treatment...and certainly did skew my perception for the better. The suite was huge...lounge, kitchenette, bedroom with sliding glass door splitting the bathroom. Had a view of the harbour, which was quite nice. Nice large LCD TVs in bedroom and lounge. Bath was just glamorous...light marble everywhere. Although it's not in the heart of the city, it's certainly worth the extra $50HKD to take a taxi to Central. Others have said the MTR was nearby, but I taxi'ed most of the time. Only annoying thing was the $130HKD charge for the wifi...if it wasn't a business trip I certainly wouldn't have paid that much for it. Shouldn't most hotel include free wireless by now?

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel in a Secondary Location”
Reviews.Author: RobertZ50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. On the positive side, the hotel was clean and the staff very solicitous, excellent harbor views (the hotel's predominant attribute). I would recommend staying on a club floor and have the benefits of the club lounge, which included free wireless internet, free breakfast buffet, free beverages thoughout the day, free late afternoon high tea buffet, etc. The hotel is a 3 block walk to the metro, a few stops to "Central" and to "Kowloon" -- taxis in Hong Kong are very expensive so it is convenient to be able to take the metro to the main areas -- the metro is very easy to navigate -- you can also take the ferry to Central and take a ferry across the harbor (from Central to Kowloon) which is quite beautiful on a nice day. On the negative side, Oil Street is just that -- a bunch of car repair shops line the street around the hotel -- so the area needs a bit to be desired. This is really a 3 star hotel in a 1 star area -- staying on a club floor brings it up in stature a bit. -- there is a reason why this hotel is priced markedly less than other hotels of its 4 or 5 star ranking. A 5 to 10 block walk away are local shops and markets, frequented by Hong Kong residents, not tourists -- and a recommended diversion from downtown. It is interesting to see the fruits, vegetables, meats and of course fish (many live and "prepared" on the spot). An excellent restaurant is just a few blocks away, called "Very Good Restaurant" with excellent fresh seafood all reasonably priced -- again, a local, not a tourist, restaurant. Having had our fill of the high price of taxis, we took the bus from the hotel to the airport, very convenient and in our case a bus that sat 50 plus people, only 4 of us on it! The harbor view rooms present a beautiful view of the harbor and once in your room the "rough around the edges" neighboring area becomes less important -- this hotel is just a bit far afield, and not enhanced by its neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “best service”
Reviews.Author: eagle_87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Grand Deluxe Room with Club access, and I definitely recommend it. you get personalized check in and check out in the club, as well as breakfast and tea and cocktails in the evening. The service is excellent everywhere in the hotel and the location is not bad, you are very close to everything in HK by MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, shame about the fog”
Reviews.Author: SWKA
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our expectations. The reception area was a bit soulless - and nowhere to sit. But overall we thought this was a great hotel for the money. A little off the beaten track but we loved exploring the sounding areas - local food and goods markets, shops, restuarants etc (not of the tourist variety). MTR 2 minutes walk away so easy to get anywhere. Our room on level 40 (free upgrade) was small but very comfortable. And potentially would have had a fantastic view but for the pea soup fog. We had a fabulous meal at the Kwan Cheuk Heen particularly because the staff were so keen and enthusiastic - they helped educate us and wanted to hear about where we have been in the world - also arranged smaller courses so we could hve more of them. Breakfast buffet was extensive and generally very good. The 188 bar was just OK and recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service really lets this place down”
Reviews.Author: ATGriff
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on some reviews we had read. The hotel itself is quite nice but does not really have a welcoming feel. The room we booked was quite well furnished, but a few things were impractical e.g. you had to get into the sunken round bath to be able to turn on the taps/shower etc. The heated swimming pool was at 22 degrees so it was cold, and you could not stay in for too long. My main criticism is the service we received in their signature restaurant Le 188. We booked this along with another couple for our anniversary dinner. We took a dirink at the bar while we studied the menu, the drinks took an age to come and for some reason he got the order wrong. Once we had ordered my friends oysters came quite quickly, but after this we had a fair wait for our starters, during this time they told us on several occasion some bread was coming. First of all two Foie Gras (pan fried) arrived looked quite good, we then waited for the wives' to arrive which they did several minutes later, still no bread. Asked once again for bread as I like to eat bread with Foie Gras, could not wait any longer as my dish had now gone cold. After we had all finished some bread finally arrived. The same thing occurred with the main course, two arrived and then the second two arrived 7 minutes later (timed it). The food was poor quality (lots of poor quality foam !!) The service diabolical, and the response to our complaints poorly handled. The guy in the restaurant offered us a 20% discount, what he didn't realise was that we knew that as residents we were entitled to a 20% discount. We had stayed the few nights previouis in the Conrad which was excellent, Here I found the rooms noisy even though we were on 27th floor. The air conditioning was terrible, in the room difficult to get a comfortable setting. Other areas of the hotel were freezing cold i.e the restaurant. In fact most things were cold that should have been hot i.e. the food. We lost a camera and asked concierge to find us the phone number of a restaurant where we had been, he did so, and I asked him if he would call it for us. He refused saying that he could not call outside the hotel on his phone as it only had an internal line. I told him that I thought he was lying, and asked to see his superior (I would have had to phone off my UK mobile). When I was waiting he made a restaurant booking for some other travellers and I asked him how he had managed this, he reluctantly then called the the restaurant for us. I Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor room service, wouldnt suggest to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: reganc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from Hong Kong and I was so upset with this hotel that I had to review it. We have been looking forward to this holiday for months and have been to Hong Kong a few times before. I have stayed in the Excelsior (amazing location on Wan Chai, superb service.) and The Inter Continental (one of the nicest hotels I have been to. The views of hong kong are amazing and the beds were super comfy, service was outstanding, however it is on Kawloon side yet this isnt a problem.) When we went to check in to the Harbour Grand we were told that a double room like we requested was not available, after complaining they managed to "find" one on a smoking floor, we said no. So she looked again and eventually found one with a great view on the 30th floor but warning the rooms are very small. We went to unpack and found two closets yet neither had any shelving and there were only five hangers. Room service is a no no, breakfast in your room is not advisable. My boyfriend ordered a full english with no baked beans.... they then forgot the bacon and sausages and my waffles and apple juice all together. We then had it another day after complaining about the hotel to a manager (who was very unhelpful) to the worst waffles I have ever eaten, that were cold and my boyfriends fry up again was not right. One of the things I really look forward to when going to a hotel is the amazing breakfasts you can get, but here it really isnt good. The housekeeping is so bad they didnt pick up anything at all and only half cleaned the room, once we had complained they did step it up a bit. I really would not suggest this hotel, whats the point in staying in a 5 star hotel to have to complain about things that should be done automatically. As someone has already written "it should not be a five star." I also dont think its in a good location not MTR anywhere near and you have to get taxis everywhere. The two good things about this hotel was the Cantonese restaurant on the 5th floor, with amazing food and great service and the door men who were always so helpful and always smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: liverbird25
Reviews.Content: We were travelling back from New Zealand and decided to make a stop-over for five days. This hotel was excellent in all respects... a great location overlooking Victoria Harbour; all rooms with Harbour views but really good views from the 42nd ( top) floor. Rooms were good sized, modern and QUIET. Hotel staff were excellent and the food was great, particularly in the buffet which had a a wide choice from a range of high quality food & styles. There are two other restaurants but we didn't explore them. Good sized outdoor pool, fitness, sream & shower rooms we just what was required after a day in bustling Hong Kong! Location is on edge of the busy 'downtown' area so is quieter and the MTR staion is only about 200 yards down the street so all of HK is easily accessible. We will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CClarke74
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the impressive reception area you know that this is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are immaculate, huge bed, great view of harbour, stacked mini bar, big TV, the bathroom has a wet room shower next to the bathroom - which is great. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast and lunch was enormous with plenty to choose from. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sukijb
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here for a week and we are very happy with our room, amenities, cleanliness and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The location we feel is excellent. The MTR is very easy to navigate, fast and very clean. The local area is fascinating with many great small local eating places within short walking distance. Even though the hotel is close to the expressway, you are guaranteed of a good, quiet nights sleep in a very comfortable bed with beautiful bed linen. We are staying in a Club room but it's not necessary to go to the extra expense, just choose a package inc breakfast and I'm sure you will find the best rate booking direct.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, cold staff but gorgeous room at great price”
Reviews.Author: rafflesking
Reviews.Content: This is a very fairly new property with well appointed rooms. However, a subway ride is imperative to get anywhere you'd want to go (minimum 20 minute commute). And while the hotel is along the water, it doesn't have spectacular views of Kowloon or Central Hong Kong nearly as much as the other properties higher rated on Trip Advisor. Slow elevators too! It was a good value at $130/night, but next time I'd choose to stay closer to the activity. The staff was unremarkable too - not bad, just not overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, room and amenities at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: suec58
Reviews.Content: From our arrival to our departure the staff were consistently friendly and helpful. The room was excellent in size and cleanliness. Even giving a choice of 12 different pillows. Quiet nights sleep with no disturbance from neighbouring rooms or from above. The location was convenient to MTR, buses and trams. If you are looking for a busy night life I think Kowloon looked as though it would offer more than Hong Kong Island. We only had 4 nights here but it was an ideally situated as a base. I used www.booking.com for a fantastic price after looking at many sites. We took the offer which included a full Buffet breakfast which catered for many different cultures and it was great every morning and had a late 10.30am finish.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: MissyPhow
Reviews.Content: I usually stay closer to Central and this is the first time staying at Fortress Hill. I was surprised at how easy it was to commute ( minutes away from MTR ). The service staff was helpful and polite at check-in and brought me to a great room with a fantastic view of Victoria Harbour. The room was extremely clean, modern and comfortable. There was a separate sitting area from the bed which was separated by a curtain which adds such a nice touch. Bathroom was modern with rainshower and a huge round bath. What I was most impressed is in the details - power points just beside the writing desk which allowed me to charge phone, computer, blackberry all at the same time! That's something I appreciate as most hotels have awkwardly located and insufficient power points. I had a very nice stay with Harbour Grand and it was a refreshing experience from other hotels in Hong Kong. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_from_Dorset
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Hong Kong & I really didnt know what to expect. I booked the Harbour Grand after checking other reviews here - they were correct. Harbour Grand Hong Kong makes an excellent base. The hotel provides an oasis of calm amongst the bustle of the city - the Room was excellent (singificantly smaller than European or US standards - but still pleanty big enough). We stayed three nights, so qualified for a free buffet breakfast - this provided a great choice of Cereals / 'continental', Fruit, Grill, Omlettes to gether with Chinese & Indian options. The pool looked good and was warm enough even in the middle of winter (not that we actually had time to use it). The location of the hotel at North Point (near Fortress Hill MTR) was at the edge of everything - but the transport links are so good that we were easily able to get everywhere. I was worried about the express highway next to the hotel (as seen on the google map) - but we could hardly hear it. In fact traffic seemed to only start using it after 6am. Hotel staff went out of their way to help - recommending the best value options, booking transport where required - they even managed to get us an early breakfast package for our early start for the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debsnottsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the harbour grand for four nights at the beginning of our holiday and we were most impressed. Upon entering the hotel you are greeted by the stunning lobby area. We were dealt with quickly at the check in desk and were given a free upgradet to a Grand Deluxe room which were were pleasantly surprised by! The room was lovely with great harbour views The bathroom is really contemporary having the bath and the shower in one area and the sink and toilet in the other area, The shower head is on the ceiling and pours down next to the bath (but not in a cubical) it runs straight onto the floor next to the bath - more like a wet room - really nice. There was a large flat screen TV and desk area and a kitchenette. The bed was really comfortable. We did not have breakfast included in our package and didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that. The pool looked lovely though we didn't use it as it was outdoor and the weather wasn't that warm when we were there! The hotel is a little out of the way but we really didn't find this to be a problem and it was quite nice to get out of the hussel and bussell. It is only a two minute walk away from the tube MTR station - fortress hill and it is only two stops away from causeway bay. It is in a business area with car garages nearby but we didn't feel unsafe. The bath on the street does not get in your way it is on the side of the pavement - there is a tyre shop next to it and I think the owner uses the bath to do something with the tyres??!. The tube is really cheap only costing about 30p to travel one way to Causway bay. However, if you are there more than a couple of days then it might be worth purchasing an Octupus card. These cost about £4.00 to buy. We topped our cards up with about £6 of credit and this lasted us for the whole time we were there. You can use it on the star ferry and the buses too. The taxis from the airport to this hotel are quite expensive about £30. However the there is an airport express train that takes you to central tube station which cost about £7.50 each. You can then catch the tube to the hotel. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to and from Central so you might be able to ring them to see what time they are going to be at Central so they can pick you up. We used this service when we left the hotel. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: berolboy
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. It is not in the immediate centre of Hong Kong, but having visited the centre, that is good. The centre of Hong Kong during the day is busy, full of business men, and at night it is full of tourists and late night shoppers so quite unpleasant to stay in. The Harbour Grand is just two MTR stations away from Nathan Road and just a 10 minute tram ride away. The walk from the Fortress Hill MTR station to the hotel is a very short walk and not at all unpleasant. Some previous visitors must expect the unrealistic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Upscale bolt-hole for a trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: teachertim
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Harbour Grand now - simple wonderful hotel. Staff are great, breakfast is out of this world, room is nice and very clean. Cannot fault this place. It is a little out of the way from main areas like Causeway Bay and Kowloon, but the MTR is literally 5 minutes walk up the street and then you have access to anywhere in Hong Kong. The tram route is also only 5 minutes and that has very cheap and easy access to anywhere on Hong Kong island. Mcdonalds, Subway, Burger King all close at hand for Westeners worried about the food, there is also a clutch of very good authentic Chinese restaurants close by. These make for very interesting meals !!! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, we love it - in some ways it is nice to come back to a hotel a little out of the way and quieter after a day exploring. Don't let other reviews about the street put you off, there are about 2 garages and the walk to the main road with the trams and MTR is no more than 100m, it is fine. OK area - great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but absolutely not top of the bunch”
Reviews.Author: LeMonstre
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HG for two weeks in February. In general, the hotel seems to be brand new and everything ranging from rooms to facilities is shiny, modern and well-polished in a neo-Jugend (Art Nouveau) style. Very nice! The huge lobby is quite impressive and most evenings there is live harp(!) music, a pleasant little feature. Less pleasant is the 24/7 muzak terror prevailing in other public areas of the hotel... The location is OK, it takes a few minutes to walk down to Victoria Park (and another few to Times Square). The area around the hotel is fairly bland and more of an office area rather than a residential area. There aren't many restaurants around apart from some very local and simple joints and junk food chains. A great asset is the close proximity to the Fortress Hill MTR station and the same goes for the tram stop on King's Road. The rooms are very modern, nice and clean with great harbour views! The broadband is as always sorely overpriced (140 HKD/night) and disappointingly slow and shaky. In addition, the room description on e.g. hotels.com is very ambivalent when it comes to the inclusion of the broadband in the quoted rate or not. I can assure you all, it is NOT. I had to fight quite a bit to negotiate the internet fee to more reasonable levels. The gym is super fresh (amazing views!) but is slightly under-equipped, but for basic needs it's OK. The pool and the pool area are most enjoyable, swimming in February overlooking Victoria Harbour is a true highlight! The service is generally unexperienced and pretty unflexible at times, but they are trying very hard, at least. The hotel restaurants are shockingly overpriced, but the breakfast buffet is really great! Make sure it's included in the price, it's one of the best parts of this hotel! All in all a very good hotel and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - good location easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: silvertimetravellers
Reviews.Content: Harbour grand hotel is lovely. We were upgraded to the top floor 40th and had fantastic views over the harbour. We had a lovely bathroom that had a full plate glass window to the lounge area. It makes the room look bigger but not really into having no privacy when using loo or shower. But there is a switch on the right of the panel that brings down a full blind. That came down straight away !! There is a large flat screen TV and a choice of 12 different pillows. Beds were really comfortable. The staff were all friendly. It seemed to be geared around conferences so very few holiday makers so mostly lots of very smartly dressed people in suits.
