The breakfast was good with an extensive buffet with plenty of variety. Good job for me as HK doesn't really have much for vegetarians. Thank goodness for subway veggie delights. It is very good location with lots of transport options, The MTR system several buses and trams are just at the bottom of the street. There is a bus direct from the airport (A11) and it is only 40hkd or 20 hkd if you are 65+. All get you to the hotels very easily and have advantages, The street outside is interesting and different well it is called Oil St. Small car workshops and yes a tin bath on the pavement chained to a lampost but it is lively and only a very short street up to Fortress Hill Shops, Bus Stops and MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: LosHombresFlacos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money and would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a five star hotel in Hong Kong for under AUS$200 inc breakfast. I booked this hotel through Tripadvisor and was upgraded to the club floor. The view was fantastic and the location was HK$18 in a cab from Causeway Bay and about $30 in a cab from Central. The Fortress Hill metro station was about 100m away for anyone relying on the train system. The concierge staff all spoke excellent english and were very helpful with any request I made about Hong Kong. Breakfast was fine with plenty of choice. The gym and pool were great - with water heated to 26 degrees. This isn't the Hyatt or the Marriott but if you want a new, clean and modern hotel this won't dissappoint.

Reviews.Title: “lush”
Reviews.Author: theresa25
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to fault about this hotel.Excellent location was so easy to get around,even managed to get a bus one night very late on the way back from lan kwai fong,which droped us at causway bay which is a walk(20mins)from hotel.rooms where cleaned everyday and had all needed.The beds where lovely and the bedding felt soft.The fittness suite and pool were lovely as were the staff.one word of warning,do not book any helicoptor flights if it looks like its going to be low cloud(it was for all the time we were in hk)we booked one to take us to Maccu and the hassle is really not worth the effort, grayline tours were a nightmare to deal with and even though they cancelled and told us they would provied a ferry ticket(which did not happen)tryed to keep back $100,when i asked why i was not given any explination,avoid this hassele.If you go to stanley go to main street and a resturant called Dim Sim,lush!Really enjoyed the time we spent in H.K and at the harbour grand , would recomened it to every one.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury type hotel”
Reviews.Author: Givemelegroom
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It is a modern building with accompanying design and functionality. The room was tastefully decorated, well maintained and perfectly cleaned. Land being at a premium in HK, every inch is squeezed out. Therefore the room was not greatly spacious though I only felt this by the rather smallish window. All the staff were friendly and helpful. It is a very busy place with crowds of people coming and going yet the doorman always had a smile and staff said hello as they passed. Again not the most spacious - but the bathroom was the most practical luxurious one that I have encountered. I despair at tastefully designed yet impractical design. At the Harbour Grand the bathrooom kept the water here it ought to be, the controls were simple and I had a great bath/shower experience. The glass dividing wall may make some uneasy, but the provision of an electrical modesty screen should comfort the more bashful. Room service was efficient and operates 24/7. The top floor bar is spectacular though spoilt by a massive lighting display that undermines the late night views. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and set my day off with a bang. The range of produce was impressive and tasty. There is a complimentary shuttle bus to the WTC and HK station. This operates to the second and synchronising my watch with the one in the bus proved beneficial. I recommend the rail link from the airport as the best way to reach HK central. Once in HK the underground system is brilliant and Fortress Hill station a very short stroll ( 5 minutes max.) from the hotel. A Starbucks enroute makes it even better. On the negative side there were the usual issues. (1) The pool was out of action. In any case it is actually at ground level and overlooked rather than on a roof. It struck me as unappealing and to be avoided as a deciding factor when selecting a hotel. (2) The banks of elevators are not connected so you have to select each bank seperatly. When the car arrives the indicators are not obvious. (3)WiFi is not free and the 24hr period is a calendar day not 24hr. So logging on at 9pm gives 3 hrs of wifi for £13! To end on a high note. The staff are superb and special mention to Rick, one of the bell boys who saved the day by locating my stored luggage and setting me on my way back to blighty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: Raja36
Reviews.Content: We were on a holiday to Macau, Disney, Hongkong and Bangkok. In Hongkong, we stayed at The Harbour Grand Hotel from 23-25 Dec 09. The Hotel is at a very convenient location complemented with the excellent MTR service at a close shot. The accommodation was too cosy and the services rendered need a special mention. The Staff was too welcoming and you feel totally at home. Though there was a general language problem, yet, the Staff was so good and helpful that, there was no barrier felt. A lovely and comfortable place to stay in Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service - wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: tanjap01
Reviews.Content: Room and hotel looks 5* but the service is exceptionally bad. I was "upgraded" to a "better" floor with a view looking out to the other side of HK, not the harbour. The back-reflection of the glass was so bad that I could barely see the view anyway so I didn't even bother arguing with them. I rang room service 3 or 4 times and no one answered, there was an eternal queue waiting for help from the concierge, despite the fact there were plenty of staff seemingly doing nothing walking around the lobby. The business centre wasn't open for me to use during the times that I wanted, the pool was closed for renovations, I was told that the bar and restaurant on the upper floor was 'booked out' so I wasn't allowed to go in there. I was also interrupted in my bath at 8pm by housekeeping!!!! What hotel does housekeeping at 8pm? All in all, the service here is a bad joke and in all honesty I've had better service at youth hostels. At least they give you a map of the city! Spend your money elsewhere if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like five star, run like three star”
Reviews.Author: Lee2828Usa
Reviews.Content: Had my family reunion there during Christmas holidays. We've booked nine rooms and have seven nights stay average. The hotel was overbooked, no one seems to know what they are doing, and no one cares. I've booked a club level room and they decided to put me in a bugger room on another level and not giving any club room benefit. I've met with the Director of Rooms and stated my case. We agreed to charged me $70 US extra per day to obtained club level benefit. Well, the "benefits" stated on their letter turns never delieved. No morning nwespaper, no daily fresh fruits, no daily coffee set up...... Hotel lounge service was average at best. Bartender don't know how to make a martini, took forever to get drinks....and they are charging $15 US for a martini. I am used to this kind of pricing with much better service. If you don't mind to spend the money, you'll get much more for the same price at any fve star hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel / poor location”
Reviews.Author: MarsbarNorthants
Reviews.Content: First time guest at this newish HK Island hotel. As you would expect the rooms are modern and bright and well-equpped. The see-through bathroom is novel but can be screened off at the touch of a button. Great views over the harbour and Kowloon peninsula - spectacular at night. The surrounding area is a let-down with very few shops or restauarants within short walking distance so taxis or MTR are the order of the day. The lobby is worth the visit in itself and the staff were cheery and helpful. The cafe for breakfast is spacious and bright and the food selection top-notch. Whether I will return will depend on a price comparison basis with my usual hotel in Causeway Bay - the Excelsior - which is in a fantastic area and affords the same great views from the speciifed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Far from 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: RAT_27
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a few nights at the Harbour Grand after a few days in true 5 star service in Macau. When we booked, we flagged an arrival time of about 2pm - in fact, we arrived at 3pm so expected we would be able to check in straight away. Upon arrival, the foyer was full of people either checking in or waiting towards the sides for their rooms to be prepared. Luggage and bags were piling up near the front door and the bell boys were struggling to keep track of who each item belonged to. Upon entering, we walked towards the lobby desk with our baggage (no one had offered to take our bags) By the time we got to the front desk, the hotel had only booked us in for 1 night, despite us having email confirmation from them that we had booked (and paid for) 2 nights. After having to convince the staff we had a 2 night booking of a harbour view room, they mentioned that there was no room made up for us for two nights, and to "go somewhere else" for about an hour while they made up a new room for us (an "upgraded room" given that we had to wait). Having no where else to go, we waited in the lounge for an hour, where only the chef acknowledged us and said 'hello'. At 4pm we checked if our new upgraded room had been made up, which it was. We were handed the key and the lifts were pointed out to us. Again, no bellboy or staff member offered to help us with our baggage and we took these up ourselves. We then found that our "upgraded room" that had just been made up for us while we were waiting (keeping in mind, the original room we had booked was a harbour view room), only to find a very small, dark island facing room where the only spare space was taken up by a baby's cot (and we dont have kids or a baby!). Calling for the manager, we again had to wait while a further room was prepared for us (again, taking our baggage with us ourselves). While we ultimately got our harbour view suite (with some great views), the lack of service we experienced for these first few hours from checking in to getting a room for the duration of our stay tarnished our stay at the Harbour Grand. No doubt the hotel is beautifully finished, but a 5 star hotel also needs 5 star service. Unfortunately, the service we got was far from 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: TraceyLancashire_uk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, everything is top notch. The lobby is beautiful and rooms were very comfortable. Our airline had lost my suitcase and the concierge at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful. They continuously chased it up with the airport and we finally had it delivered to our room 24hrs late. I read a few reviews before we went and was a bit worried about the area, but had nothing to worry about. We walked around the area with our young daughter even during the evening and felt very safe. Iwould definately recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: westphillyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 days at end of December. Overall very pleased with room, service and amenities. The staff try very hard to please. We got a great price and I think for the money it can't be beat. The metro is 5-10 minutes away so getting anywhere was easy. Used the airport transit, which was also easy. I have previously stayed at the Peninsula and Island Shangri-La in HK. Those hotels are exceptional and truly a notch above with regards to service and amenities. 5 star hotels, which should have a 6th star. However, they are both much more expensive. If you want a good hotel at a reasonable pricem this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: gumbolo
Reviews.Content: I went there with my girl-friend and mother for the NYE in HK. We had booked a suite with an additional bed, which brought the cost for the three of us down signficantly. While we were concerned about a too remote location, I have to say that it is actually a top-spot: there is no hotel in this category at this price in Central HK, only much more expensive hotels. If you want something similar you have to go either more outside or over to Kowloon. We spent most of the time in Central, then did a trip to Aberdeen and also Stanley beach. With the taxi trips we were usually very fast and almost never got stuck in any traffic jam. I speak from experience, when I used a Kowloon hotel and tried to take a taxi to Central, it took me almost an hour through the congested tunnel. The suite itself was fabulous, perfect view, perfect facility, absolutely clean and quiet. We free fresh fruits every day, free water, free newspaper. The only experience not so perfect was the afternoon sandwich we had in their cafe. Nothing too bad, but just not that tasty/competitive considering the high quality food you can get in HK everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Faith1123
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay on the Kowloon side but was very glad we ended up on the Hong Kong side and in this hotel. The hotel is within a working - car repair - area but I am sure in a few years the area will be gentrified (though I really hope it won't become too touristy). It's very safe and conveniently located down a block from the MTR. We asked for a room with a pantry; housekeeping provides the kitchen stuff if requested. We only needed the microwave to warm up water for baby cereal so we didn't request the other stuff. You also have to call to have them plug in the microwave. We had great views of both sides of the harbor from our rooms on the 20th and 17th floors (we went to Macau and came back). The windows are in the corner as opposed to right next to the bed, but I was fine with it since our toddler was with us and I didn't want the lights to distract his sleep. I just sat on the ledge and looked out after putting baby to sleep. I could see the harbor from bed but the view was definitely better closer to the window. The pier right outside of the hotel also provides great view (and nice city skyline photo op) as well and is a nice little area for a toddler to run around. The bathroom does have the glass wall, but there's a screen you can roll down to have your privacy. The hotel should label the switch inside the bathroom because I first thought it was for the hair dryer until I pushed on it and saw the screen come down. Service overall is great though the concierge could have been more informative about good places to grab a bite outside of the hotel. Perhaps they don't know since they may not have tried the food around the area or perhaps they can't say anything since they want you to eat in the hotel, I don't know. They showed my husband a street that they said has many restaurants (this was near midnight after we checked in), but the food we tried there were awful. Luckily we bought a WOM guide to help us find a few nearby restaurants. We didn't try the food in the hotel since we had so much other places to try as we went about the city. I also like the complimentary shuttle to the Hong Kong station for the Airport Express. The shuttle also takes you to other places but I can't remember what they are - Wan Chai, Causeway Bay's World Trade Center... And there's another shuttle that takes you to Cityplaza, Tai Koo Shing and a few other places. These are all places that are easily accessible from the MTR but the shuttle is free.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed with first room.......”
Reviews.Author: hangar2jo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Harbour Grand having just stayed at Sofitel Macau and Intercontental Grand Stanford (Kowloon), and this was to be the icing on the cake of our trip. On arrival about 3.00pm my husband was initally ignored at check in but was finally dealt to promptly. We had booked a delux harbour room and when we got into it were really dissapointed. It was a corner room with one window looking into the accomodation blocks of North Point and the other looking at the harbour. We had expected a full harbour view as we had had the week before in Kowloon. We returned to reception and ended up paying extra for a 'premium harbour view room' which was totally up to what we expected, but did have to wait 2 hours for it to become available and cleaned. The hotel has a a 'funky' - 'clenical' feel and there seems to be numerous staff wandering around the lobby, however there were always plenty of doorman racing to open the door for you on entry and exiting. The hotel is only two streets away (2 mins) from McDonalds, Subway, Ollivers Sandwiches and Laundry in second street (big bag of washing only $HK30 dollars and ready the next day). MTR at end of road also and we caught the tram several times down to places we needed. Interesting selection of car maintenance shops and tyre repairs out on the footpath, so be careful when walking past the equipment and grime underfoot, as I did slip one day on some oil / grime ? on the pavement and ended up in the gutter.....it is called 'oil street' afterall, so I should have known. Just wish I knew what they were saying as I picked myself up and hobbled away before examing the damage.....bet I was talk of the street that day. We did go up to the 41st floor lounge bar and had a drink one night - awesome view however they have a big advertising neon billboard above the windows and is rather distracting as it flashs up the latest specials etc......took away alot of the ambience of the place I thought, so sit on the right hand side if possible not the left. No complaints about the breakfast included in the room. There is something there for everyone and would be the best buffet I have seen in a hotel. The breakfast room is also nice and bright and great views over pool or harbour. Overall the hotel was up to standard but lacked a 'warm - welcoming' feel.

Reviews.Title: “Must be the best views in Hong Kong - Harbour Grand = fantastic”
Reviews.Author: trescomania
Reviews.Content: Fantastic new hotel - Harbour Grand on Hong Kong Island. Beautiful - espaecially at Christmas! Couldn't fault the rooms and service (though the glass walls in the bathroom must be a bit disconcerting for those on a romantic spree.) All the rooms have fantastic 'postcard views' over the harbour. The service was impeccable and cheerful. Bars/meals a bit pricey but to be expected - there is a good SUBWAY at the corner of oil street if you want a huge sandwich, and plenty of other bars/restaurants.Watch out for the 10% surcharge which seems normal for HK hotels and restaurants. Regarding the areass, yes, there is an old bath on the street, but it hasn't just been 'dumped' it is part of a tyre repair shop - the Harbour Grand is indeed in a 'working area' of Hong Kong - but if a bath in the street is the worst thing you encounter on your travels, then you are not travelling to any interesting places! Vive la difference and enjoy these different experiences!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - pity about the room design”
Reviews.Author: wareinbelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Grand for 3 nights in September. We chose the hotel because of the price and specifically for the harbour views. I had stayed in a hotel previously in HK with a great view and I wanted my wife to enjoy the same experience so we paid a little extra and booked a "Grand Deluxe Harbour View room". I must say I was a little disapointed at the room and the layout. The view was there but you had to crane your neck a little because of the poor layout with a desk and table in the way and the windows were actually in the corner of the room. The design could have been much better to optimize the view. Anyway it was still a nice place and we were upgraded to the 41st floor so it was enjoyable. The restuarant/bar at the top had spectatular views at night, well worth a visit,

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: LilianJ3
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for a hotel, overlooking both sides of Hongkong, a great view specially at night, accessible to all types of transportation,great hotel staff, couldn't ask for more

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvmuk
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon with my wife from 10th Dec to 17th Dec in this hotel. Notes on location: - The hotel is located in a not so touristy suburb - there is an AIA tower nearby, Govt. supplies department, a big public parking lot managed by wilson, few small mechanic shops, some restaurants and 7 eleven. It is very close to Fortress Hill MTR station Exit A and is a 3-5 mins walk to reach the MTR from the hotel. As you walk along the Oil street, the hotel appears to be strategically located at the waterfront as the street terminates there. The restaurants nearby include Subway,MacD,Burger King,Starbucks and Maxim's cakes. These proved helpful for vegetarians like us. There is also a superstore Wellcome that stocked many fruits/snacks/breads for vegetarians. There are 2 Indian restaurants nearby within walking distance - Chillie Graden and Palki Notes on hotel:- The hotel is grand in looks both inside and outside and has a 5 star feel to it. It has a grand lobby and high speed lifts. The staff of hotel is cheerful,very helpful. When we arrived at the hotel, we were very tired and on enquiring about the reservation was duly attended. We had to submit 3000 HKD in advance as security for the use of hotel facilities. I was not with enough cash and the hotel reception graciously accepted 1000 HKD as token deposit. Notes on hotel room:- We had reserved Grand deluxe room on 29th floor. The room was quite spacious for us with avg. height of 5 feet and 2 inches. The room is quite luxurious and offers many facilities like LCD TV,DVD player, LAN connection, minibar, toilet facilities, wardrobe, electric kettle. The bathroom is very clean and the toiletries good to use. The bathroom has glass walls and hence there is no privacy. The room has two windows - one at 90 degree to the other. One window offers the view of the city and the other a breathtaking view of the harbour and Kowloon side. The room has a nice and comfortable bed and has many drawers to store things. Some considerations/negatives: 1) The hotel staff though very cooperative and helpful, will never go too much out of the way or treat you like royalty even if you are on honeymoon. Frankly, I had expected that we will be daily surprised with compilmentary gifts. We had received a complimentary bottle of champagne on first night in the hotel. 2) The housekeeping staff is not well versed with English. There used to be many cases of miscommunication thus resulting in the housekeeping bring less no. of water bottles or creamers. However they were prompt in bringing it.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to live in”
Reviews.Author: cosmoherbs
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel located close to the ferry pier and otehr important locations in Hong Kong. Pretty close to good eating places and MTR station

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking hotel, great view and 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic, so much luxury, the room and bathroom were fantastic, we had a gorgeus view of the victoria harbour, the concierge and front desk provided 5 star service, they were so helpful, breakfast was top of the line, service in general was fantastic, will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “We hosted our Wedding there, Horrible hotel and service, not deserve to be 5 star,”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsChan
Reviews.Content: Room - Requested extra bed has not been set up when we are checked in. The housekeepers came to set up after 3 hours we have checked in. - Pantry didn’t set up with all equipped cooking ware. The stove and microwave are not connected with power. We have requested all of the above to Joyce in the meetings. We ended up need to call the housekeeping for a few times to complete all the set up. - Chinese teaset, cushions and steamer are not set up in the room. Need to call housekeeping to remind them over and over again. And the cushions never show up with no reply or explanations from the operators. - Bath salt is “holder” is found empty for the entire stay. - Coffee and teabags are not available for the entire stay. - Toothbrush sets are not replenished after used. - Dirty dishes are left in the sink when we requested them to clean up the room - Basically the cleaners and the housekeepers are failed to check and replenish the amenities. - On the first day, I left a note to the cleaners on the table regarding all the things she/he has missed out; however, there is no improvement on the second day. - On the second day after clean up, the bathtub is found with human dirt. This is not hygienic at all. - The carpet is terribly rugged after the Saturday morning.. - On the wedding evening after we were back from the banquet, we have called the in-room dining to prepare our mid-night supper, which is included in our package. The staff has declined our request and said that our room only includes a bottle of champagne and chocolates. I asked them to re-confirmed again, but there is no action taken but to decline us firmly. After the server came with the champagne, fruits and chocolates, I showed him our packages with all the bills and terms, he said he will go check it and come back to me. After 30 minutes of no reply, we called the in-room dining again. Finally, they offer us some choices. As a result, we waited for more than an hour from ordering the food to the food arriving in our room. - This kind of service quality and lack of communication does not deserve to claim to be a 5-star hotel. The above can be met by any 5-star hotel without the guests repeatedly reminding the hotel staffs and the staff continuously denies taking an extra step to assist the guests. - We have spotted other hotel guests smoking in the hallway with leftover cigarettes on the garbage cans. According the law in Hong Kong, smoking in the hotel hallway, I believe, is prohibited. My friend and I had made several requests to the concierge several times on Friday with pictures of the garbage cans taken and proved to the hotel staff. However, the leftover cigarettes stay and the hallway continues to fill with the smell of cigarettes

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RupsB
Reviews.Content: I work in the travel industry and have stayed at many hotels. This i have to stay was one of the best. Great service, absolutely spotless, amazing location for the views of HK maybe not 1 of the best locations overall, but for the standard of hotel definately worth the extra 10mins travel to whereever it is you want to get to. It is conveniently located within 2mins walk to the nearest MTR station and has all the facilities you would expect from a 5* hotel. The restaurants were the best we ate in Hong Kong, the pool is great, and the staff are just so accomodating to anything you request. Nothing is too much, one day we wanted to find out what time the races were on and just casually asked one of the staff members, she didnt know but said that her dad would, laughing we said not to worry as we would find out elsewhere but she said it was no bother and called home straight away to give us the information !! Just little touches like this made our stay ... The rooms are lovely , the bathroom and shower is amazing - also after reading a few of the other reviews ive noticed people pointing out the glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom. PLEASE DO NOT LET THIS PUT YOU OFF STAYING IN THIS AMAZING HOTEL !! Yes it is glass and totally see through but there is a button inside the bathroom which totally covers up the glass wall and you can not see a thing !! I stayed at this hotel with a friend and it was fine we couldnt see anything. Other than that ... would i go back? yes definately no doubt about it !!

Reviews.Title: “Start of Honeymoon. Wow.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaGullick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place, breakfast out of this world. Very kind and attentive staff. 5 star excellance. Fantastic start to our Honeymoon. Spent 3 days here and eat in the top floor restaurant on once. Pricey but worth the experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: A&MForrest
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a stop over. We stayed for 3 nights and it was clean, nicely designed and with a good atmosphere in the bar areas. The location worked for us; it was 2 mins away from the underground station and only a few stops away from the main areas of interest. The hotel wasn't in one of the city's top spots as mentioned by other reviewers, but this didn't bother us and meant that the rates were half that of equivalent hotels in better neighbourhoods. It's worth stressing that the area isn't unsafe, but it's not in amongst other hotels and is a 'working neighbourhood' with car mechanic garages etc on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Rough diamond”
Reviews.Author: yapmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Reserved for two plus baby and asked for a crib. On arrival 10 pm, the taxi driver did not know where to go and had to call the hotel for directions. The wait for the front desk was not expected as there were three persons there and only one other person in front of us. I repeated my request for a crib on check in, but had to wait and wait and wait for the crib. Talked to the manager on call when I wasn't getting anywhere with the crib. Lily was apologetic and it took till midnight before she and the staff arrived with one. She said the crib on the 17th floor was taken and they had to find another one. The door had two dead bolts so I was not worried about strangers coming in uninvited. The hotel is located in a local commercial district. In the morning, this place was crowded with Hong Kong locals, but the night was quiet and dark. Not recommended to walk at night but we took taxis to and fro. This is a good place for tour groups and not really for individuals. The bathroom is avant-garde, with unusual faucets and see thru walls to the bathroom. Lack of closet space and hooks in bathroom. Some noise from the highway outside. Check out the breakfast buffet, but make sure you have it as a package. Facilities great and very new, but service needs some attention. Nearby cafes and 7-11 useful.

Reviews.Title: “treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: lovesgreece
Reviews.Content: went in july for my silver wedding anniversary trip, the hotel was recommended to me by my travel agency destinology, as i wanted sheer luxury. from the moment you walk through the doulbe doors, attended to by door men in pristine white uniforms you know you are somewhere special, the foyer alone is spectacular with an amazing cristal chandelaire hanging up. our room overlooked the habour, with a spectacular view at night. the hotel only opened in june 2009, and is the epitamy of first class service. we had a meal in the shezchan restaurant, and the staff were very attentful, and our waiter devised a menu for us so we could sample some of the best dishes on the menu. in fact to show how they give first class service, on the morning of our anniversary the maid must have seen our cards on the table, and informes the concierge who sent a bottle of champagne up to our room with the compliments of the hotel. the sourounding area of the hotel is a bit commercial with a garage just next door, the hotel is situated on north point in hong kong, but once you are inside, you forget where you are. a truly wonderful and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: carrache
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel. The lobby is quite grand, and the staff very friendly and helpful. The view was great, and having the MRT just a couple of blocks away made getting anywhere pretty easy. I felt comfortable in the neighborhood (didn't think it was that bad) and would return again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Beaut new 5 Star in sleazy area -”
Reviews.Author: UselessJRPass
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only 1 night. The hotel is brand new with a beautiful design and everything you'd expect. The price was good as they're not yet established. The room was excellent with great views over the harbour towards Kowloon. At 4am a male stranger crept into my room claiming the door was unlocked (a lie) and quickly vanished when I challenged him. I was awake with jetlag luckily, but if I was asleep I would probably have lost all valuables. The downside is the location.. it's a subway ride to all the attractions as it's located at Forresters Hill amidst light commercial businesses servicing cars and selling tyres etc. The MTR station is a 3 minute walk. Avoid the expensive restaraunt.. there's plenty of good food nearby at a quarter the price. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !”
Reviews.Author: gak2705
Reviews.Content: What can I say - what a fabulous hotel. the hotel is new and soooooo luxurious. The rooms are all harbour facing with spectacular views by day and night. From the welcome at the door by the staff into the fabulous entrance hall to the chambermaids - all of the staff could not have been more helpful. I only stayed 2 nights and so didnt get round to sampling the food but the hotel was fab!!!! The only downside would be it is not a great location bu with the MTR a the top of the road you are never far from where you need to be. The room was spacious, tidy and clean. Even the bathroom ameneties were plentiful. I highly reccomend this hotel.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great views. Excelent stay.”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissHolidayFan
Reviews.Content: I booked a transfer with the hotel, by shared minibus, this was good value and took the strain out of thinking on arrival. On arrival into the hotel the reception is very grand and really makes an impression. Check in is quick and efficiant. I booked and Grand delux harbour view room and was a little dissapointed that it only had 1 window raher than the 2 showed on that room on their website. However the view was good, even if a little obstructed by the room next to us. ( we were tucked in the corner of the hotel) The room itself was goos size but, a squeeze with the extra bed for a child. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower and bath were great. The glass window was novilty, but in the end we just left the blind down as it was a pain to keep waiting for the screen to go up and down. The sliding door is noisy if your not carefull closing it. There is very litlle space to hang towels and nowhere to dry your swim stuff. The bed and pillows were really comfortable. The location is OK, a short trip on the MTR or tram to the center, too far to walk. Well in the heat of august anyway! The hotel is located right next to some car repair shops and a old disused building, maybe not what you would expect of a hotel aiming for a 5 star status. But the area has a safe feel to walk around. A previous reviewer mentions a bath in the path that forces you to walk in the road. Sure enough its there, but I did not have to walk in the road to pass it and it would not put me off staying there. There are lots of coffee shops, fast food restaurants and a great itailian near by. Eating in the hotel is very expensive, and somthing I did not try as there are many other, better locations to eat for less, But we did visit the L188 for a glass of wine and enjoy the night view. Worth the experiance to take some advantage of the full view. Regular high end bar prices. Great selection available. A visit to the pool is worth is, great swim overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience! We loved the Harbour Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Melburnians
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Harbour Grand and loved it! As other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel is in the 'soft opening' phase, so we got a real bargain... We stayed in a Premier Club Harbour View Room for around HKD$2000 per night with every fourth night free and let me say that this is outstanding value. We were met at HK station by the free shuttle bus which whisked us to the hotel where we were met by very friendly staff and one of the most amazing lobbys and chandeliers that I have ever seen... very impressive. For the first night we stayed in a Grand Deluxe Harbour View Room which was lovely and perfect for a couple staying one or two nights or a busines traveller, but for us for a longer stay we felt we needed some more room (and more importantly a sofa) so we decided to upgrade to the Premier room and feel that it was well worth it. It has a HUGE round bath, a lovely bathroom, king size bed, lovely sofa with a foot stool and a large flat screen TV, everything you could really need and plenty of space for a longer stay (by HK standards!) The rooms are brand new and are tastefully furnished and feature Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries which are a nice touch. What really puts this hotel ahead of the rest are the warm, friendly staff who really go out of their way to please you and make your stay enjoyable. We really felt like guests and were treated like Kings and Queens! (Thanks to Kayan, Lafisa, Apple and Sunny just to name a few!) We have stayed at the Sheraton Kowloon and the Kowloon Shangri-La and found the staff quite cold, but at the Harbour Grand it is just the opposite. Executive Club access is certainly worth including in your package, we were treated to an amazing buffet breakfast (one of the best I have had), high tea in the afternoon, cocktails and canapes in the evening (full cocktail and spirit list available on a complementary basis for two hours) and a smattering of other benefits including free internet access on one of three computers in the Club. We took advantage of the gym which is fully fitted with the latest and greatest treadmills, elliptical trainers and weight machines and overlooks the fabulous heated pool. It was lovely to while away the afternoon there having a dip overlooking the harbour and watching the boats go by... We found the location very convenient as the MTR is only 5 minutes walk away and you are only two stops to Causeway Bay and five to Central. There is also a free hotel shuttle to Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Station (Central) and Tai Koo. The views from the hotel are just the best in Hong Kong, and I agree with a previous reviewer, they are just a good as the peak! You can see down the Hong Kong Island with a clear view of the night lights but also see the Kowloon peninsula, the best of both worlds. It has been a treat to sit in the Club every evening with a cocktail and admire the view from the 41st floor! Overall, I would recommend to stay at this hotel whilst it is so reasonably priced as it may not be for too much longer as more people discover its charms... it is still in soft opening stages, but even if there are minor hiccups the staff more than make up for it, and the rate certainly does! We had a fabulous time and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxurylover3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impressive from start to finish. The reception creates an amazing first impression and the staff cannot do enough to help. We stayed in the cheapest standard room which was still extremely well kitted out with mini-bar, tea and coffee, flat screen etc. The pool is lovely and the food in both restaurants of an excellent standard. The views of Hong Kong are totally breathtaking. However it is the staff here that really make this hotel stand out. They seem genuinely excited and pleased to be working in this hotel, they all seem proud to be working there and cannot do enough to help you. The guy in the gym was so friendly and there was another member of staff by the pool to help you choose your sunbed etc. I work in the hotel industry and I have never, ever experienced better service than at this hotel. I would love to stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I would choose to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lon14
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some colleagues in July 2009 shortly after the hotel opened. I have stayed in many hotels and my standards are quite high. I was initially concerned the hotel may be too far out from the main attractions, but it is so easy to travel on the air-conditioned MTR and I felt completely safe on my own! I walked into the lobby and was impressed from the start. The staff are friendly and willing to assist at every opportunity, the lobby is everything you expect from a 5 star hotel and the rooms were great! I stayed in a Suite and the views were breath taking - panoramic views of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. We ate in Lounge 188 and the food was world class as were the cocktails and choice of wines! The cocktails were a little too good! I used to think I would prefer to stay in Kowloon, but I would choose to stay on Hong Kong Island every time and would choose Harbour Grand Hong Kong if I returned in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: PKa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 14 July to 20 July and we just loved this hotel ! We had booked airport transportation with the hotel, so hotel's driver was waiting for us as we came through with our luggage. He escorted us to a nice S-class Mercedes and we were on our way to the hotel. The location of the hotel is nice, close to Fortress Hill MTR station, maybe 100-200 meters from the hotels front door and also tram stops are close. Plenty of small coffee shops (Starbuck etc) near by, and also many local restaurants (and McDonalds and Burger King), especially on Electric Road. Entering the lobby is amazing experience for the first (and the second and the third etc...) time ! It is huge and looks just so amazing. White marble floors, big (and I mean really, really big) crystal chandeliers on the ceiling and so on. Check-in for guests staying in their club rooms is on 41 floor but our check-in was on the lobby. Everything went smoohtly and took only few minutes (even with the temp check :) ). They escorted us to our room on 23 floor and our luggage arrived only few minutes later. Room was very comfortable, beds were especially nice, even the extra bed for our son. The room did feel a tad small with the three of us, but it wasn't too bad. For 2, there is plenty of room. The rooms are equipped with all the usual stuff, nice 42" flat screen TV with good number of english channels, coffee makin facilities, minibar etc. Bathroom was beautiful, it has the oh now so hip glass wall which gives the nice illusion that the actual room is bigger than it really is. Bathtub is fun, it's a round one, I'm not sure if it is the most practical one, but hey, it sure looks cool. Rainforest shower head was lovely and the water pressure was more than adequate. There are only two complaints that we have about the rooms and they both concern bathroom : 1) Those sliding doors, they are awfully noisy if you are not extremely careful with them, if you slide them even a little too hard the banging sound is very, very loud (and will definately be heard in the rooms near you !) 2) There is no place to dry your towels, swimsuits etc if there are more than one people staying in the room. There was three of us, so we really had to use our imagination on how to dry our stuff after a pool visit or after a day on the beach. We ate breakfast twice at the hotel and while it is a bit pricy, it is really good, with wide selection of asian and western food. We had drinks on the Le 188 Restaurant & Lounge on the 41 floor, they make mean martinis, which were not overly expensive by the way, and the views, wow, incredible ! Other facilities, we only used the pool and it is good sized pool, hotel says it is 27 meters and yes, maybe the whole pool is, but the actual swimming area is not, maybe about 20 meters, but still, good size. View from the pool is also great, you could see Kowloon and IFC2 and other Hong Kong Island skyscrapers while laying in hot tub, not bad. But still, I think they should have build the pool one floor higher (it is on the third floor) or then build lower fence, then the view would have been absolutely amazing. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to Causeway Bay and Hong Kong Station and somewhere else :) We only used the transport to Hong Kong Station after our check-out. We happened to be here during typhoon Molave and that caused the only little mishap on our trip. My wife happened to wake up 4am on the night when the typhoon was at it's worst and noticed that our floor was completely wet ! So, we called to the number that the hotel had given before the typhoon (they had delivered a nice "what to do"-guide on the previous day) and after a couple of minutes, staff came to our room to check the situation. Pretty soon they realized that we could not stay in that room, so they arranged as another room. All this, from the phone call to the time we got our new room, took 20 minutes, most ! So, even though the situation was difficult (and as I talked to the guy who escorted us to our new room, he told us that no, we were not the only ones), they handled it very, very well (ok, they could have offered us upgrade etc for the rest of our stay, but hey, let's not get greedy here:)), and that, in my opinnion, tells a lot about the attitude of the staff and the hotel in general. All in all, this hotel has a lot of potential, and if they get everything running (even more) smoothly, they will be in very good position. If you are staying at this hotel during their soft opening (like we did), you have to remember that you are sort of like a guinea pig :) They are testing things, they are learning things, heck, they are even fixing the building all the time. But they try awfully hard and the staff is very, very friendly and eager to help you (like the time we came back to hotel after some serious shopping and we had purchased extra suitcase for us, I really had to almost fight with staff and tell them so many times, no, this is empty, ww just got it, I can carry it :) ) But because you will be sort of test customer, you get to try this great hotel with a bargain price :) But yes, we loved it ! Try it !

Reviews.Title: “I would not walk to or from this hotel to metro/subway station”
Reviews.Author: sunnycreek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and right by the waterfront. Rooms are small. The metro/subway station is less than 10 mins away by foot. There are truckloads of recycled materials to the left (less than 100m) of the hotel. Locals are sorting cardboards, electronics and building materials on the pavement from dawn to sunset. Very dusty and nosiy. If you walk to the station, you will pass by a TIRE shop with a bath tub on the pavement forcing you to walk on the road fearing being hit either by their tools or cars. There are two other hotels in the same area with better access to the metro but no harbour view. City garden hotel and Newton hotel.
